Founded in 2001, we are digital marketing experts who help brands to use digital to upgrade their growth. We are Google’s longest serving European partner with a 20 year long relationship and have worked with them to deliver market-leading strategies for some of the world’s biggest companies. Our work has been recognised through several awards, achieving 11 major award wins in 2020 including “Best Use of Data” and “Best Use of Technology” at the Drum Awards.

About the Analytics and Data Team

We are a full service Analytics team and form part of Incubeta’s Global Operation Hub in Cape Town. We service clients globally, and are experts in Analytics Implementation, CRO, Data Solutions (Analysis, Engineering and a little Data Science). Our strength lies in our collaboration with each other and our drive to be the best in our fields. As the Data Solutions Team Lead, you will lead the Data Solutions pod in the bigger team.


Overview Of Job Description

As a Data Solutions Lead, you are responsible for ensuring that the data team (consisting of Data Analysts and Data Engineers) are producing work of the highest standard and adhering to industry best practices.

Your team should be producing innovative and exciting data based solutions, dashboards and insights reports to solve complex data problems.

The team is expected to be able to present their models, data and insights to clients and internal teams either from a dashboard, Google Sheets or from Google Slides in an understandable and simplified manner to ensure that the work is understood and bought into by all stakeholders.

You are expected to have a relentless curiosity about various business problems and a passion for inventing data-based solutions to those challenges.

You are required to:

  • Analyze data to discover hidden trends; deliver insights and analysis with clear recommendations
  • Build well-managed data solutions, tools, and innovative prototypes to enable self-service frameworks
  • Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Document analytics projects in a manner that ensures specific processes can be replicated and scaled across the organization
  • Collaborate with multiple teams and stakeholders in an agile and dynamic environment
  • Maintain a profitable team with reasonable billable hours.

Place Within Organisation

  • Reports to the Head of Analytics and Data in the Analytics and Data Team in the Global Ops Team.
  • Works with the global ops team, international analytics teams, local and international commercial teams and consultants.


Knowledge And Experience

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

As a Data Solutions Lead, you are required to provide advanced analysis and insights to our clients and internal teams through Looker Studio, BigQuery, Google Cloud Platform and other tools. In order to successfully perform this role, you will need the following hard and soft skills:

Hard Skills

  • Expert SQL
  • Advanced BigQuery
  • Google Cloud Platform certified (Advantageous)
  • Good Python & / R
  • Probability and Statistics
  • Prescriptive, predictive and statistical Modeling advantageous
  • Presentation Skills
  • Provide training to internal and external teams; including but not limited to:
    • Looker Studio
    • Data Literacy
    • Introduction to SQL
    • Introduction to BigQuery
  • Knowledge of Key Metrics and Dimensions for GMP Platforms (DV360, CM360, SA360), Google Ads and Facebook
  • Knowledge of Digital Media Strategy (Advantageous)
  • Understanding of Data Science Principles and Practices
  • Data Science Experience (Model design, build and testing) would be an advantage

Soft Skills

  • Strong management and leadership skills
  • Strong ability to delegate tasks to team members
  • Strong time management skills
  • Ability to mentor, guide and grow junior data analysts
  • Excellent problem solving abilities
  • Ability to think and act independently as well as collaboratively.
  • Relentless enthusiasm and highly reliable.
  • Ownership driven, pro-active to self-learn and make progress.
  • Confidently deal with enquiries around analytics from and establish influential relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.
  • An excellent communicator and be able to present ideas, verbally and in writing (to internal stakeholders and clients where required)
  • Strong technical communicator - able to turn complex technical concepts into simple and easy to understand concepts for both internal teams and clients.
  • Able to deliver difficult feedback as a Manager in a solutions driven way.
  • Exceptional attention to detail and pride in any work produced.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic, pro-learning environment on multiple priorities simultaneously. Strong ability to prioritize and manage own time as well as assisting teams where needed
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Display honesty and integrity at all times
  • Accountable for your actions even when making mistakes
  • Organized and detail oriented
  • Be approachable and open to constructive feedback
  • Display a hunger for knowledge and a willingness to learn for any situation


Tasks And Responsibilities

Your tasks responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Conducting discovery sessions with the client
  • Putting together scopes and costings for new projects
  • Formulating, suggesting, and managing data-driven projects which are geared at furthering our clients' business interests.
  • Delegating tasks to team members in order to successfully complete projects.
  • Monitoring the performance of team members and providing them with practical guidance, as needed.
  • Selecting and employing advanced statistical procedures to drive and obtain actionable insights.
  • Producing and disseminating non-technical close out reports that detail the successes and limitations of each project.
  • Suggesting ways in which insights obtained might be used to inform business and digital marketing strategies.
  • Staying informed about developments in Data and Analytics and adjacent fields to ensure that outputs are always relevant.


Required Certifications

  • At least a bachelor's level degree in business, data science, statistics, computer science, or similar.
  • SQL
  • BigQuery
  • Google Cloud Platform (preferred)
  • Google Marketing Certifications (Analytics, Ads etc)

If you feel you fit the above criteria, please apply with your CV and cover letter.
Please take note that if you do not receive a response within 2 weeks of applying, you should consider your application as unsuccessful.

Designation:
Payroll Account

Category:
Group Finance

Level:

Closing date:
12 Jul 2023

Position Type:
Permanent

Location:
MultiChoice City


Job Description:

The Organisation

The MultiChoice Group is a multinational media and entertainment group headquartered in South Africa, Dubai, and the Netherlands with principal operations in pay television, video entertainment, advertising, and content security. Brands within the Group include DStv, GOtv, SuperSport, M-Net, DStv Media Sales, Showmax and European-based content security leader Irdeto. We’re proud to say we serve 20 million subscribers across more than 50 African markets, with a successful history of identifying and adapting to industry trends, allowing us to continuously deliver the best in entertainment.

By joining our passionate and creative team, you can help us achieve our objectives of expanding our pay-TV and SVOD (Subscription Video On demand) subscriber bases, improving advertising sales, spearheading cutting-edge technology, supporting local content, and providing an exceptional customer experience.

Join Africa’s most loved storyteller!

Position Name: Payroll Accountant

Reports to: Senior Manager Payroll

Division: Finance Shared Services

Department: Payroll


Number of Direct Reports

Key Customers

Business Heads of Finance, Financial Managers Rest of Africa and South Africa Financial Managers, Business Finance Analysts, RTR

Location: Based in South Africa, Johannesburg, Randburg


Purpose of the Position:

Recording Journals, Performing Reconciliation and Producing Reports for all SA Entities and the following African countries

  • Ghana
  • Namibia
  • Uganda
  • Botswana
  • Tanzania
  • Kenya
  • Zambia

Key Performance Objectives

Controls, Governance & Policies

  • Prepare Balance sheet reconciliations for all payroll related control accounts.
  • Investigate reconciling items and resolve the current outstanding items (including but not limited to passing adjusting entries, following up with payroll administrators, investigating non-payroll related entries and tracing to the source)
  • Assist in improvement and development of payroll processes and systems for accounting purposes.
  • Responsible for the development/creation, implementation, and maintenance of system of robust controls, procedures and policies relating to the payroll function.
  • Responsible for monitoring compliance to accounting policies and payroll legislation.
  • Ensure compliance to policies, internal control, and external audit.
  • Support internal audit, ensure that any findings are resolved.
  • Work with cross functional teams in the shared services and business to ensure compliance, accuracy, and efficiency in financial areas.

    Payroll Activities

  • Analysing payroll data and providing meaningful reports to business
  • Prepare and request monthly funding for salary costs and agree to costing reports received from various payroll administrators.
  • Prepare and process cashbook journal.
  • Processing the salaries bank account bank statement into SAP Main bank account and prepare the reconciliation.
  • Extract and balance payroll journal for import into SAP for the Multichoice Group
  • Extract and distribute cost centre reports.
  • Prepare and process leave provisions.
  • Prepare and process bonus provisions.
  • Review and process reallocation journals from business
  • Reconcile and clear the bank subaccounts used for processing bank statements.
  • Prepare Balance Sheet reconciliations on Blackline.
  • Resolve and clear balance sheet reconciliation items every month.
  • Process confidential payments, as per Management request
  • Process bursary payments and maintain debtor’s book.
  • Assist with quarterly audit of the payroll administrators’ payrolls.
  • Assist with the half year and year-end audit.
  • Assisting with payroll cost related queries.
  • Recognizing the salary costs of associate companies on SAP and submitting the invoice to the relevant Finance Managers
  • Performing monthly Payroll Quality Assurance
  • Allocating Payroll deductions to the GL (Income statement, Balance sheet or staff debtor accounts)
  • Performing monthly Payroll variance analysis
  • Performing monthly Payroll analytics
  • Review all third-party payments prepared by the payroll administrators.

    Qualifications

  • B. Com Degree

    Experience / Skills

    Competencies

  • Speed and accuracy with figures
  • Stakeholder management
  • Attention to detail.
  • Proactive and ability to plan.
  • Ability to prioritise to meet multiple deadlines.
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and pressurised situations.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to think and move quickly in a dynamic fast-moving environment.
  • Excellent communication skills- upward, downward, and lateral
  • Problem solving
  • Customer orientated focus
  • Systematic and analytical
  • Minimum 2 years’ relevant experience in a similar role
  • Sound knowledge of Payroll legislation and Taxation rules
  • SAP & SAGE system experience
  • Advanced excel skills.
  • Blackline experience
  • Power BI would be advantageous.

MultiChoice has a COVID-19 mandatory vaccination policy to ensure a productive and healthy workplace. By submitting your application for employment, you warrant to MultiChoice that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and accept that you will be required to submit your vaccination certificate during the recruitment process. In processing your information we will comply with the requirements of the Protection of Personal Information Act.

Our Company:

If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you.

If you have a desire to work in an organisation that is:

  • Passionate about its people
  • Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers
  • Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful
  • Obsessed with our customer's success
  • The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more!
  • Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity
  • Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community

Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi's, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.

Your Role at Impact:

At Impact we have an amazing opportunity to leverage machine learning and AI to drive product innovation.

As a data scientist, you will work on our core and business products to help shape the future of what we build at Impact. You will enjoy working with our rich data set, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real products on a regular basis. Partnering with internal and external stakeholders, you will develop new products/features and solve business problems by preparing, analyzing, and understanding data to prototype products/features, deliver insight, predict emerging trends, and provide recommendations to optimize results.

You should have a background in a quantitative or technical field, experience working with large data sets, experience in data-driven decision making, and data story telling through visualization. You are proficient in big data technologies, Cloud environment, statistical modeling, and machine learning algorithms. You are passionate and diligent about staying abreast of academic research and industry best practices in the constantly evolving digital marketing landscape. You are focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a product.

This position will be based in Cape Town post Covid-19 and welcomes anyone who is interested in relocating.

What You'll Do:

  • Co-lead projects with hands-on analysis and modeling, drawing from multiple analytical methods to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges
  • Design new methodologies, assemble necessary dataset (internal and external), building statistical and machine-learned models with accuracy, and analyzing experiments, applying critical thinking throughout. Build and automate end to end ML framework
  • Communicate and visualize insights to multiple levels of stakeholders with clarity, informing decision-making. Design and create interactive visualization dashboard to facilitate custom analytics, trouble shooting, data storytelling, and evangelization of ML products to non-technical audiences
  • Participate in engagement with internal and external stakeholders to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the biggest impact
  • Develop comprehensive understanding of Impact data structures and metrics, advocating for product changes where needed
  • Contribute to Data Science COE knowledge sharing and documentation. Provide mentorship to junior team members
  • Be a self-starter, motivated by a passion for developing the best possible solutions to problems

What You Have:

  • BA/BS in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Operations Research, Statistics or other quantitative Social Science fields. Advanced degree preferred
  • 3-5 years' experience of tech industry work experience as a data analyst, statistician, or data scientist. Experience in statistical data analysis, such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, and sampling methods
  • Well versed in R, Python, and SQL, and big data query language
  • Experience with big data and cloud platforms to deploy large-scale data science solutions. Working knowledge of distributed computing framework preferred
  • Experience articulating business questions and using mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using available data
  • Experience communicating the results of analyses with product and leadership teams to influence the strategy of the product
  • Understanding of digital marketing and statistical algorithms typically used in marketing analytics a plus

Benefits/Perks:

  • Unlimited PTO policy
  • Take the time off that you need. We are truly committed to a positive work-life balance, recognising that it is important to be happy and fulfilled in both
  • Training & Development
  • Learning the advanced partnership automation products
  • Medical Aid and Provident Fund
  • Group schemes with Discovery & Bonitas for medical aid
  • Group scheme with Momentum for provident fund
  • Stock Options
  • 4-year vesting schedule pending Board approval
  • Internet Allowance
  • Flexible work hours
  • Casual work environment

Impact is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or non-binary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

:

Human Resources

Are you a problem solver, explorer, and knowledge seeker – always asking, “What if?”


If so, then you may be the new team member we’re looking for. Because at SAS, your curiosity matters – whether you’re developing algorithms, creating customer experiences or answering critical questions. Curiosity is our code, and the opportunities here are endless.

PBT Group, leading Data Specialists, is looking for exceptional graduates wanting to embark on a specialist IT career path. Our program will equip you with Business Intelligence (BI) best practices, real-life case studies, intensive training and on-the-job mentoring culminating in your deployment into business.


About PBT

PBT Group is a professional services provider to large national and international clients, and one that is focused on transforming data into a tangible asset. PBT Group provides an end-to-end data services and solutions offering, including Data Strategy, Data Engineering, Data Visualisation, Data Analytics, as well as Application Development.


PBT Group has worked in more than 27 countries around the world and has implemented large-scale data projects throughout Africa, the Middle East, Australia and Europe in the banking, insurance, healthcare, telecommunications and retail sectors.


With a staff complement of more than 890 highly skilled professional consultants, PBT Group has a reputation for delivery according to expectations. Worldwide expertise and local wisdom - that’s what makes us different!


What is Business Intelligence?

  • BI is the process of gathering information in the field of business. It can be described as enhancing data into information and then into knowledge.
  • Businesses realises that in this very competitive, fast-paced and ever-changing business environment, a key competitive quality is how quickly they respond and adapt to change. BI enables businesses to use information gathered to quickly and constantly respond to changes.
  • Further reading: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Business_intelligence.

Graduate Program Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or final year student in Information Systems or Computer Science.
  • Academic record: a sustained average of 65% and above (your final mark will determine your consideration for the intake into the program).
  • Strong knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle.
  • Strong mathematical and statistical skills.
  • Firm understanding of database functionality.
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Strong programming skills.
  • The ability to plan, research, analyse and interpret data.
  • Good communication and language skills.
  • Strong leadership qualities.
  • Applicants must be under the age of 28.

Program Duration

  • The program spans over 12 months, with the option to extend for a further period thereafter.
  • The first 6 months focuses on theoretical training, followed by 6 months of on-the-job training.

Apply Now

If you are interested and meet the above requirements, please send the following documents to graduates@pbtgroup.co.za.

  • CV
  • ID
  • Matric Certificate
  • Academic Transcripts (Results) for Tertiary Education
  • Degree Certificate if you have finished

Please note that only South African residents with a valid ID document will be considered. If the above does not accompany your application, we will not be able to consider you for our Graduate Program.

Company Description


About Deloitte

Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax and related services. Our global network of member firms and related entities in more than 150 countries and territories (collectively, the “Deloitte organization”) serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Learn how Deloitte’s approximately 312,000 people make an impact that matters at www.deloitte.com.

About the Cloud Practice

Deloitte is an industry leader in our clients Digital transformations. We recognize that the backbone enabling our clients highest aspirations for analytics and cognitive solutions is next-gen Cloud infrastructure. From cloud consulting, to implementation, and ongoing managed services we offer a full scope of Cloud services and solutions. We want talent who is ready to innovate cloud services and empower our clients to leap frog forward in their technical capabilities. Building your career at Deloitte offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge Cloud technologies to deliver next-Gen Cloud solutions. We embrace the tech pioneer mindset and always enable our talent to keep their skills evolving at the speed at which the technology marketplace is evolving.


Job Description


As a Data Migration Lead, you'll be responsible for data migration and analysis. You will work closely with the client to identify their requirements and develop new data models that can efficiently handle the volumes of data being migrated.

  • Work with the customer, users, technical architect, and application designers to define the data migration requirements and structure for the application.
  • Lead the data migration plan, analysis, design, and build effort.
  • Work with the technical architects and application designers to understand the data conversion requirements fully and to design the conversion procedures and applications.
  • Review the database deliverables throughout development to ensure quality and traceability to requirements and adherence to all quality management plans and standards.
  • Ensure that the application developers and data migration developers responsible for data migration thoroughly understand the requirements and designs.
  • Work with other architects to ensure that all components work together to meet objectives and performance goals as defined in the requirements. Identify and communicate any cross-area or cross-release issues that may affect other areas of the project.
  • Support the development and test teams with the creation of test data. Ensure test data conforms to data security requirements.
  • Ensure security in reporting and data warehousing.
  • Take ownership of design, development and testing of all data extract, transform and load (ETL) activities
  • Working with the project team to ensure that all ongoing data transformation, de-duplication, extraction and load functions once ready for production deployment are documented in detailed data lineage models
  • Work with data owners to verify and obtain approval that any transformed data retains its quality/accuracy
  • Own the reject and exception handling processes associated with data
  • Develop best practice, processes, and standards for effectively carrying out data migration activities.
  • Prepare data migration plans including migration risk, milestones, quality and business sign-off details.
  • Manage assigned risks and monitor potential impacts as part of the data migration plan.

Qualifications


Technical Experience required:

  • Strong technical database and scripting skills. Azure, SQL
  • 5+ years of experience working with large scale, data processing systems in a Data/Data Warehouse environment.
  • Good understanding of Source to Target mapping between CRM Dynamics and Salesforce
  • Understanding of Salesforce CRM Data Model
  • Understanding of CRM Dynamics data structurers

Skills:

  • Ability to develop or revise the data migration approach as new data requirements arise
  • Ability to develop and manage all aspects of the data migration effort, including the plans, interdependencies, schedule, tools, and required personnel.
  • Ability to convert data and related techniques to acquire data needed to support testing, training, and other application development activities

Additional Information


At Deloitte, we want everyone to feel they can be themselves and to thrive at work—in every country, in everything we do, every day. We aim to create a workplace where everyone is treated fairly and with respect, including reasonable accommodation for persons with disabilities. We seek to create and leverage our diverse workforce to build an inclusive environment across the African continent.

display_title: Business Data Operations Analyst Market Research & Insights EMEA
job_description:
CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER. It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.

The Team

We are about insights, action and opportunities - not just endless data. We have been on a mission to move away from outdated perceptions of Insight functions as data and info providers to being the provocateurs, storytellers and opportunity seekers stirring the business into action across the region. Core to this is driving a Culture of Curiosity within broader Mattel so that everyone becomes agents for change, but crucially, ensuring our data systems run smoothly.


The Opportunity

With ever growing datasets and sources, Mattel has been focused on optimizing the processing of our insights and analytics data. This role will own the relationship with key data partners and be the key interface point between them and Mattel to ensure that the capture, processing, management and storage of our data is optimal. You will be responsible for end to end management, dealing with multiple internal departments to unblock issues and correct errors found through third party data input. Developing and implementing pan EMEA data rules and processes that enable consistent behaviours for all data across the region.

For our Mattel office in Johannesburg, South Africa, we are looking for a outsourced temporary (12 months) working fulltime and hybrid model;

What Your Impact Will Be:

  • Work with key external data providers and the broader insight and finance teams to manage data quality, processes and ensure a smooth running data operation.
  • Take Mattel EMEA data processes to the next level and constantly strive for improvements
  • Remove manual tasks and aid the implementation of enhanced systems with third party suppliers.


What We’re Looking For:

Skills

  • Someone that is curious about the world around them, and strive to optimize processes
  • Strong analytical understanding and ability, comfortable with large datasets, and monitoring repetitive tasks
  • Detail, process and operations focused
  • Collaborative and inclusive team player with the ability to network with a broad range of stakeholders.
  • Ability to efficiently handle multiple projects in a fast-paced regional environment, adapt to shifting priorities and be able to communicate complex issues in a clear manner
  • Willingness to learn and develop within the role

Experience

  • 2+ years working with large datasets, data processing and quality controls.
  • Degree (or equivalent) in a business related area, e.g, Business, Marketing, Statistics.
  • Strong English communication is crucial.


What It’s Like to Work Here

We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors:

  • We collaborate: Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower.
  • We innovate: At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking.
  • We execute: We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results.

Who We Are

Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest catalogs of children’s and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world’s leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential.

Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers.

Mattel is an Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.

display_title: Senior Technical Advisor – Data and Analytics Seconded to Gauteng Department of Health
job_description:
Anova is an NGO that empowers people and changes lives. Good health and quality of life is what motivates us to provide healthcare solutions and support for those who need it most.

The incumbent will provide the Gauteng Department of Health HIV/AIDS and STI Cluster with data analytics support and build capacity for data analytics/use in the Department of Health. The Senior Technical Advisor will foster evidence-informed decision-making across the HIV/AIDS and STI programmes, design, develop, manage, and operationalize M&E systems and plans that are aligned to program strategy to allow for quality reporting and dissemination.

He or she will monitor the project’s progress towards its goals and contribute to program strategy to ensure that activities and assignments are carried out as planned and the program objectives are being achieved. The Senior Technical Advisor will also provide technical assistance on the design, development, and implementation of the Operation Phuthuma Nerve Centre Approach.

Key duties and responsibilities:

Data analysis for strategic planning and to inform operations.

  • Conduct analyses to inform programme operations and identify gaps in programme implementation for the Gauteng Provincial HIV/AIDS and STI Cluster.
  • Give input into content and design of routine data analyses and reporting dashboards.
  • Maintenance of Operation Phuthuma Data and Information flow.
  • Participation in strategic planning forums and Technical Working Groups to support key HIV/AIDS and STI Program.
  • Lead 95-95-95 District Graduation process.
  • Support alignment of targets across stakeholders and consistent target-setting methodology
  • Support National HIV/AIDS and STI Nerve Centre with data analytics.

Stakeholder engagement

  • Engage with key stakeholders at National, Provincial and District level (where necessary) to understand and prioritise data use needs and gaps.
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to develop project plans to address the identified gaps.
  • Build relationships and act as a liaison between Operation Phuthuma and critical M&E stakeholders.

Capacity building

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to develop and implement a strategy to strengthen data analytics and use.
  • Capacity building of Department of Health and Operation Phuthuma staff on data analysis and use.

Dissemination

  • Produce and disseminate reports documenting programme results, activities, and lessons.
  • Academic dissemination e.g., publications and conferences
  • Other dissemination e.g., briefs and infographics; writing for lay audiences/ website/ media.

Data Quality Improvement and Reporting

  • Work closely with the Provincial team to drive the utilisation of Data for Improvement and Reporting in a meaningful way.

Any other tasks as agreed with line manager.

Minimum qualifications and experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in public health or related field.
  • At least 5 years’ experience in HIV/ TB or related field.
  • Ability to summarise, interpret and visualise complex data.
  • Experience working in the South African public health services.
  • Scientific report writing and presentation skills.
  • Ability to collaborate with diverse groups of people.
  • Understanding of Operation Phuthuma at all levels.
  • Understanding of DOH indicators and M&E systems.

Closing date: 14 April 2023

In accordance with our Employment Equity goals and plan, preference will be given to suitable applicants from designated groups as defined in the Employment Equity Act 55 of 1998 and subsequent amendments thereto.

Preference will be given to persons with disabilities.

Anova Health Institute is a provider of essential health services and therefore has a mandatory vaccination policy. Should your application be successful, you will be required to submit your proof of vaccination before commencing employment in the role.

Applicants who have not been contacted within 4 weeks of submitting their application should assume that they have not been successful.

Our Company:

If you are looking to join a team where your opinion is valued, your contributions are noticed, and enjoy working with fun and talented people from all over the world then this is the place for you.

If you have a desire to work in an organisation that is:

  • Passionate about its people
  • Focused on delivering the very best tech to our customers
  • Offering the flexibility to work how and where you are most successful
  • Obsessed with our customer's success
  • The leading SaaS platform to automate partnerships - affiliate, influencer, technology partners, and more!
  • Entrepreneurial in spirit with a culture that rewards collaboration and curiosity
  • Obsessed with making a difference in business and to the wider community

Impact is the global leader in Partnership Automation, working with innovative brands like Ticketmaster, Levi's, Microsoft, Airbnb, and Uber to help them manage their online affiliate, influencer, brand to brand, and content partnerships. The Impact Partnership Cloud covers the full life partnership lifecycle including onboarding, tracking ads and paying partners, recruiting for new partners, data and marketing intelligence, and protection from fraud. Founded in 2008, Impact has grown to over 500 employees and ten offices across Europe, the United States, Africa, and Asia so there is plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement.

Your Role at Impact:

At impact.com, we are on a mission to educate publishers, advertisers, and agencies on how to mutually benefit from partnership opportunities. We enable industry professionals to excel in their roles through our Partnerships Experience Academy (PXA).

As an intern for PXA, you will experience a variety of different job roles and responsibilities as you acclimate to the PXA team and impact.com. You will write and edit content, create and edit learning content videos, manage data entry projects, and much more as needed.

This paid internship is 3 months with the potential option to extend at the end of the period. Please note that this is a hybrid role and the successful candidate will be required to be in office a minimum of two days a week.

What You'll Do:

  • Work within our LMS (Learning Management System), Intellum, and our internal customer information tool, Operator
  • Support PXA team members in meeting required data and data analysis requirements (Google Sheets experience advantageous)
  • Write and edit course copy, emails newsletters, and other related material, adhering to the voice and Corporate Identity (CI) of PXA.
  • Use Adobe Premiere Pro and additional tools within the Adobe suite to edit product and industry training videos, adhering to the Corporate Identity (CI) of PXA.
  • Create engaging storyboards, and cut voiceovers and videos in collaboration with our video editors and multimedia designers.
  • Use iorad.io to prepare impact.com product training simulations.
  • Other tasks as needed.

What You Have:

  • Must demonstrate basic writing skills.
  • Must be action-oriented and customer-focused.
  • Must demonstrate the ability to think creatively.
  • Must demonstrate a keen eye for detail and be analytical.
  • Excellent organizational skills, using tools like Asana, Jira and Google Calendar.
  • Ability to communicate professionally via email, Slack and Zoom.
  • Ability to work independently, and have a high degree of accountability and accuracy of work.
  • 0 - 1 year work experience.
  • Must have reviewed pxa.impact.com.
  • Preferred:
    • Qualification in Marketing, Social Sciences, or other relevant creative background. (Data Analytics major advantageous)
    • Documented professional writing experience.
    • SEO or marketing experience.
    • Video editing experience.
    • PXA Affiliate & Partnerships Industry Fundamentals Certification

Benefits/Perks for full time permanent employees:

  • Flexible work hours
  • Unlimited PTO policy

Data Analyst

We are growing our Data Analytics team and looking for individuals who will engage with internal stakeholders to uncover the business problems they face as well as identify and implement solutions. The preferred candidate for this role is an individual who is logical, analytical and objective and has good reasoning skills. They should be a perfectionist by nature as their work needs to be delivered accurately. A proven self-starter with high standards of excellence and an innovative mind is required.

Main responsibilities:
  • Engaging with stakeholders within the business to uncover what business problems they face:
    • This involves understanding the relevant process flows or workings of specific functions within the company.
    • Understanding how each team fits into the broader company picture.
  • Working closely with department managers to identify the “Value-Add” that Data Analytics can bring to move them forward towards their goals.
  • Identifying solutions to the problems that creates that value for the business user.
  • Implementing solutions that create value for the business user through mediums such as:
    • Visual Dashboards;
    • Forecasting/predictive models;
    • Statistical modelling;
    • Improvement of processes.
  • Improving the overall data pipelines:
    • Developing data structures to enable automated data quality testing and improved data governance as well as reusability.
  • Adopting a DataOps principles-based approach to all work.
  • Collaborating with team members on projects.
  • Continuous researching and developing of personal technical, business and mathematical skills.

Minimum requirements:
  • Completed Tertiary Qualification in Engineering or Bachelor of Science Degree is essential with strong preference for an Honours Degree qualification.
  • Analytical experience of solving business problems through analytical approaches (1 -5 years).
  • Experience with SQL is a must have.
  • Experience with Excel + Power BI (or other visualisation tools) + Python is an advantage.
  • Good stakeholder communication skills.
  • Able to apply mathematical concepts to business problems.
  • Great problem solving skills.
  • Experience in DataOps type environments or projects is advantageous.

display_title: Operational Risk Manager - Card Issuing and Payments
job_description:
Bring your possibility to life! Define your career with us
With over 100 years of rich history and strongly positioned as a local bank with regional and international expertise, a career with our family offers the opportunity to be part of this exciting growth journey, to reset our future and shape our destiny as a proudly African group.
Job Summary
The successful candidate will support the second line of defence (Risk) Manager for Operational and Resilience Risk in the exciting Consumer Issuing (Credit Card), Payment (Regulatory & Schemes) and Woolworths Financial Services (WFS) Business area in Everyday Banking (EB).
Provide specialist advice and support in the embedment of operational risk management and associated processes, methods, and techniques to deliver on approved operational plans effectively and efficiently across Everyday Banking and assist the Operational & Resilience Risk Manager (2LoD) in the development and maintenance of the Absa Operational and Resilience Risk Management Framework (ORRMF) by delivering integrated qualitative and quantitative analytics. The scope of the role covers all risk management and measurement methods which apply to the relevant Operational Risk approach.
.
Job Description
Accountability: Risk Management
Understand and apply the relevant risk and governance procedures to activities undertaken. Ensure that the appropriate risk management processes, control environment requirements and risk management frameworks that impact the area are documented, understood, and captured on ORMS (as applicable).
Analyse implemented Enterprise Risk and Operational Risk Management Framework effectiveness.
  • Conduct an ongoing review of the performance of the Operational & Resilience Risk Management Framework. This requires providing check and challenge to ensure all risks have been considered and appropriately addressed within the specific business area being supported.
  • Perform ongoing data quality checks and validations on all Operational Risk Management Framework components, extracting data from ORMS, including performing independent validation checks on the data captured on ORMS.
  • Display professional behaviour whilst ensuring the appropriate check and challenge with the respective Business area the Operational & Resilience Risk Manager supports, raising and discussing contentious observations with the Operational & Resilience Risk Manager and providing evidence to support all issues identified.
  • Support the Operational & Resilience Risk Manager with ongoing analysis, review and oversight of Risk and Control Self-Assessments, Risk Event Management, Key Indicators, Key Risk Scenarios and Lessons Learnt but not just limited to the above elements- Information captured on ORMS, CPA, MCA, RCA and LL, Issues, Actions, dispensations and Risk event reconciliation,
  • Oversee and perform (where appropriate) deep dive- and lessons learnt exercises for material risks, including the review, challenge and tracking/escalation of findings.
  • Perform Operational & Resilience Risk policy and standard conformance testing.
  • Monitor and track the effectiveness of the control environment (MCA, CPA, RCSA, Risk profile etc.) and take action to mitigate further operational risk where required within the mandate of the supported BU’s risk profile.
  • Use the ORRMF to facilitate the identification of all possible risks and ensure corrective controls (aligned to this framework) are implemented by the relevant business area risk managers to mitigate these risks.
Accountability: Support the Operational Risk Manager: Policy & Framework
  • In providing support on automation of the ERMF & ORRMF in the approved operational risk management system and in resolving issues.
  • In driving the implementation and use of the ERMF & ORRMF in the business.
  • Report on results analysis to the Operational & Resilience Risk Manager.
  • Support the development of operational risk techniques for the business area supported by the respective Operational & Resilience Risk Manager.
Accountability: Data management
  • Prepare monthly data extracts per framework component to support the Operational Risk manager (to be obtained from the approved operational risk management system [ORMS]).
  • Apply appropriate data quality checks on this data and prepare reports on an exception basis on data quality issues.
  • Ensure timely capturing of risk management issues and risks on the ORMS by the relevant 1LOD business partner(s).
  • Review, check and challenge data captured on ORMS (RCSA, CPA, MCA, Risk events, Risk event reconciliation, RCA and LL, Issues, Action, dispensations etc.).
  • Support the Operational & Resilience Risk Manager: Reporting, with periodic reporting requirements (monthly, quarterly and annual).
Relationship Management
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key 1LoD business risk partners.
  • Engage closely with stakeholders, identify the BU requirements, and encourage open discussion and interaction with businesses on the risks associated with their environment.
Education
  • Bachelor`s Degrees and/or Advanced Diplomas or a Diploma: Business, Commerce and Management Studies (Required), Risk Management (preferable).
Work Experience & Knowledge
  • Experience in a similar environment at junior management level.
  • Knowledge & work experience in the Payment (Regulatory & Schemes) and Consumer Card Issuing environment (required).
  • Knowledge & experience in Operational & Resilience Risk environment (preferable).
Education
Bachelor`s Degrees and Advanced Diplomas: Business, Commerce and Management Studies (Required)

Join Our Tribe!

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive results and enhance customer interactions?

Are you skilled in managing dialler systems and optimising data & dialler performance?

If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Join our dynamic and fast-paced team as a Data and Dialler Professional in the CX Interglobal Group of companies, where you will play a vital role in maximising our operational efficiency and delivering exceptional customer experiences.


Position Overview:

As a Data and Dialler Professional, you will be responsible for managing our dialler system and utilising data to optimise our outbound communication strategies. You will work closely with our operations, sales, and customer service teams to ensure effective dialler performance, enhance productivity, and drive revenue growth. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on our organisation's success.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage and maintain the dialler system, including configuration, campaign setup, and ongoing performance monitoring.
  • Utilise data analytics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in dialler performance.
  • Develop and implement strategies to optimise dialler performance, including dialling strategies, pacing, and list management.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and design effective dialler campaigns that align with our goals.
  • Conduct regular data analysis to measure and evaluate the effectiveness of dialler campaigns, making data-driven recommendations for improvement.
  • Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reports on dialler performance to stakeholders.
  • Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements related to dialler management and data usage.
  • Continuously seek opportunities to enhance dialler efficiency, increase contact rates, and improve overall customer experience.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Proven experience in dialler system management and optimisation, preferably within an internationl BPO/GBS environment.
  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis and interpretation.
  • Knowledge of data management practices, data privacy regulations, and industry best practices.
  • Familiarity with CRM systems, telephony software, and contact centre operations.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think strategically.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.

Join our team and unlock your potential as a Data and Dialler Professional! Be part of a supportive and innovative work environment where your ideas and expertise are valued. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for professional growth and development.


To apply, hit the link below and start the journey! We look forward to reviewing your application and exploring the possibilities together!

To trade FX Futures and Forwards the assigned single product within the defined mandate to maximise trading book profit while adhering to defined risk levels, codes of conduct and statutory regulations.

Data Insights - Leverage and assess data, insights and analytics to inform better price making against the market and desk value

Market Knowledge & Analytics - Monitor, collect and analyse historic, current and expected market developments, trends, and performance to proactively translate these into appropriate trading positions (discretionary) and price making activity.

Stakeholder relationships - Liaise with authorised counterparties, brokers, financial institutions and peers to ensure the agreed processes and functions are performed to allow consistent daily performance.

Reporting to the Editor-in-Chief, the Lifestyle Editor is accountable for overseeing all editing, writing, and publishing on News24's lifestyle section. S/He will manage the lifestyle team, including section editors from a variety of lifestyle topics. Creating and executing special lifestyle projects and events to maintain News24 Life as a premium lifestyle news destination is critical. The successful candidate will be based at our Cape Town or Johannesburg (Randburg) offices.


Key responsibilities:

(The primary tasks, functions and deliverables of the role)

  • Maintain the strong editorial voice and tone of News24 Life, which reflects the aspirations and interests of the target audience;
  • Manage, plan, and build on the News24 Life content strategy and vision as a premium and trusted news destination;
  • Ensure all lifestyle content (including Arts & Entertainment, Books, Relationships, Wellness, Travel, Food, Wine, and Motoring) drive traffic to the site and contribute to News24's subscription model;
  • Align editorial goals with company strategic direction;
  • Have a sound ethical approach to content creation and publication;
  • Leverage technology and multimedia capabilities to create, manage, and publish high-quality video content and podcasts;
  • Create and implement a daily, weekly and monthly editorial calendar to increase traffic to the site and drive subscriptions;
  • Source and create features, ensuring all copy is delivered within stipulated deadlines and to standard, rejecting copy that is not on brief or standard;
  • Manage, coordinate and drive daily uploading of relevant, fresh, accurate, premium lifestyle content, ensuring that content is loaded correctly with the correct meta tagging and meta descriptions;
  • In conjunction with the publisher, drive initiatives, special projects, events, and other opportunities to grow the News24 Life brand;
  • Manage employee performance and daily duties, including setting expectations, providing clear feedback and coaching for improvement;
  • Manage all administration related to freelance contracts and invoicing;
  • Ensure that the site is meeting its targets in terms of unique users, page impressions, revenue and subscription targets;
  • Analyse site traffic and constantly look to improve and grow traffic through modifying editorial coverage, improving packaging etc;
  • Provide monthly reports and analysis on News24 Life's performance using various data sources;
  • Oversee and grow social networking and other content distribution channels;
  • Create, manage, and deliver regular newsletters and mailers on various topics;
  • Manage relationships with the industry, partners and sister publications;
  • Stay abreast of current industry standards and techniques, changing internet technology, journalism trends and the competition, to ensure effective content that achieves the publication's goals;
  • In conjunction with the publisher, drive innovative growth opportunities and constantly seek opportunities to build and extend the brand's online presence.
  • Must have an established network of contacts in the South African arts and entertainment industry to ensure knowledge of news, launches and events


Qualifications:

  • Tertiary qualification in journalism, languages or media studies


Experience:

  • 5-7 years editorial experience and in online editing
  • Prior experience working with Google Analytics and other data tools
  • Proven experience in leading a team
  • Knowledge of or experience with a variety of lifestyle topics
  • Proven experience in breaking stories and generating exclusives


Skills and competencies:

  • Interest in news and other trending topics;
  • Be able to switch between fast news and in-depth features;
  • Be pressure resilient;
  • Be result orientated;
  • Creativity and innovative thinking
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Experience in video and audio;
  • Good interpersonal skills;
  • Excellent attention to detail;
  • Excellent journalistic skills;
  • Problem-solving ability is important;
  • Have great planning, organising, and administration skills;
  • Understand data analysis for reports;
  • Have sound judgment and ethics.

JOB DESCRIPTION

To manage and deliver the Solutions Structuring capability in the effective origination, structuring and execution of tailored Structured Trade Finance solutions for a portfolio of top tier clients across the Africa region and internationally across all sectors that optimally solves for the client's unique needs, achieves revenue targets and promotes the Corporate and Investment Bank (CIB) brand as the "go-to" bank for Trade Finance Solutions.

Essential Functions.

Actively engage with clients and foster relationships partnering with relevant stakeholders to uncover opportunities to meet unique client needs, optimize client capital and balance sheet structures and manage CIBs balance sheet exposure.

Actively monitor portfolio transactions in collaboration with relevant internal stakeholders to enable early identification of any issues (to the extent that CIB is appointed as agent) and ensure optimal performance of portfolio.

Define and drive implementation of the Solutions Structuring Group’s (SSG) strategic objectives for assigned portfolio partnering with relevant stakeholders to optimize client shareholder returns, grow TPS Trade Finance revenue and protect and grow market share.

Keep abreast of new or amended applicable legislation, regulations and standards and interrogate the risk environment and best practices to understand their impact on the Trade Finance Structured Solutioning portfolio in collaboration with relevant risk and compliance partners to continuously improve controls, reporting, compliance and ensure policies, procedures, documentation and controls are aligned to effectively mitigate risk and optimize clean audit reports.

Lead solution negotiations, oversee coordination of internal and external stakeholder requirements, review and approve contracting requirements and obligations, transaction and commercial terms and closing processes partnering with internal and external stakeholders to drive the realization of commercial targets, maximize shareholder returns and growth of revenue and balance sheet.

Oversee and drive the execution of deals within assigned portfolio and drive engagements and processes with internal and external stakeholders to ensure solution completeness, compliance, quality and exceptional client experience.

Participate in relevant market forums and establish ties with industry bodies and associations linked to Trade Finance and structured solutioning to keep market and sector knowledge relevant and, where appropriate, influence the direction of the industry and its regulatory bodies.

Proactively develop, maintain and expand a network of relevant internal stakeholders to promote sufficient balance sheet, capital and risk appetite for Structured Trade Finance solutions and create a pipeline for new business.

Regularly identify, evaluate and map risks and associated controls within area of responsibility in collaboration with relevant risk partners to identify gaps, establish or adjust controls where necessary (or formally accept the risk /appetite), to minimize risk and losses to the Trade Division.

Review outputs of management information and interrogate performance within portfolio to facilitate adjustment of plans and tactics where necessary and ultimately achieve SSG strategies.

Use specialist knowledge and expertise of Trade Finance and financial instruments across multi-geographies to structure and price solutions tailored to the specific needs of clients within the portfolio that optimally solves for the client’s unique needs, complies with all relevant regulations and achieves SSG revenue targets.

Utilise analytics and modelling tools to provide dashboards (visual depiction of data) to share with relevant business and governance forums to illustrate trends, provide insights, identify opportunities and inform decision-making.

QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Qualifications
Type of Qualification: First Degree
Field of Study: Business Commerce

Experience Required
Product Management
Transaction Banking
3-4 years
Interpreting, applying and complying with relevant regulatory frameworks across multiple geographical jurisdictions.

5-7 years
7-10 years in an investment banking trade finance environment. Relevant geographical experience in the Africa Region. Ideally experience working across multiple geographic locations in a global organisation. Client management experience with financial institutions and corporate clients.

5-7 years
Managing a portfolio of client solutions to ensure risk and exposure is effectively managed.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Behavioral Competencies:
Challenging Ideas
Convincing People
Developing Strategies
Empowering Individuals
Generating Ideas
Interacting with People
Making Decisions
Providing Insights
Pursuing Goals
Seizing Opportunities
Showing Composure
Team Working

Technical Competencies:
Deal Appraisal
Deal Negotiation
Financial Analysis
Innovation Management
International Market Knowledge
Risk Management
Structuring
Trade opportunity creation

Please note: All our recruitment processes comply with the applicable local laws and regulations. We will never ask for money or any from of payment as part of our recruitment process. If you experience this, please contact our Fraud line on +27 800222050 or TransactionFraudOpsSA@standardbank.co.za

Closing Date
2023/07/19

Reference Number
SHO230705-3

Job Title
Functional Analyst II

Job Type
Permanent

Location - Country
South Africa

Location - Province
Western Cape

Location - Town or City
Brackenfell, Cape Town

Purpose of the Job

  • To evaluate business requirement specifications, transform the essential components into an abstract and algorithmic business models, and as such, identify the use cases to transform into logical and technical views through configuration of the SAP system.

  • To ensure that efficient and cost-effective business solutions and processes are in place to address business needs/requirements.

  • The role facilitates effective and competitive business processes by eliciting, analysing, validating and documenting business organisational and/or operational requirements.

  • This role plays an instrumental role in the delivery teams to ensure that solutions are delivered according to the business requirements.

  • This role works closely with a cross-functional team and supports the system designers with co-creating sustainable new solutions.

  • Specialised knowledge of systems analysis, and the creation and testing of low to medium complex applications, will be a key success factor in providing relevant technical solutions and practical configuration execution.



Job Advert Details

Job Category
IT

Job Objectives

Identify use cases and transform them into logical and technical views, architectural diagrams and functional specifications.


Perform routine gap analysis to determine and understand the functional business requirements and changes as defined by the Business Analysts, Product Owners and other stakeholders. Identify problem areas, measure various areas of performance, propose changes and develop process improvement initiatives.


Perform systems integration of medium to high complexity, and provide support to the systems designer in the identification of data conversion and reporting requirements.


Work collaboratively within and across functions, building and maintain a trust relationship with business and IT stakeholders by delivering what was promised and providing technical and functional knowledge and support to the team as well as system users.


Estimate, schedule, prioritise and deliver on business-critical projects. This includes accurate and justifiable effort estimations for completion of work, identifying business and functional dependencies to effectively prioritise and schedule delivery of assigned work packages and providing accurate and concise feedback to team leads, highlighting task status, issues and risks.


Analyse test requirements and test scenarios


Facilitate and execute QA testing/user acceptance and go-live support activities. Maintain and enhance manual and automated test case repository.


Complete deliverables throughout the system lifecycle for compliance according to agreed plan, supporting the delivery of projects in assigned area, while consistently reviewing and analysing accuracy and quality of own deliverables.


Maintains clear communication channels with project team on work status. Raises issues with manager as identified in area of focus that may affect the quality of delivery or timelines of the project.


Continuously support the business environment, through maintaining an understanding of initiatives and objectives, its various line portfolios, and the current trends and developments in the technology field.


Work within the framework Agile methodologies and/or other agreed cross-functional team ways of working.



Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or Diploma in Information Systems, Computer Science or in a related field - (essential) OR Demonstrable knowledge and practical ability - (essential)


Experience

  • +4 years' experience with demonstrable knowledge and experience in system analysis, functional analytics, integration, configuration, testing, design, and architecture – (essential).

  • Experience in a retail environment - (essential).

  • Customised system integrations experience with eCommerce projects – (essential).

  • Experience working on projects in Agile and DevOps – (essential).

  • Experience in a retail environment – (highly desired).


Knowledge and Skills

  • Understanding and configuration ability of SAP SD, Pricing (MM\SD Retail), billing and order management functionality with Retail Pricing functions - (essential)

  • Understanding and configuration ability of SAP Promotions and Bonus Buy functionality - (essential)

  • Understanding of cloud technology and solutions (preferably AWS) – (essential).

  • Strong proficiency in MS Office 365 specifically Excel and Projects – (essential).

  • Agile/Scrum toolset (preferably Atlassian) – (desired).


  • To ensure that efficient and cost-effective business solutions and processes are in place to address business needs/requirements.
  • The role facilitates effective and competitive business processes by eliciting, analysing, validating and documenting business organisational and/or operational requirements.
  • This role plays an instrumental role in the delivery teams to ensure that solutions are delivered according to the business requirements.
  • This role works closely with a cross-functional team and supports the system designers with co-creating sustainable new solutions.
  • Specialised knowledge of systems analysis, and the creation and testing of low to medium complex applications, will be a key success factor in providing relevant technical solutions and practical configuration execution.
