display_title: GRADUATE – IBM TM1 PLANNING ANALYTICS DEVELOPER
job_description:
About MCI

MCI is a dynamic Business Information Systems Consulting firm and an equal opportunity employer. Our clients operate in a range of industries including banking, financial services, manufacturing, fast moving consumer goods and recruitment, throughout Africa and the Middle East. Our service offering includes project management, software implementation, product development across various platforms, including e-commerce solutions.

We strive to be the best at what we do, and to achieve this we need people on our team who have commitment, drive, and a positive attitude that helps deliver winning results.

Role

MCI's Business Performance Management division is currently looking for graduates that are passionate about numbers and data specifically relating to financial models.

The position entails the development, implementation and support of models using the IBM Planning Analytics (TM1) software suite.

Activities will include:

  • Designing and building multidimensional OLAP cubes;
  • Development of business rules using the native TM1 rules engine;
  • Creation of ETL processes to import and extract data from various sources;
  • Develop user interfaces for capturing and reviewing data;
  • Design and deploy reports including data tables, graphs and others offering analytical insights;
  • Communicate and feedback to clients on an ongoing basis.

  • A tertiary qualification, preferably with a strong focus on Information Technology/Computer Science. (Applications of candidates completing studies this year will be considered);
  • Logical thinker with good programming ability;
  • Good grasp of basic computing principles;
  • The fundamentals of financial and management accounting;

The successful applicant will work with clients in the financial services industry and may be required to pass credit, criminal or other background checks. Applicants must be eligible to work in the Republic of South Africa.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • A minimum 3-year tertiary qualification from an accredited university, either in Commerce or Computer Sciences or Industrial Engineering;
  • A minimum of matric-level accounting (tertiary accounting preferred)

MCI Consultants are people who are:

  • Ambitious team players, but can work independently;
  • Courageous and passionate;
  • Able to take on challenges with a sense of urgency;
  • Focused, with a strong desire for self-improvement;
  • Dynamic and progressive in their thinking;
  • Ethical and responsible;
  • Professional, trustworthy and keen.
  • Service delivery focused.

Company Description
-Come join us as Instrumentation Mechanician and be responsible for providing dedicated technical and operational systems support to the process division at PMR.

By looking after our assets, you’ll become an asset too

Anglo American has a portfolio of world-class mining operations. We mine, process, move and market the essential ingredients that enable a cleaner, more connected world and that meet fast growing consumer-driven demands for products from smartphones to electric cars. Our basic materials build homes, offices, railways and airports, and our diamonds fulfil people's dreams.

Platinum

Our Platinum business mines, processes and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium and osmium. We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialised applications that improve lives across the world, from vehicle fuel cells to jewellery; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining.


Job Description
-As an Instrumentation Mechanician your role will be to ensure that all systems are maintained and optimised to ensure that the capacity to the production process is maximised.

Below are some key responsibilities:

  • Identify areas to be maintained and optimised
  • Disseminate instrumentation best practice
  • System trouble shooting and hardware problems resolution
  • Support on existing instrumentation
  • Calibration and maintenance of all equipment within the control solution
  • Adherence to the Anglo Platinum change procedures and standards

This role is in the Engineering department at a C2 level reporting to the Front Line Manager.


  • Qualifications
    -Matric or NQF level 3 equivalent
  • Trade Certificate in Instrument Mechanician - Anglo American recognised
  • Valid Driver's licence

Experience, Knowledge and Skills:

  • Minimum 2 years post trade experience in maintenance and projects
  • Plant experience will be advantageous.
  • Basic understanding of hydraulics and pneumatics, PLC (Programmable Logic Control) system and electrics.
  • Must be able to work standby shifts and overtime
  • English literate and good decision-making skills
  • Basic Computer Skills

Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join Anglo American you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, but more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We are a large, successful multinational company – and we are still growing all the time.

Who we are

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

Background checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Closing Date: 07th July 2023

Role Purpose:

To lead and direct the data and analytics function for the company to ensure that we extract maximum business value from our data assets.


Qualifications:

Essential:

  • Tertiary Degree in mathematics / statistics / information technology or related discipline

Preferred:

  • Honors Degree in Data Science/Computer Science/Information Systems / Statistics/Applied
    Mathematics /Business Administration / Economics

Knowledge:

  • Strong data analysis skills
  • Advanced analytical techniques and tools
  • Data lifecycle management
  • Sound understanding of Big Data Analytics platforms and tools.

Key Relationships
Internal
Merchandise Buying & Planning, Commercial, Marketing, Operations, Supply Chain, HR, Finance

External

  • Pepkor D&A, Pepkor IT, Qlik, APT

Experience & Skills Required

Essential:

  • At least 10 years’ working experience as in a Data Analytics, Data Management or Data Insights position.
  • Proven and successful experience in execution of data analytics initiatives
  • Experience in setting up data architecture and design.
  • Experience in leading a large analytical team.
  • Experience in building and leading quantitative analyses
  • Building business insights, response, and risk models for a business
  • Experience working with a wide range of data to deliver descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive models.

Preferred:

  • Experience within the retail industry
  • Senior Data Analyst in a fast paced and complex business setting
  • Strong business / commercial acumen
  • Deep understanding of a retail environment


SKILLS:

  • Strategic thinking
    • Be a though leader in the data and analytics space as an enabler to drive execution of strategy.
  • Excellent Communication
    • Written and Verbal
    • Interact on all levels/with numerous departments’ personnel and departmental heads / executive management.
  • Good presentation skills and ability to simplify complex scenarios.
  • Data and information management
  • Reporting Visualization
  • Problem solving using advanced analytics techniques.
  • Highly proficient in workings of data technologies
  • The ability to:
    • Work under pressure (remain calm and composed)
    • Make strong, lasting, and meaningful connections with others.

Objectives and Measurements:

Enablement of Self-Help Data Analytics

Qualitative Measure (Description)

  • Establish processes, technology, tools, skills, and knowledge for data management.
  • Enable end to end view of organizational data and information (single source).
  • Establish and execute data governance principles across the business.
  • Lead strategy and execution of data collection, data warehousing and data models.
  • Deliver a data literacy manual and training Programme for all data users and commence with training.

Quantitative Measure (Number)

  • Establishment of an organizational data dictionary (common language and measurements) agreed and signed off by the relevant data champions in each BU within the first 6 months.
  • Align all measure calculations across the business.
  • Optimize self-help data analytics landscape: reduce the number of operational data models in the business to no more than 10.

Strategic Analytics Services (Predictive Analytics)

Qualitative Measure (Description)

  • Define the more complex business questions that need to be answered and define appropriate analytics models in addition to identifying and readying relevant data sources for analysis.
  • Deliver actionable insights that drives successful execution of the overarching business strategy.
  • Identify risks and potential risk mitigation tactics.

Quantitative Measure (Number)

  • Deliver a minimum of 2 predictive models that significantly impacts business performance or reduces financial risk on an ongoing basis (24 months). (Annual value > R10 million)
  • Deliver a cost-effective alternative solution for basket analytics / test and learn application (24 months) – Saving of R5m annually on third party costs.

Engagement

Qualitative Measure (Description)

  • Form meaningful partnerships with business stakeholders to extract maximum value from the data and analytics tools.
  • Works closely with data and insights champions in each function in execution of departmental goals and strategies.
  • Works with internal and external service providers (PIT, D&A, APT etc.) in defining the data collection, and storage needs of the business for the purpose of consuming and also for guaranteeing that there is high data-quality and reliability across the business.

Quantitative Measure (Number)

  • Establish data analytics forum with data champions in each BU and relevant. Monthly sessions. Target – first 3 months.
  • Save minimum of 40 hours per month through automation of reports / repetitive analytics.

Central Reporting Services

Qualitative Measure (Description)

  • Develop and implement analytical presentation standards and best practices to optimize the use and understanding of data and information sources.
  • Ensure congruence of information in the various daily, weekly, and monthly reports and dashboards that are published across the business.

Quantitative Measure (Number)

  • Ensure central BI reports have standardized data quality throughout the organization with zero discrepancies between report values.

Commercialization of Data

Qualitative Measure (Description)

  • Support Business Units with strong data science capability that can drive business value by implementing advanced data, mathematical and statistical models.
  • Enable data enrichment from other sources and ensure due consideration is taken when insights are extracted.
  • Provide support to increase the adoption of automated and embedded decision solutions.

Quantitative Measure (Number)

  • Partner with SBU’s to deliver four new insights driven value creation decisions by providing advanced analytics modelling.

Protection of Personal Information

Owns responsibility to ensure compliance with regards to POPIA for customers, employees, and suppliers.

Are you passionate about using data to solve problems?

Who we are:

We are a specialist team within the Solutions and Insights Business Group of IQbusiness. We exist to grow individuals within our team to achieve their professional goals. In doing so, we assist our clients in their growth journey with our sustained energy and enthusiasm derived from our dynamic and cohesive team. We provide efficient and novel Data Solutions to our clients uplifting their business and enriching our team.

What we want:

We are looking for a Data Professional to join our dynamic and diverse team of Data Specialists. If you meet some or all the below requirements, then you may have a certain set of skills which we require.

Data Governance - Do you understand the information flow for organizations, including the integrity, efficiency, and availability of data?

Data Analysis – Can you turn data into information and information into insight that will lead to informed business decisions?

Data Modeller – Could you design and maintain optimal data models at both an enterprise and system level that meet the business and architectural objectives of the organisation?

Cloud Data Engineering – Are you able to work behind the scenes to obtain, process and supply data via various methodologies and technologies, to various consumers, in ways and forms that makes sense and adds value?

Do you have a broad understanding of Data Management (DMBOK)?


Personal competencies that we are looking for:

  • The ability to solve problems.
  • The ability to rotate around a problem, to see if solutions can be gained in different ways.
  • The ability to work in an ever changing, unstructured environment.
  • The ability to work as part of a team, with vastly differing skill sets and opinions.
  • The ability to contribute ideas to the quorum.
  • The ability to mentor and provide guidance for other team members.
  • A systems approach to thinking, as opposed to a siloed approach. You need to understand how your work affects the greater system.
  • The ability to work without supervision and take accountability for the work you deliver.
  • The ability to liaise with clients, the ability to ignore extraneous data and extracting the core requirements.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


As a Data Governance Analyst:

  • Developing and implementing data standards, guaranteeing metadata is captured correctly, and creating methods for monitoring and reporting any data incidents.
  • Monitoring of application personnel to ensure adherence to data governance and regulatory requirements, where required.
  • Create and maintain common data dictionaries/business glossaries and the tools or methods that support data standards for an organization.
  • Analyse and oversee strategies designed to enhance data reliability and minimize redundancies.
  • Work with other information technology personnel to develop data quality standards.
  • Create key performance indicators and supply colleagues and organizational management with performance results.
  • Assist with data monitoring and provide organizational management with guidance on streamlining data management.
  • Implement procedures and policies for data management in an organization, assisting colleagues in performing data-related tasks, and networking with clients.

As a Data Analyst:

  • Interpret data, analyse results and interpret trends enabling continuous improvement in data quality and overall business performance
  • Create detailed specifications that specify data sources, data flows, data transformations, data storage and reporting
  • Produce documentation such as source-to-target-maps, data dictionaries and data models
  • Create test cases and scenarios used to ensure quality assurance
  • Interact and collaborate with technical and business stakeholders to identify data sources, find data definitions for master and metadata as well as formulate and implement solutions
  • Promote the use of existing enterprise and divisional data standards to enhance data quality, ensure constant compliance and adherence to data governance principles
  • Promote reusability, maintainability, reliability, and scalability in design and development of data solutions
  • Process live and confidential data according to specified guidelines
  • Evaluate changes and updates to source production systems that could impact reporting and eventually business decisions

As a Data Modeller:

  • Modelling data changes required by new features or regulatory needs
  • Contribution in filling any gaps in the wider enterprise models
  • Ensuring that the data model is aligned to the wider enterprise models, raising issues for any exceptions
  • Collaborating with the business analysts, product teams and architects to build data flow and develop conceptual models
  • Perform reverse engineering of physical data models
  • Coordinate data models, dictionaries, and other database documentation across multiple applications
  • Identify opportunities to improve business
  • Provide Data Management guidance and alignment to the Data Management framework and standards
  • Collate dataflow diagrams outlining the flow of data across systems and interfaces
  • Support the achievement of the business strategy, objectives, and values

As a Cloud Data Engineer:

(As the field of data engineering is very broad, you may be required to develop API endpoints for the consumption of data, data pipelines, highly distributed, high availability data processing pipelines in an effort to satisfy the need of the Client, Data Analysts or Quantitative Analysts.)

  • Providing a superior customer experience by building and maintaining relationships, working at customer offices, keeping data confidential
  • Design and develop data solutions
  • Produce solutions for both real-time and batch environments
  • Test your work to ensure compliance
  • Solve problems, and do root cause analysis
  • Prioritize your workload
  • Assist in other areas relating to your data function, such as data modelling, data and business analysis
  • Interact with a variety of individuals: senior, junior and technical business representatives
  • Provide guidance to colleagues or manage a team
  • Uphold the IQbusiness values, which are to care, learn & share; innovate; deliver as well as to build, enhance and maintain relationships.

REQUIREMENTS:


For a Data Governance Analyst:

  • 7-10 years of experience in Data Management Framework development and implementation thereof
  • Relevant Bachelors’ Degree / Diploma / recognised qualification from an accredited tertiary institution preferably ICT
  • Knowledge and/or experience in Data frameworks, practices and tooling (e.g., DAMA, Apache, etc)
  • Demonstrates knowledge of database and data warehouse design
  • Proven experience building logical and physical data models using industry best practices, patterns and frameworks
  • Has analytical skills and demonstrates a deep interest in research
  • Demonstrates the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to draw actionable insights from raw data and information to help further the business’s cause
  • Ability to communicate well with different types of stakeholders, adapt to different project environments and play a flexible role in projects
  • Have a drivers' license and a willingness to travel

For a Data Analyst:

  • 3 – 6 years of experience in analyzing and using data to solve problems
  • Relevant Bachelors’ Degree / Diploma / recognised qualification from an accredited tertiary institution preferably ICT
  • Knowledge and/or experience in Data frameworks, practices and tooling (e.g. DAMA, Apache, etc)
  • Demonstrates knowledge of database and data warehouse design
  • Proven experience building logical and physical data models using industry best practices, patterns and frameworks
  • Practical technical experience using database management tools(SQL) and reporting tools(Power BI)
  • Familiarity with BI methodologies such as Kimball and Inman
  • Has analytical skills and demonstrates a deep interest in research
  • Demonstrates the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to draw actionable insights from raw data and information to help further the business’s cause
  • Ability to communicate well with different types of stakeholders, adapt to different project environments and play a flexible role in projects
  • Have a drivers' license and a willingness to travel

For a Data Modeller:

  • Able to demonstrate practical experience in relational and dimensional modelling techniques, modelling experience also an advantage
  • Experience using Infosphere Data Architect or any other Data Modelling Tool
  • Experience with industry models such as IFW, BFMDW
  • Broad understanding of Data Management (DMBOK), systems development lifecycle methodologies and IT Architecture
  • Relevant regulatory knowledge, and understanding of banking and financial services
  • Experience in NoSQL and other forms of database modelling advantageous
  • SQL for Data Analysis
  • Denodo experience would be advantageous
  • Matric and NQF level 6 Qualifications essential
  • BCom or BSc Computer science or Information systems advantageous
  • DAMA, TOGAF and the like highly beneficial.

For a Cloud Data Engineer:

  • 4 - 10 years experience in Data Engineering environments and technologies
  • Cloud exposure and/or project experience – Microsoft Azure, AWS, etc
  • Extensive experience in Microsoft Azure technologies
  • Extensive experience in reporting and dashboarding technologies such as Power BI and QlikView
  • Experience using Azure DevOps and CI/CD frameworks
  • Exposure to logical and physical data modelling
  • Agile and waterfall project management
  • Relevant Qualifications Information Technology
  • Additional MS, Data and/or Cloud certifications are beneficial.

Your knowledge about the following concepts, is valuable to the team:

  • Data modelling
  • Relational data modelling in traditional database management systems
  • Coercing unstructured and semi-structured data into structured form
  • Data pipeline knowledge (extracting and transformation)
  • Data transformation knowledge for reporting and analytics purposes

Some technical competencies that we are looking for:

  • Writing SQL queries, that can relate, transform and aggregate data from many different sources
  • Experience with writing data pipelines that move and transform data
  • Working knowledge of a general purpose programming language like Python would be advantageous
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Azure technologies such as Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Databricks, Synapse Analytics.
  • Working knowledge of Storage Repositories and Data Lakes

Please note: As all IQbusiness roles require honesty in the handling of or access to cash, finances, financial systems, or confidential information; our recruitment process requires that the following background checks be completed: credit, criminal, ID and qualification verification.

IQbusiness is committed to sustainable growth and transformation, we embrace diversity and employ previously disadvantaged individuals.

Job ID: 17866
    Position Type: Full-Time

    Workplace Type:

Position Description:

Job description

This role requires a driven individual that will assist the digital and social media division of TFG Media in contributing to the division’s Key Performance Indicator’s (KPI’s),

The individual would report to a combined team across the digital and mobile entertainment portfolios.

The primary function of this role is to provide creative and strategic brand support to the DigitalTeam:

  • Planning and execution of socia media campaigns across multiple brands
  • Content creation (copywriting)
  • Basic digital design (Photoshop, InDesign, Everlytic for example)
  • Campaign data analytics
  • SEO
  • Research into digital subscription products and platforms
  • Customer relationship management where required
  • Performing ad hoc admin tasks when required
  • Business skills such as ability to use would be an advantage


Duties and Responsibilities

  • Assist the digital and mobile entertainment teams in social media and email campaign planning and execution
  • Understand and compile campaign analysis reports
  • Brainstorm new ideas and strategies to attract different market segments to subscribe
  • Monitor and report back on brand social media activity
  • Create bespoke content for varying product campaigns (digital magazines, print magazines, mobile entertainment products)
  • Research and advise on expanded use of QR codes internationally
  • Research digifal magazine platforms in the e-commerce space
  • Advise on latest social media tools and trends
  • Assist with planning and execution of events
  • Continually seek ways to improve customer experience and profitability
  • Building and maintaining relationships with internal and external customers

Requirements

  • If possible a digital marketing degree, or business or equivalent diploma
  • Computer literacy and well versed in using Microsoft Office tools (Word and Excel) will be advantageous
  • High comfort level with all social media platforms
  • Digital-first thinking
  • Ability to work closely with all levels of people from management to research groups


Competencies and behaviours for success

  • Excellent written communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent understanding of digital marketing platforms
  • Exceptionally keen desire to grow quickly and show results in digital and social media realms
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to remain focussed and deliver results
  • High resilience and agility with the ability to work well under pressure
  • Able to work both independently and in groups
  • Good interpersonal skills

Preference will be given, but not limited to, candidates from designated groups in terms of the Employment Equity Act.

display_title: Senior Data Science Analyst- Model Validation
job_description:
JOB OVERVIEW
Business Segment: Group Functions
Location: ZA, GP, Johannesburg, Baker Street 30
Job Type: Full-time
Job ID: 60050095_80357903
Date Posted: 6/12/2023

JOB DESCRIPTION

Perform initial and ongoing validations of models for both the retail and wholesale areas of the bank, including machine learning models and provide thought leadership on leading edge data science and artificial intelligence practices to be applied in the model validation process.

Perform initial and ongoing validation of internally and externally developed risk models used by either the retail or wholesale credit risk functions in the bank.
Interact with Model Development to obtain additional clarity on the models that are being validated.
Perform model validation tasks according to the team’s operating standards.
Identify, make recommendations, and assist to improve the validation methods and processes.

display_title: Manager Finance Retail FP & A EM
job_description:
Purpose & Overall Relevance for the Organization:

As a key member of the Hub FP&A team this position offers analysis and support to guide Finance and non-Finance stakeholders and help the Retail sales channel grow across EM region.

This requires a detailed understanding of the business, correct and timely reporting as well as in-depth analyses combined with competent and professional business partnering. With strong understanding of Retail across a complex geographical region.

Key Responsibilities :
  • Manage and execute standardized monthly and ad-hoc financial reporting / process and partner with business and Senior Management for enabling fact-based decision making.
  • Review and approve Markets’ retail investment plans together with DTC HUB team for every new store opening, relocation, concept upgrade, closure, and ensure optimal CAPEX allocation to drive commerciality, profitability and support strategic store portfolio management.
  • Drive continuous store level financial performance analysis to ensure concrete actions are taken for underperforming doors.
  • Develop and implement standardized business controlling processes & tools with ongoing drive for improvements & simplifications.
  • Creating transparency acting as business partner for commercial and finance counterparts based on the actual reporting, forecasting/budgeting process, potential Risk / Opportunities and management comments.
  • Coordinate, execute and participate in the budgeting process for Emerging Markets.
  • Provide expertise and ongoing financial information to Market Retail Directors to assist in making business decisions to achieve growth, profitability and targets.
  • Manage medium sized projects and/or actively participate in projects; implement findings and ensure sustainability of achievements.
  • Other ad hoc projects as required by FP&A lead.

KPI’s:

  • Establishment and monitoring of KPI’s to compare clusters across EM.
  • BPM reviews
  • Provision of monthly Retail deck

Key Relationships:

  • VP Finance Market EM
  • VP Retail Market EM
  • Senior Director Financial Planning & Analysis, EM
  • Market Finance Team
  • Market Commercial teams

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Experience working in a multinational environment.
  • Proven track record working in a digital environment;
  • Strong analytical and financial modeling skills, solid knowledge on Finance and Accounting principles and very good financial statement analysis ability.
  • An organized self-starter who can work independently handling of a variety of tasks with different levels of complexity.
  • Desire and ability to work closely and collaboratively with EM markets, senior management and Global HQ.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
  • Commercial acumen
  • Ability to operate cross-functionally and understanding of external business drivers
  • Strong analytics and presentation skills, managing large data quantities from multiple sources (SAP, Excel, BI, PowerPoint, Thinkcell).
  • Business fluency in English (written and spoken)

Requisite Education and Experience / Minimum Qualifications:

  • University degree in business administration with focus on Finance/Controlling, qualified accountant with strong commercial experience (CA, CPA, or CIMA membership or similar Accounting Body)
  • Strong experience in financial planning and analysis.
  • Retail experience: ideally in retail/apparel/fashion/consumer goods
  • Advanced System expertise in Microsoft office (Excel, PowerPoint) and SAP.
  • Strong competence with various tools, procedures, etc.
  • 5-8 years of experience in the same or similar field.
  • Proficient accounting skills and experience.

display_title: Senior Business Analyst - Digital Technologies - Remote Work (Within SA)
job_description:
We are looking for a Digital Feature Analyst to join our rapidly growing digital team and assist us in recommending the best digital products/solutions to launch in various markets we operate in, to increase profitability within the company’s business and digital transformation vision.


The successful candidate will be responsible for clarifying business requirements, documenting associated user stories and acceptance criteria, through in-work collaboration with business stakeholders, cross functional teams and product owners across our business process services in finance, health and insurance etc, contributing to the accurate and effective end-to-end delivery of expectations. To assume the role of scrum master within the digital and business transformation and information technology teams, looking at market data to determine what digital products to launch and interviewing customers to understand their needs.


Ultimately, the candidate will work with our clients and various community of practice leaders in our organization to help us determine what digital products/solutions we should launch to maximize profitability and realization of our global digital business model.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and oversee medium to large scale digital and business transformation projects.
  • Analyze metrics to continually improve company and client’s digital products.
  • Assist the company in achieving short and long-term goals relating to digital product growth.
  • Work with our community of practice leaders to improve the analysis and presentation of our digital products/solutions.
  • Proven work experience as a Business or Product Analyst within a digital environment or similar role.
  • Proficient in database software SQL, Oracle, Jira, Confluence, Celonis, PowerBi (Dax or M-Query languages), Programming Python & R (Business Analytics Packages).
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills, logical and critical thinking skills.
  • The ability to work under pressure and adapt to change.
  • Relevant training and/or certifications as a Business or Product Analyst.
  • Prioritize and Plan work activities within the Digital Feature role.
  • Manage the Backlog for the Digital Feature role.
  • Collaborate with the team to deliver on backlog.
  • Wear different hats: designer, tester, facilitator, product owner, etc.
  • Create a shared understanding of what the digital product is supposed to do.
  • Understanding business needs and be able to analyse requirements.
  • Ability to analyse statistics and other data, interpret and evaluate results, and create reports and presentations for use by other business stakeholders.
  • Evaluating the company’s digital products and comparing them against industry trends.
  • Developing an understanding of company products to meet the company's current and future needs.
  • Providing assistance with digital products and customer satisfaction, rating reviews and associated voice of customer technologies.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Degree in BCom Informatics or a related field.
  • Certifications in IIBA AAC/CBDA/CPOA or CCBA/CBAP or related.
  • Service Design, Design Thinking, Lean Six Sigma, Scrum or SAFe industry accredited certifications will be advantageous.
  • Consulting background will be advantageous.

Experience:

  • 2 - 3 years proven experience in requirement elicitation, gathering, documentation and management and analysing digital business needs and provide solutions, working in an agile environment.
  • 2 - 3 years good understanding of agile working practices, LEAN and SCRUM proficiency and working collaboratively across teams. Agile methodologies, digital business analysis, SDLC, requirements management and business support.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Behavioural Competencies:

  • Taking Action
  • Team Working
  • Adopting Practical Approaches (Pragmatic)
  • Embracing Change
  • Articulating Information

Technical Competencies:

  • Digital Business Analysis/ Feature Analysis
  • Digital, Data and IT Knowledge
  • Requirements Gathering and Management
  • Process Analysis, Focus Groups, Surveys & Interviews, Workshop Facilitations
  • Research & Information Gathering
  • Stakeholder Management (Digital, Data and IT)

Job Description

About our client

Our purpose is making life better. We are a global healthcare provider delivering measurable clinical quality through a diversified offering and a people-centered approach.

Role

Head: Data, reporting to the Executive: Data and Analytics.

The successful candidate will have prime responsibility for data asset delivery for analytics and business needs, and as such, will have an important and high-profile strategic position in the group. The role is responsible for overseeing data architecture, infrastructure, governance, operations and development, but more than that, for designing and building the environment that will future-proof the delivery of data insights.

It calls for a visionary, a leader and a creator, not merely a technician and manager.

Key Responsibilities

  • Ensure the creation and preservation of data assets to allow the company to drive business value through reporting and analytics.
  • In particular, transform the existing infrastructure (a data warehouse and multiple stored procedures leading to multiple data sources) to an integrated, aligned and reusable single source of truth.
  • Future-proof data sources in a way that is closely aligned to the business's evolving reporting and analytics needs.
  • Have a thorough understanding of business strategy and the objectives that flow from this.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand operational needs and how these evolve.
  • Oversee the management and storage of data to support these objectives, ensuring data quality, availability and usability.
  • Through direct line reporting, manage the Architecture and Data Governance Manager, the Data Operations Manager and the Data Development Manager, and through them indirectly the teams supporting these functions; through these reporting lines:
  • Be accountable for organizational data architecture regarding operational needs, efficiency and cost.
  • Research best-in-breed solutions and ensure that the data environment remains relevant and optimal to support organizational goals.
  • Develop and nurture a high-performance, quality-obsessed, collaborative culture with other leaders in the broader data and analytics team.
  • Drive innovation in data management and drive business implementation of the data management strategy.
  • Be accountable for data governance, ensuring that data privacy obligations and data protection regulations are complied with.
  • Effectively communicate to senior management, business, and staff in the data and analytics team the value and importance of sound data management and the analytical possibilities that flow from it.
  • Oversee data operations and data development.

Required Experience/Qualifications

  • Honors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or an equivalent field, or other equivalent qualifications.
  • 8+ years of experience in the administration and management of data environments and the information life-cycle.
  • 3+ years of management experience.
  • Previous experience in overseeing the set up and management of enterprise data warehouses.
  • Solid experience in cloud technologies and on premise solutions.
  • Strong leadership and communication skills.
  • Understanding of data systems, architecture and pipelines.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret complex problems or processes that span multiple business areas, identify and understand requirements, and develop alternate solutions.
  • Project management skills.
  • Client relationship skills: demonstrated ability to build relationships with and deliver valuable solutions for stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with relevant data environments and tools, including big data solutions.
  • Healthcare experience will be a strong advantage.

Salary

R168000.00

The company has mandated that all employees be COVID-19 vaccinated.

Introduction

Through our client-facing brands Metropolitan and Momentum, with Multiply (wellness and rewards programme), and our other specialist brands, including Guardrisk and Eris Property Group, the group enables business and people from all walks of life to achieve their financial goals and life aspirations.


We help people grow their savings, protect what matters to them and invest for the future. We help companies and organisations care for and reward their employees and members. Through our own network of advisers or via independent brokers and utilising new platforms Momentum Metropolitan provides practical financial solutions for people, communities and businesses. Visit us at www.momentummetropolitan.co.za



Role Purpose

To be involved in all analytics related aspects of the management of a short-term insurer; including performance remuneration, product development, experience monitoring, process optimization, and other ad-hoc projects. This is a broad technical role that will require a passion for data science.


The role will require accountability for key BAU processes but will be more focused on ad-hoc projects involving a range of key areas and processes of a short-term insurer. This role is ideal for a candidate with exceptional analytical and data science skills looking for an opportunity to explore the application of and grow their skills in the insurance sector.



Requirements

  • Degree in Actuarial Science, Statistics, Business Sciences, Business Mathematics. Other degrees or postgraduate qualifications with a statistical/modelling aspect and/or experience will be considered.

  • Actuarial candidates need to have passed all CT’s and CA1.

  • 2 years or more experience in statistical modelling or an analytical role

  • 2 years or more experience in Microsoft Excel, SQL

  • Experience in modelling software such as R and Python required

  • Experience in the Short-term insurance industry will be advantageous.


Duties & Responsibilities

  • Data collection, verification and management

  • Extract insights and recommend appropriate actions through statistical modelling and data analysis

  • Design and build analytical solutions to meet business needs

  • Reporting on any analysis, modelling or solutions developed

  • Remuneration modelling management


Competencies

  • A quick learner

  • Independent self-starter

  • Energetic and strong sense of urgency

  • Self-disciplined and self-motivated

  • Enthusiastic and passionate attitude to the job and company

  • Effective communication skills (written and verbal)

  • Exceptional analytical and technical skills with an interest in machine learning.

  • Ability to work well in a team and independently.

  • Financial and Business acumen

  • Problem solving skills

  • Integrity and honesty

  • Passionate about data

We are looking for truly unique people who believe in fostering a diverse and inclusive environment, where our people are cared for, happy and inspired to build an extraordinary place to work. We are looking for a creative problem solver that thrives when presented with a challenge and aligns with our awesome values and culture. We see ourselves as a company that enables its team to thrive, with the top value behind the work we do being trust, which means total flexibility and independence.

Our solutions range from cloud-based solutions that are AI-Powered, machine learning predictive tech that keeps our clients ahead of customer behavior, to centralized, data-visualized, single dashboards, that are custom-built solutions automating and centralizing all elements of the management process. We also predict what our customer needs, what they buy, and how much of it they buy. Our solutions have revolutionized all forecasting abilities from pricing, inventory, customer behavior, and sales analytics.

Our vision for our Junior Payroll Administrator is to contribute to the efficiency and precision of the Payroll and Benefits function by ensuring that employees are paid on time and correctly. Further, to provide employees with relevant information as required by the BCEA, and to contribute to group policies and procedures to ensure the sound management and control of the department.

Responsibilities include

Input Processing

  • Collecting of salary input documents
  • Scrutinizing of salary documents for abnormalities
  • Ensure all abnormalities and incomplete documents to be logged on input query list and distributed to the People Team
  • Obtaining outstanding documents when necessary
  • Prepare documents for processing
  • Process input documents – capture onto the payroll system
  • Ensure that all input is captured accurately and on time and take corrective action when necessary
  • Ensure all data is inputted by the deadline date
  • Ensure timeous action is taken relating to finalization of queries to ensure service delivery continues
  • Ensure that EE records are updated with documentation and that documents are readily accessible and readily available upon request
  • Adhere to all deadlines applicable to the payroll department
  • Adhere to company procedures and policies
  • Ensure the availability of documents captured within the applicable month if and when queried
  • Apply audit requirements to everyday tasks

Salary Administration

  • Ensure that EE records are up to date at all times Provide feedback to employees and management regarding queries within 48 hours
  • Ensure timeous verification of personal and bank details on CRS DIY portal
  • Assist users to access documents such as payslips, tax certificates, salary letters, etc. from the DIY portal
  • Report abnormalities to line manager for clarification
  • Highlight departmental input and effectiveness/errors
  • Salary Clearing variances to be investigated and corrected to ensure up to date and reconciled account status
  • Loading payments (EFT’s)
  • Ensure all stop payments and recalls are done by deadline date accompanied by reversals if and when necessary
  • Ensure reversals of payments are done within the applicable month to ensure corrective action was taken for recalls

Reporting (Payroll and Migrate)

  • Ensure goals and objectives are met
  • Ensure all errors on exception reports are corrected timeously
  • Scrutinise all auditing error reports and correct immediately and provide Quality Specialist with feedback or confirmation once corrected
  • All reports to be checked and corrected to minimize month end queries all reports to be signed off
  • Maintain Audit requirements
  • Ensure accuracy of Contract Dates

Benefits Administration

  • Ensure all Medical Aid applications are complete and correct as per Company Policies and Medical Aid Plans
  • Ensure application forms are submitted on time and captured within the applicable month using SMP as starting point
  • Ensure all EE are on Pension as per Company Policy and criteria
  • Ensure that proof can be provide at all times regarding submissions and payment to 3rd parties – record keeping
  • Garnishees’ queries to be dealt with directly
  • UI19 documents to be generated immediately upon receipt of termination documents
  • Abnormalities to be logged, communicated and resolved and feedback communicated

Your skills and experience include

  • Diploma/NQF level 5
  • 2-3 years admin experience, capturing data and verifying if remuneration-related issues
  • Computer literacy
  • Attention to detail
  • Relationship building
  • Deadline driven
  • Numerical reasoning

Key personal attributes include

  • Communication
  • Organisational commitment
  • Teamwork & collaboration
  • Relationship building
  • Agility
  • Performance & results driven
  • Continuous growth & improvement
  • Resilience & stress management
  • Service excellence
  • Analysis & problem solving
  • Planning & prioritisation
  • Quality & detail excellence
  • Financial acumen

Our strategy, The New Equation, is about how PwC brings together unique combinations of people, powered by technology, galvanizing ourselves as a community of solvers to address those dual challenges. The foundation of the strategy is our multidisciplinary model, which allows us to help clients build trust and deliver sustained outcomes by bringing together deep expertise across a broad range of capabilities. It is this combination of capabilities and the ability to look at things
from different perspectives that is so essential to delivering high quality and real impacts for clients, stakeholders and society at large in Africa and globally.


A career in our Strategy Consulting practice, within General Consulting services, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities. We work with some of the world’s largest and most complex companies to understand their unique business issues and opportunities in an ever-changing environment. We help create sustainable change by stimulating innovation, unlocking data possibilities, navigating risk and regulatory complexity, optimising deals, and aligning costs with business strategy to create a competitive advantage.


Strategy& focuses on the development of high impact and pragmatic strategies to solve complex problems and maximise market potential and differentiation. This is achieved through our unique capabilities-driven strategy, business transformation, and digital transformation approaches and tools. Our strategy development and strategic problem-solving work draws on analytics, global and local leading practices and case studies, innovation, industry and domain Subject Matter Experts and business/solution architecture.


As an associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:


  • using strategic business consulting skills, to work with clients through all stages of strategy-based transformation projects;

  • providing support in consultation with clients to identify, clarify, and resolve complex issues critical to clients' strategic and operating success;

  • developing insights, conducting independent analysis and developing hypothesis-based recommendations as part of the development of client specific transformational strategies;

  • developing conclusions and recommendations, writing reports, assisting in client presentations and providing implementation assistance as required.


Requirements

What skills and attributes are we looking for?


  • Comfortable delivering both formal and informal presentations, both internally and externally.

  • Strong written report skills are essential.

  • Ability to build strong relationships at all levels of the organisation (client and internal), establishing your credibility and gaining trust.

  • Flexibility and commercialism to manage a diverse range of responsibilities in a dynamic and results-oriented environment.

  • Ability to work in teams in a strategic consulting environment as well as autonomously.

  • Excellent communication skills.

  • Foreign language skills and international work experience will be advantageous.

  • Self-motivated and capable of developing innovative approaches to difficult issues.

  • Highly analytical and structured thinking (hypotheses-based analysis).

  • Excellent quantitative skills and high levels of attention to detail.

  • Flexibility in adjusting to highly varied projects and environments.

  • Resilience and ability to adapt in unfamiliar industries and functions.

  • Good interpersonal skills, and ability to work in a team environment.

  • High energy level.


    Minimum 70% average in your undergraduate and postgraduate degree in:


    • Economics/ Econometrics,

    • Environmental Studies,

    • Finance,

    • Engineering,

    • IT,

    • Mathematics,

    • Accounting,

    • Investment Management,

    • Business Science.


The PwC Professional is our global leadership development framework. It outlines the capabilities that we look for in all our people — from associate to partner level — that will help us to thrive as purpose-led and values-driven leaders. We look for and develop these qualities in all our people:


Whole leadership


I lead myself and others to make a difference and create a positive impact in a responsible, authentic, resilient, inclusive and passionate manner.


Business acumen


I bring business knowledge, innovation and insight to create distinctive value for clients and PwC.


Technical and digital


I apply a range of technical, digital and other professional capabilities to deliver quality and value.


Global and inclusive


I operate and collaborate effectively with a mindset that transcends boundaries and embraces diverse perspectives.


Relationships


I build relationships of high value, which are genuine and meaningful.



About PwC

At PwC, our purpose is to build trust in society and solve important problems. We’re a network of firms in 157 countries with over 276,000 people who are committed to delivering quality in assurance, advisory and tax services. Find out more and tell us what matters to you by visiting us at www.pwc.com.


PwC has a presence in 34 African countries with an office footprint covering 66 offices. With a single Africa leadership team and more than 400 partners and 9000 professionals across Africa, we serve some of the continent’s largest businesses across all industries.


PwC refers to the PwC network and/or one or more of its member firms, each of which is a separate legal entity. Please see www.pwc.com/structure for further details.

We help create sustainable change by stimulating innovation, unlocking data possibilities, navigating risk and regulatory complexity, optimising deals, and aligning costs with business strategy to create a competitive advantage.

Our strategy development and strategic problem-solving work draws on analytics, global and local leading practices and case studies, innovation, industry and domain Subject Matter Experts and business/solution architecture.

The Opportunity

We are on a mission to help more people thrive in tech - becoming the central place for software developers to build great careers and companies to build winning teams. Our mandate within the Growth Group of OfferZen is to engage and grow our community of developers and those hiring them by engaging them with valuable tech career content, events, reports, and tools.

As a Social Media Manager, you'll play a key role in growing our reach within the tech community online by engaging them with value-adding content.

What you'll do

  • Work with the Content Team Lead & Head of Brand to create social media roadmaps & campaigns that build our social presence.
  • Create channel-specific social media collateral that drives meaningful engagement and valuable insights for the tech community.
  • Work with key stakeholders to identify opportunities and develop social media content that drives core missions
  • Monitor, engage and organise responses to our community's questions, insights and suggestions in a manner that builds their trust and loyalty in the OfferZen Brand.
  • Act as a channel expert, to provide social media best practices and support OfferZen marketing and community teams to better understand what's happening in the online community and what people are finding valuable.
  • Monitor, review and report on social media performance and iterate to improve social efforts

You'll be a great fit for this role if you have:

  • Excitement about the opportunities that social media presents to us as a business and opinionated on what works and doesn't.
  • 2 years of social media experience: You are a channel expert and understand social media best practices. You understand the best performing channels and content types to optimise our existing content and suggest new content and channels.
  • A related tertiary qualification
  • Communication skills: You are a confident creator who can craft copy that will appeal to and engage the right people at the right time
  • Content creation experience: You've got a solid understanding of content distribution from concept to deployment. From building out a content distribution strategy, optimising for channel objectives, to working with various content types and tools.
  • Topical focus: You understand the tech community (Advantageous: Tech Twitter is your happy place)
  • Stakeholder management: You work well cross-functionally and with external and internal partners

What it's like to work here

We love to do fun stuff together. We are focused on building a connected tribe and a sense of belonging. We value unique and diverse approaches and ensure we create opportunities to share and learn from each other. We have regular online events, show and tells and a book club as well as regional and annual off-site events.

We're dedicated to authenticity: We treat people as people, caring personally and speaking openly. We foster low-ego behaviour - we own our mistakes as well as our victories. We're never about blame. We're always about honesty, learning and continuous improvement. We ensure lots of transparency and visibility. From OKRs and strategy to analytics and company performance numbers, it's all available for you to see and understand.

We're passionate about learning and levelling up: Everyone at OfferZen strives for a growth mindset. We read books, listen to podcasts, share expertise obsessively, then take on hard challenges with smart guidance and support. When things go wrong, we look for the learning and how to improve.

We're all about balance: We believe that maintaining a healthy balance between home and work is the key to feeling happier and more productive. We work fully remote and also offer 20 days of leave a year which are available to use from the time you start.

The OfferZen Story

OfferZen is on a mission to improve the experience of finding work for people involved in making software, from developers to designers and data scientists through the utilisation of our world class online recruitment marketplace. We do this by flipping the traditional recruitment model on its head and getting companies to reach out to candidates with upfront offers.

Over the last 6 years, we have managed to make a large dent in the South African online tech recruitment marketplace – and we're speeding up. We have a team of 150+ people with offices in both Cape Town and Amsterdam. At 6 years young, we're still in an exciting scale-up phase which allows us to develop new and exciting ideas, innovate our product, and think creatively about solving real problems.

Who are we?
Sanlam Group Technology is responsible for the provision of a digitally enabled technology service as a group COE, drive business and transformation and provide group-wide digital and data architecture. Data & Digital Academy Graduate
An exciting opportunity is available for soon-to-be or recent graduates to join the Sanlam Data & Digital Academy. We are seeking Africa’s brightest minds who are eager to build and develop technical, analytical, and business skills while working on real business cases within the Sanlam Business Intelligence and Group Technology ecosystems.

Being selected for a Data & Digital Academy Graduate position will entail:
Permanent employment from the onset.
Market-related benefits and rewards.
Access to business mentors, qualified life coaches and subject-matter experts to guide your career advancement.
Hands-on experience in one of the largest and most diverse FS organisations in Africa .
Access to secondments in a variety of agile -focused delivery teams to solve problems and co-create innovative solutions for the business.
Participation in real case studies that have been tailored for Sanlam, thus providing technical training and domain knowledge simultaneously.
Exposure to leading-edge technologies and the opportunity to apply your skills in the process of designing and launching new capabilities or experimenting to deliver MVPs.
Constant growth, facilitated through tech focus days, experimentation programmes and participation in dedicated innovation competitions.
Collaboration with experienced Sanlam employees participating in the programme.
Opportunity to build a career at Sanlam, and gain access to opportunities across a diverse set of capabilities, propositions, and geographies. All about Sanlam
Sanlam is one of the largest internationally active insurance organisations in the world and has the biggest non-banking financial services footprint on the African continent. The Group has an active presence in 43 countries, operating across the African continent, India, Malaysia, and selected developed markets. It is listed on the Johannesburg, A2X, and Namibian stock exchange.

Further to this, Sanlam has:
formed an InsurTech partnership with Africa’s largest telco, MTN
formed an African operations partnership with one of the world’s largest insurers, Allianz
structured a deal with Absa to create the largest black-owned asset manager in South Africa, Sanlam Investment Holdings
established a dedicated FinTech cluster, applying cutting-edge technology to build and launch digital market propositions
The application of technology, digital business and data is at the heart of our success. We strive to transform into a technology company with a strategy, and associated investments, geared towards the optimal use of technology to achieve objects and market advantage.
The Sanlam Data & Digital Academy (SDDA) forms part of Sanlam Group Technology. It is designed to build data analytical and technical skills which are critical in a fast-growing technological and data-driven environment.
As a group Centre of Excellence, Sanlam Group Technology is responsible for the provision of digitally enabled technology services, driving business and transformation while providing the Group with its data and digital architecture. Much of our focus falls into the domains of cloud-native architecture, regenerative artificial intelligence (AI), data mesh architecture, machine learning (ML), insurance telematics, advanced cyber security, event streaming, and other technologies such as virtual reality. What will you do?
The Sanlam Data & Digital Academy is offering two exciting development opportunities over a 13 month period, aimed at launching your career in either the data or digital track.

Data Track:
You are passionate about all things related to data: finding patterns in data, using data to build insight, aid decision-making and process action, and to create real value.
You want to establish strong foundations in data management and data engineering, in a fast-moving and complex enterprise data domain.
You’re interested in tackling complex data problems, and learning how to apply AI, ML, and regenerative AI to datasets to deliver unique insights, prompts and direction.
You aspire to develop your analytical skills to grow your career in roles such as Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, or AI/ML engineer.

Digital Track:
You have a passion for engineering and solving complex problems.
You aspire to grow in the domains of engineering and modern engineering with an interest in cloud-native architecture, Infrastructure as Code, and application integration.
You want to solve problems by applying the latest innovations in the digital world, modern engineering practices, as well as modern integration patterns, and AI techniques.
You seek a career as a Software Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Test Engineer, Integration Specialist, or Digital Architect.

During the 13-month program, you will receive:
Ongoing technical training, real-world enterprise-level experience, and soft skills training in a professional environment.
Guidance through coaching and mentorship from subject matter experts in the Sanlam Technology and Business Analytics Team to ensure that you are well-equipped to grow and become successful in your chosen career.
The opportunity to work cross-functionally in order to learn across various disciplines and be equipped with a diverse skillset, gaining access to multiple parts of the data and tech capabilities, and working with multiple parts of the business.
Rotate to different IT teams to get exposure to a variety of IT disciplines enabling you to find the best fit for your skills and interests.
The opportunity to participate in innovation competitions and tech learning days, such as the SGT data day, and SGT VR day, as well as vendor-facilitated hackathons.
Functional training and hands-on experience with the leading IT & BI tools and technology that will enable you to play a key role in Sanlam’s strategy to modernise the IT agenda. What will make you successful in this role?
The graduate programme is suited to independent and self-motivated individuals with strong analytical skills. Some of the key traits that will make you successful are, but not limited to:
an innovative mindset and problem-solving ability
a passion for data and technology
the ability to juggle deadlines and tasks from various stakeholders
hold a high value of client centricity and collaboration
be open to receive feedback for continuous personal growth Qualifications & Experience
We will only consider students who already hold a degree, or will obtain a degree be the end of 2023 . Previous work experience is not a pre-requisite.
Consideration will be given to applicants with undergraduate or postgraduate degrees within the STEM (Science, Tech, Engineering, Maths) disciplines.

Technology degrees such as BCom, BSc, BTech:
Information Technology / Information Systems / Computer Science

Degrees such as BCom, BSc, BEng:

data analysis, modelling and visualisation
business and process analysis Values Care – contributes independently

Our commitment to transformation
The Sanlam Group is committed to transformation and embracing diversity. This commitment is what drives us to achieve a diverse workplace. Our Employment Equity plan and targets will therefore be considered as part of the recruitment process. With employment equity as a key goal, Sanlam aims to create an inclusive workforce, representative of the demographics of our society as well as giving opportunity to people living with a disability. Build a successful career with us
We’re all about building strong, lasting relationships with our employees. We know that you have hopes for your future and want to achieve greatness in your career and personal development. We pride ourselves on helping our employees to realise their worth. Throughout our business clusters (Sanlam Retail Affluent and Retail Mass, Sanlam Corporate, Sanlam Emerging Markets, Sanlam Investments, Santam, Miway, as well as the Group Office) Sanlam provides many opportunities for growth and development. Turnaround time

JOB DESCRIPTION

Application closing date 10th July 2023

The Business intelligent and Analytics BCB SA team provides business with insights across the analytics continuum to enable effective tracking of key business performance metrics while also enabling real time Analysis & Insights through a self-service capability on one version of the truth that is consistent, accurate and timely in nature, and leveraging on internal and external data to provide actionable insights to allow business to have meaningful conversations with internal and external stakeholders. Utilize advanced statistical techniques that offer business opportunities and insights to make more informed decisions. Collaborating with our partners to ensure that data is available on the approved platforms, underpinned by appropriate data governance controls, thriving for acceptable data quality with 95% confidence level, and identifying opportunities to further optimize processes to create pleasurable customer experience.

Our Business intelligent and Analytics BCB SA Graduate Programme seeks to expose young South Africans in advanced data management technics that well enable effective tracking of key business measures that will allow business to make informed decision while driving the growth of our businesses and identifying opportunities to maximize shareholder value. Through this programme, you will be exposed to several BI and analytical tools that will allow one to understand Data engineering concepts, automation and building bespoke models that aims to solve for business challenges.

As a Data engineer, you will deal with several source systems and the ability to ask the relevant questions is key in ensuring we solve for the business needs. The Data can be Structured or semi-structured, the skills to deal with both structures is pivotal as you transform the raw data into meaningful information that can be used by business.

A deep understanding of advanced data platforms such as Python, Jupiter Notebook and Power Platforms, together with a formidable background in the fields of Mathematical Statistics, Data Science and Business is required to achieve our goals. This needs to be coupled with an experience in designing data flows aligned to modern data frameworks.

Undergraduate, Postgraduate or Honours in:
Computer Science

Informatics

Information Technology

Applied Mathematics

Actuarial Science

You'll be responsible for building the backend of our new product. You'll work with a team to build the back end in Python using Django and AngularJS. Requirements

  • Writes clean, reusable, and effective code.

  • Ensures the application works as intended when deployed to production.

Qualifications

  • Three years of experience as a web developer in Python preferred.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field required
  • Minimum 3 years experience as a developer with a strong background in Python and C#.
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment and have an aptitude for software development.

Your role in helping us shape the future:

Join our dynamic and innovative team of Platform Service Management professionals who specialize in platform resource planning, service management and product analytics which supports the strategy to maximize our Fleets’ revenue capture capabilities and deliver a superior customer experience. You will play a vital role in designing and delivering solutions to enable big data analytics which supports the growth of Intelsat's managed product line and its strategic priorities. You will function as the point of contact for data science initiatives partnering with the other business functions to identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency increase revenue and reduce cost. You will collaborate with Product Development, Asset Managment, Data Engineering and Operations on productionalization of data to support models and decision systems. You are assertive and inquisitive in your journey to understand business objectives that can be fulfilled using advanced analytics and predictive modeling solutions.

Are you up to the challenge?

  • Provides on-going tracking and performance monitoring of decision systems and/or models pipelines/processors business rules notifications and articulating overall functionality needed by the business
  • Performs research and deep analysis on complex topics to drive value to the business (reduce cost increase revenue) and/or related to the support of business operations
  • Conducts exploratory data analysis and highly complex designs algorithm
  • Designs experiments tests hypotheses validates analysis identifies/creates appropriate algorithm and builds and deploys models
  • Applies advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to build maintain and improve on multiple real-time/near real-time decision systems
  • Leads discovery processes with institute stakeholders to identify business requirements and the expected outcome
  • Makes strategic recommendations on data collection integration and retention requirements incorporating business requirements and knowledge of best practices
  • Develops innovative and effective approaches to solve analytical problems and communicates results and methodologies; works in iterative processes with client and regularly validates findings
  • Uses a vast amount of programming tools / scripting languages to innovate and design new machine learning prototypes and solutions
  • Designs and builds self-service dashboards using a mixture of analytical and visualization techniques to derive actionable insight from the data to influence decision-making
  • Manage the data science portfolio and develop advanced analytics roadmap which supports Intelsat’s Managed Platform strategic priorities.
  • Architect develop and deploy AI/ML/DL solutions that can be integrated into business systems and/or applications to improve decisions and outcomes.
  • Educates the business on methodologies and approaches (hypothesis testing) statistical validation of results and model interpretability
  • Researches and maintains knowledge in emerging technologies and offers recommendations on the application to the business.

You should definitely have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Computer Engineering Information Systems or related technology
  • At least 3 years of relevant data processing experience and utilization of data management and cloud-based services
  • Experience with large scale data lake and data warehouse implementations on cloud
  • Significant experience with programming languages Scala Python Java SQL, etc.
  • Experience with web services API Integration and Data streaming
  • Experience with Metadata management and Data Governance
  • Ability to work autonomously and with small cross-functional teams
  • Strong communication skills including technical documentation development and delivery of demonstrations and presentations and the ability to listen and communicate effectively with functional leaders
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to make strategic recommendations
  • Ability to present technical information to a non-technical audience.

It would be nice if you had:

  • Satcom knowledge or experience
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools.

What it’s like to work with us:

Intelsat is connecting the world and transforming the satellite landscape by reaching beyond the traditional satellite industry. We are defining new solutions and new products that will open new, profitable markets. To help us reach this goal, you should be a bold thinker who will perform a key role in shaping Intelsat innovation for years to come.

  • We emphasize personal and professional growth
  • Awesome benefits including medical, tuition reimbursement, and training
  • Flexible Work Arrangements and Hybrid Work Policy of 3 days per week in office experience
  • Fun, diverse, and inclusive culture.

Other Job Info:

  • These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees assigned to this job
  • Job requires ability to sit for long periods of time.

As the foundational architects of satellite technology, Intelsat applies our expertise to develop breakthrough solutions that advance and secure boundless applications for our customers and partners.

At Intelsat, we increase human potential by connecting people, communities, businesses, and governments. Our employees enjoy a casual and collaborative environment, where we celebrate professional excellence in pursuit of the corporate mission. We hire skilled professionals who work in various areas such as: satellite engineering, network operations, cloud architecture, accounting, sales, legal, and more. If selected for a role at Intelsat, we may collect and share your PII for these purposes.
