Want to be a part of our team?

Directs the activities of the Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Data team responsible for the design, development, programming methods, processes and systems to consolidate and analyse structured and unstructured data sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for HR users across the company. Oversees the development of software programs, algorithms and automated processes that cleanse, integrate and evaluate data sets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies and communicates to stakeholders, meaningful, actionable insights from data and metadata sources. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel ensuring the efficient operation of the function.

Working at NTT

HRIS Data Product Owner is a people management role responsible for operationally managing Data Modelling and Analysis for HRIS. In addition to managing a team, this role will drive the adoption of HR Data Modelling and Analytics within NTT Ltd. The primary responsibility of this job is to ensure data-driven solutions that add HR business value using statistical models, machine learning algorithms, data mining, and visualization techniques are created and delivered.

Key roles and responsibilities:

  • Operationally manage a team of HR Data Analysts to ensure achievement of team objectives/KPIs
  • Collaborates with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive HR business solutions
  • Research, design, implement and deploy scalable HR data analytics vision and machine learning solutions to challenge complex business issues
  • Extends company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
  • Enhances data collection procedures to include HR information that is relevant for building analytic systems
  • Processes, cleanses, and verifies the integrity of data used for analysis, and building algorithms necessary to find meaningful answers
  • Performs analysis using programming languages or statistical packages such as Python and R etc.
  • Mines and analyzes data to drive optimization and improvement of HR business strategy
  • Architects scalable and highly available applications leveraging the latest tools and technologies
  • Creatively visualizes and effectively communicates results of data analysis, insights, and ideas in a variety of formats to key decision-makers within the business
  • Takes ideas to successful launch by leading and mentoring diverse, geo-distributed teams through innovation, bootstrapping, pilot, production, scaling, and maintenance phases with multiple stakeholders to the highest levels of quality and performance
  • Develops SQL Queries for reports and dashboards
  • Analyzes relational and transactional databases to provide data analysis, and present results in a clear manner
  • Creates documentation around processes and procedures and manage code reviews
  • Applies industry standards best practices to development activities
  • Works on data set to ensure solutions are successfully executed, within agreed upon time frames
  • Continuously coach and mentor team to understand and apply data to solve business solutions
  • Continuously ensure team remains abreast of latest technology and tools in the area of data science

Knowledge, skills and attributes:

  • Solid understanding of data management principles, including data governance, data quality, data integration, and data architecture
  • Subject matter expertise in data modelling
  • Theoretical understanding of statistical methods and machine learning techniques
  • Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
  • Excellent quantitative and qualitative analysis skills
  • Strong desire to acquire more knowledge to keep up to speed with the ever-evolving field of data science
  • Strong curiosity to sift through data to find answers and more insights
  • Solid understanding of the information technology industry within a matrixed organization and the typical business problems such organizations face
  • Ability to translate technical findings clearly and fluently to non-technical team business stakeholders to enable informed decision-making
  • Ability to create a storyline around the data to make it easy to interpret and understand
  • Theoretical understanding of statistical methods and machine learning techniques
  • Self-driven and able to work independently, yet acts as a team player
  • Able to apply data science principles through a business lens
  • Strong desire to create strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you
  • Ability to think strategically about how to use data to drive competitive advantages
  • Excellent leadership skills

Academic qualifications and certifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or related in a relevant field such Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science etc.
  • Relevant programming certification(s)
  • Agile certification preferable

What will make you a good fit for the role?

  • Solid understanding of data management principles, including data governance, data quality, data integration, and data architecture. Prior experience working with data in various formats (structured and unstructured) is valuable.
  • Experience in data analysis, including data modeling, statistical analysis, and data visualization, is valuable for understanding the intricacies of data products and making informed decisions.
  • Demonstrated experience leading and managing a team of data management / data scientists / data analysts.
  • Demonstrable experience with data warehouse and data lake technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT, and reporting/analytic tools
  • Experience with Agile Development Methodologies and Test-Driven Development
  • HR domain knowledge will be beneficial.

job_description:
NTT is a leading global IT solutions and services organisation that brings together people, data and things to create a better and more sustainable future.

In today’s ‘iNTTerconnected’ world, connections matter more now than ever. By bringing together talented people, world-class technology partners and emerging innovators, we help our clients solve some of the world’s most significant technological, business and societal challenges.

With people at the heart of our success, NTT is committed to attracting and growing the best talent and providing an environment where everyone feels they can belong and their contribution matters.


Want to be a part of our team?

Analyzes complex HR related business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.

Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences.

Constructs forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.

Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.

May provide consultation to users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.

May directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using system reporting tools.

May be internal operations-focused or external client-focused, working in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.

Working at NTT

HR Business Intelligence Analysts transform data into insights that drive HR business value using data analytics, data visualization, and data modeling techniques and technologies. They turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.
  • Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in relevant datasets to locate influences.
  • Constructs forecasts, recommendations and strategic/tactical plans based on business data and market knowledge.
  • Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
  • Define, develop, enhance and track metrics and dashboard requirements to deliver results and provide insight and recommendations on trends.
  • Uses advanced data analysis and tools to ensure analytics are valid, meaningful, and provide actionable and comprehensive insights.
  • Support the team to help them answer strategic questions, make insightful data-driven business decisions, and properly design new initiatives.
  • Provide technical advice, consultation, and knowledge to others within the relevant teams.
  • Provide support to address and resolve business issues.
  • Create relevant reports and present on trends
  • Analyze data across various platforms, including social media, and present trends and patterns.


Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Strong Excel skills
  • Detail-oriented
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to collaborate across multiple teams and build sound working relationships
  • Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
  • Understanding of current data protection and privacy laws

Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.


A career at NTT means:

  • Being part of a global pioneer – where you gain exposure to our Fortune 500 clients and world-leading global technology partners and work with a network of over 40,000 smart and diverse colleagues across 57 countries, delivering services in over 200 countries.

  • Being at the forefront of cutting-edge technology – backed with a 150-year heritage of using technology for good. With 40% of the world’s internet traffic running on our network and where Emoji were first invented, you can be proud of the group’s many new ‘firsts’.

  • Making a difference – by doing meaningful work that helps to shape the future for our clients, and across industries and communities around the world.

Company Description
-Join us at our Mototolo Complex as we are looking for a talented HRD Trainer who will be responsible for executing practical skills training and assessment including skills programmes for our teams.

You’ll look after our most important resource. Our people.

Anglo American has a portfolio of world-class mining operations. We mine, process, move and market the essential ingredients that enable a cleaner, more connected world and that meet fast growing consumer-driven demands for products from smartphones to electric cars. Our basic materials build homes, offices, railways and airports, and our diamonds fulfil people's dreams.

Platinum

Our Platinum business mines, processes and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium and osmium. We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialised applications that improve lives across the world – from vehicle fuel cells to jewellery; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining.


Job Description
-As the HRD Trainer Processing, you will have the opportunity to execute training and assessment in an unconstrained and constrained area. You will also ensure maintenance of applicable MQA accreditation criteria in a designated area to ensure compliance.

Your responsibilities will include the following:

  • Execute skills development for competency
  • Compliance to training and assessment with approved methodology and learning material
  • Training resources in compliance with best practice
  • Execute and deliver processing, generic, site-specific induction, equipment operating skills, ancillary and skills training
  • Progressive reports on predetermined targets for skills development

This role is in the Human Resource Department and is at a C3 level reporting to the HRD Officer.


Qualifications
-You will need the following:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent
  • NQF 4 OD ETDP Certificate
  • Assessor Certificate
  • Process Supervisor Development Programme Certificate (advantageous)

Experience:

  • 3 years production experience

Additional Requirements:

  • Fitness certificate
  • Computer literate
  • Drivers’ licence
  • English literacy

Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join Anglo American you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, but more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We are a large, successful multinational company – and we are still growing all the time.

Who we are

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

Background checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

As a Junior Investment Analyst, you will be working within our team of highly experienced, thought-leading, and

entrepreneurial-minded investment professionals. This is a key new role that intersects with all the functions

performed across our investment team, and through which you will be supported and empowered to develop

hands-on knowledge and expertise across multiple areas of our investment firm. We are manager of client

assets, a global investment advisor, and a provider of global fund manager research. In this role you will benefit

from hands-on exposure to both the local and offshore asset management industry. In addition, through

involvement in each area of our rigorous and institutional quality investment process, you will get the

opportunity to develop the expertise that will accelerate your growth as an investment professional.

The Role

The successful candidate will report to the Chief Investment Officer, and shall be responsible for assisting with

investment analytics, implementation, and the improvement of processes across the investment functions.

Investment analytics plays a pivotal role in our investment process, and the successful candidate will have a

broad range of responsibilities in this area, including quantitative analysis, data management and modelling,

and performance calculations and attribution analytics, all of which provide key inputs into various aspects of

the investment team’s processes. The role will contribute to the investment team’s research, asset allocation,

portfolio management, implementation, compliance and reporting activities.

Work Experience

The ideal candidate for this role will have 1 – 3 years’ experience within the financial services industry. Examples

of financial services industry experience would include the following:

  • Understanding of the investment environment and financial markets both local and international (incl.
CIS’s, ETF’s, equities, benchmarks)

  • Quantitative analysis (modelling, design and development)
  • Financial modelling
  • Development of analytical tools (incl. Excel, BI tools, proprietary tools)
  • Structuring and processing large amounts of data
  • Performance attribution analysis
  • Performance calculations
  • Portfolio mandate and regulatory compliance monitoring
  • Trade implementation
  • Trade life cycle management (incl. execution, confirmation and settlement)
  • Understanding of investment analysis metrics (incl. tracking error, standard deviation)
  • Compilation and delivery of investment reporting (to the investment team and clients)
  • Sourcing and maintenance of market data and data from 3rd parties
  • CIS operations (incl. asset and liability administration, Manco, trustees, custodians)
  • Design and implementation of internal process improvements
Qualifications and Skills

Qualifications and skills serve to provide the potential candidate with a strong foundation upon which to grow

and develop within this role. The type of qualifications and skills we are looking for include the following:

Degrees (or similar): Bachelor’s, Honours or Master’s degrees (fields incl. Actuarial Science; Finance;

Mathematics; Statistics; Computer Science; Investment Management)

Degree Results: Upper Second; First-Class; Deans Merit List

Additional Studies: Studying towards or completed CFA, CIPM, CFP or other fields of specialisation

Computer Skills: Proficient use of all MS Office applications (ability to use MS Excel is essential to succeed in this

role); Programming experience (e.g., SQL, Python, Java, C#, R); Experience with trade management, analytics,

and market data systems (e.g., Refinitiv, Bloomberg, Morningstar, FE Analytics)

To apply for this role please send your CV, ID and transcripts to operations@asearch.co.za

Associate 3: Enterprise Risk (Internal Audit)


Why should I work for EY in Risk?

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team up to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

Management and Boards of Directors rely heavily on Internal Audit to provide important proactive assessments and assurance around the effectiveness of controls and company processes, while also providing objective advisory support. You will be engaged in delivering some of the most significant and class-leading internal audit and risk engagements globally. As part of our market-leading global network of risk professionals, you will gain the valuable experience you need to become a successful risk advisor. At EY, we recognize that it is the perspectives, skills and enthusiasm you bring to our clients that makes the difference.


Job purpose

As Associate3 in Enterprise Risk (Internal Audit), you will make a significant technical contribution to client engagements and internal projects. Within your role, you will actively establish, maintain and strengthen internal and external relationships.

Working closely with colleagues, you will confirm whether the work plan is properly executed, documented and concluded in compliance with EY's guidelines.


Your client responsibilities

  • Work effectively as a team member, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining communication and updating senior team members on progress.
  • Assign and manage tasks with other team members considering engagement needs and identified business outcomes, and organize own work such that important items get done first.
  • Build strong internal relationships within EY and with other services across the organization.
  • Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel.
  • Research client industry, company structure, key customers and suppliers and possible insight into operations and the various processes.
  • Manage own time in line with budgets
  • Preparing business process descriptions through interviews with the client and documenting understanding of business process and confirm the business process descriptions by performing a walkthrough of the process.
  • Identifying possible business risks and control weaknesses from the business processes under review.
  • Drafting detailed audit programmes to test controls in place.
  • Assessment of design and implementation of key controls as well as the operating effectiveness, accuracy and validity thereof.
  • Identify basic data analytic procedures
  • Compilation of working papers substantiating scope and results of testing.
  • Provide a coaching / mentoring role.
  • Draft individual sections of documents and presentations to explain issues and solution options and implications.
  • Display a logical thought process in understanding client challenges and exploring possible solutions.
  • Identify and escalate potential risks and issues to project manager along with suggested preventive or mitigating actions.
  • Draft audit findings for review by EY Management.


Your people responsibilities

  • Act as a visible role model for our people.
  • Coach and mentor junior team members.
  • Give honest supportive feedback to colleagues.
  • Take personal responsibility for own performance and career development.
  • Play an active role in EY and Service line team activities.
  • Understand and follow workplace policies and procedures.


Technical skills requirements

  • Must have Honours in Internal Audit, Accounting, Business, Finance or other related field
  • CIA or part CIA will be an added benefit
  • Minimum of 3 years of related work experience
  • Related audit or applicable business experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft office (including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint).


Additional skills requirements

  • Strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Demonstrated integrity, values, principles, and work ethic.
  • Enquiring Mind
  • Analytical
  • Self-starter
  • Team Player
  • Share EY’s values and vision
  • Disciplined
  • Able to handle pressure
  • Team building ability
  • Good communication skills

ABOUT THE ROLE -

Business analysts are responsible for bridging the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders. BA work with organisations to help them improve their processes and systems. They conduct research and analysis in order to come up with solutions to business problems and help to introduce these systems to businesses and their clients.


The role reports to the BI Manager

  • Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
  • Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimisation strategies.
  • Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernise systems.
  • Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
  • Performing requirements analysis.
  • Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
  • Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
  • Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
  • Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
  • Providing leadership, training, coaching, and guidance to junior staff.
  • Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency.
  • Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
  • Performing user acceptance testing.
  • Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
  • Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures.
  • Prioritising initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
  • Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
  • Managing competing resources and priorities.
  • Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.


ABOUT YOU:

  • 2 to 3 years experience in data driven projects
  • 2 to 3 years experience in SQL development projects
  • Strong handle of:
  • Project management skills
  • Must be able to set tasks with deadlines and work towards delivering within timeframes
  • Strong cross-functional skills (matrix structure)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Retail / commercial experience favourable


Some additional perks you’ll get access to...

  • Apple equipment: To set our teammates up for success we make sure you’ve got everything you need to work effectively.
  • Learning and development: Access to a Learning Management System to enable teammates to attend courses, conferences, and training events.
  • Social events: Fun and regular company events to relax and connect with teammates.

Data Visualisation Developer and Consultant

Reporting to: Director of Data, Analytics and Digital Engineering

Location: Port Elizabeth, South Africa

Working Hours: 40 hours per week

Purpose of the role

The focus of this role is to deliver data visualisation, manipulation and consolidation projects using a variety of solutions within the Microsoft Power Platform and Azure Cloud Solutions. To work within a highly progressive and collaborative team consisting of technical and commercial colleagues to deliver services and projects for our clients.

The role will include both internal data work and external client data work to mature ourselves into a data driven organisation as well as create lasting impact for our clients. The role will work directly with the Director of Data Analytics and Digital Engineering to scope work and deliver true lasting change.

We are seeking passionate and enthusiastic Data Visualisation experts at all levels who are excited by empowering decision making with data, and keen to take an active part in the growth of the company.

About Zenzero

We are a dynamic and fast-growing company that truly values and is reliant upon our people, our culture and our commitment to excellence. Being the best means having the best people, and getting the best people means being the best place to work.

If you think you are a result oriented, positive self-starter, then Zenzero is the place for you.

We like to laugh, we like to do things together and among all the challenges of growing a fast-paced business, we promote people being themselves, allowing them to focus on outcomes and substance rather than form.

Client Delivery

You will be using your experience to help our clients solve their most important data challenges. You would also be responsible for supporting the growth of our team, helping them to build the skills they need to solve our client’s challenges.

Typical projects and services include:

  • Developing dashboards and reports for senior management to better understand and track business operations

  • Design and implement new data pipelines to enable the unification of multiple data sources and build business logic to enable reporting across an organisation

  • Performing maturity assessments across our clients’ data analytics capability, providing guidance on how to better utilise and leverage data, using your experience and industry best-practices to form recommendations

  • Appling advanced data analytics techniques to generate new insights and answer questions such as how a client could generate more revenue or how they could increase customer satisfaction

  • Upskilling client teams in data modelling, how to tell stories with data and how to create meaningful and insightful reporting

  • Deploying and on-boarding new data visualisation/ETL software for a client to enhance their analytical capability

We do not expect you to be an expert in all areas and we understand that experiences vary based on the background and years of experience.

Below we list some of the skills we are looking for:

  • Be inquisitive about how data can be used to solve business problems and better understand the world around us

  • Expertise in data visualisations and telling stories with data

  • Experience in a at least one visualisation tool such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.

  • Experience creating ETL pipelines in tools such as SQL, Alteryx, Python, etc.

  • Knowledge of optimal design of data structures and models to enable end-to-end reporting

  • Strong interpersonal skills and able to develop great relationships with stakeholders

  • Comfortable capturing business requirements and successfully delivering end to end analysis

  • A desire to use data to drive transformation in our clients, whether that be improving operational performance, reducing risk, growing their customer base or improving service levels

  • Excellent written and verbal communication, with the ability to develop clear requirements and specifications and communicate complex technical information to both technical and non-technical colleagues.

Growth and development

  • Promotion is solely based on your own performance, and we give you every opportunity to progress though our Personal Development and Personal Review Plans

  • You decide on the training you need. We invest in you, to ensure you remain the best in the business, through formal training, coaching, and mentoring. We have a training points system to give you the flexibility to either use days off or a set budget for further education.

What can Zenzero offer you?

  • Our projects offer you the ability to deliver tangible benefits for clients whilst developing both your softer skills (i.e., through exposure to senior stakeholders across a wide range of industries) and technical capacities (i.e., through hands on experience on several leading products and tools in the data space).

  • Lastly, we recognise the importance of work-life balance and we know that the ‘ideal’ balance will vary from person to person and will change at different stages of our working lives. If you require flexible working, please talk to one of our recruiters about the flexibility you may need.

Role Specification

Knowledge

Essential

  • Knowledge of PowerBI dashboards and reporting.

  • Knowledge of best practice in data modelling.

  • An understanding of SQL databases.

  • Knowledge of the capabilities of MS Power Platform

Desirable

  • Data engineering from source systems to databases and API integration

  • Microsoft Solution Architecture of Power Platform

  • Knowledge of best practise in project delivery

  • Knowledge of the ISO27001 and ISO9001.

Experience

Essential

  • Experience in delivering project work to clients

  • Experience of working with clients to build requirements for data visualisations

  • Experience in working with the Microsoft Power Platform

  • Experience of working in a collaborative team

Desirable

  • Experience of small – medium enterprise market

  • Experience of scoping data projects and being able to estimate effort

  • Experience of coaching and/or providing training to colleagues in your field of expertise

Essential Skills

  • Ability to communicate effectively and manage expectations of clients

  • Ability to lead a project and work as part of a team

  • Ability to converse at ease with customers and colleagues as well as provide advice

  • Ability to keep learning from others and through specified training

Essential Leadership Competencies

Ability to take the initiative - Seeing something that needs to be done and stepping up to complete and finish the task, with minimal direction from others.

Ability to make decisions - Forming sound, evidence-based judgements, making choices, assessing risks, and taking accountability for results.

Resilience - Being flexible and adapting positively, to sustain performance when the situation changes, workload increases, tensions rise or priorities shift.

A stakeholder focus - Consulting with, listening to, and understanding the needs of those who your work impacts, and using this knowledge to shape what we do and to manage others’ expectations.

A commitment to excellence - Setting high standards for oneself and others, guiding, motivating, and developing them, to achieve high performance.

Bitfinex is looking for a skilled and experienced Marketing Project Manager to lead the planning, coordination and implementation of a fast moving and changing marketing agenda, for one of the longest-running,most resilient and successful crypto exchanges.


The successful candidate will have 5-10 years experience working in marketing on multiple projects running in parallel with different stakeholders, with competing interests and demands.


He/she will also be responsible for monitoring and measuring the success of campaigns and be skilled in presenting projects to relevant stakeholders and review analytics and results with a view to continued optimisation of marketing activities.

The Marketing Project Manager will also manage the meeting agenda for the marketing team and set daily, weekly and monthly priorities to support the growth and execution of the marketing strategy. You will also be expected to also to support ongoing operational marketing for new products and features such as landing pages, announcements, educational blog posts etc.


Bitfinex is one of the longest running crypto exchanges and the most resilient. It is guided by a mission to deliver Financial Freedom to communities, cities and countries around the world. The successful candidate would be expected to have an interest and understanding of cryptocurrency and how to help in positioning Bitfinex as a leader in its industry.

Orion Hotels & Resorts (South Africa) seeks a talented and enthusiastic individual to join our team as a Junior Marketing Manager. The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for marketing, excellent creativity, and the ability to think analytically. They will work alongside the marketing team to support various marketing campaigns, develop strategies, and assist in managing day-to-day marketing operations. The Junior Marketing Manager will report to the CEO of the Hotels Division and play a vital role in driving brand awareness and achieving marketing goals.

Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with the marketing team to create, implement, and optimize marketing strategies across multiple channels, both online and offline.
  • Assist in coordinating and executing marketing campaigns, including creating marketing materials, writing copy, and coordinating with external vendors.
  • Conduct market research to identify target audience trends, preferences, and competitors' activities to help inform marketing strategies.
  • Monitor and analyze marketing campaign performance data to provide actionable insights and recommendations for improvement.
  • Manage the company's social media accounts, including content creation, scheduling, and engagement to enhance brand presence and customer interaction.
  • Assist in organizing and attending events, trade shows, and exhibitions to represent the company and promote its products and services.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as sales and hotel teams to ensure consistent brand messaging and effective communication.
  • Stay updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in marketing to identify new opportunities for growth.
  • Support the CEO: Hotels Division in budget management, tracking expenses, and ensuring marketing activities align with allocated funds.
  • Contribute to the development and execution of email marketing campaigns, newsletters, and other customer communication efforts.

Minimum Requirements:
  • Grade 12 or equivalent qualification.
  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field.
  • At least 3 (three) years previous experience in marketing, advertising, or a similar role.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to write compelling copy.
  • Proficient in using marketing tools and platforms, including social media management tools, Google Analytics, and email marketing software.
  • Familiarity with SEO techniques and content marketing strategies.
  • Basic design skills and knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite or similar tools is a plus.
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret and derive insights from marketing data.
  • Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.
  • Creative thinker with the ability to generate innovative ideas to enhance marketing efforts.
  • Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
  • Strong organizational and multitasking skills, with excellent attention to detail.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and CRM software.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with customers and colleagues at all levels.

Should you apply for this vacancy and your skills and experience DO NOT match the inherent REQUIREMENTS of this position, YOUR APPLICATION WILL BE IMMEDIATELY DELETED. job_description:
Bring your possibility to life! Define your career with us
With over 100 years of rich history and strongly positioned as a local bank with regional and international expertise, a career with our family offers the opportunity to be part of this exciting growth journey, to reset our future and shape our destiny as a proudly African group.
Job Summary
The CIB Data Enablement team within CIB Transactional Banking Tech is looking for a Lead Data Engineer.
Job Description
Leveraging a thorough understanding of the business data requirements & own data subject matter expertise (ahead of trend), set data architecture direction & lead the agile solution design, deployment, implementation & ongoing optimization of enterprise wide data retrieval, storage and distribution across an estate.
Contribute, design and drive book of work for CIB with regards to our Enterprise Library Architecture Strategy.
Analyse and Optimise Data, Source Systems, Principles and Patterns to ensure Data Quality and Maturity.
Implement a data-led culture within the organization with clear accountability and ownership.
Collaboration with Data Engineering to adopt and derive value from current services through advice, guidance and appropriate governance.
Support Data Engineering by translating data-related policies and standards into clear requirements for implementation by all affected teams.
Continuously improve the Data Management and Data Governance capabilities by providing both oversight and serving as Subject Matter Expert for CIB.
Key Accountabilities:
  • Accountable for providing expert advice to inform the effective implementation of data-related policies and controls, striving to create a single data management framework for the related services to be effective
  • Develop and maintain policies, standards and best practice guidelines for adoption of data governance and data management services provided to the bank by Data Engineering
  • Develop and maintain standards and best practice guidelines for Data Engineering to remain compliant with bank policies and assurance requirements

    • Foster a culture of adding value to the bank and continuous improvement

    • Stakeholder management, including communication and improvement areas
    • Define and maintain the operating model for data management services and the required governance for consistent use across the group
    • Analysis of System data to make informed decisions, and implement strategies for Data Management

  • Compliance, risk and Data Management fields

  • Communication, facilitation and negotiation
  • Stakeholder management and change management fundamentals
  • A structured approach to solving complex problems
  • Impactful leadership and collaboration
  • Data security
  • Data retention and destruction
  • Data management, including quality, metadata, reference data and master data
  • Data governance
  • Risk management

display_title: Strategic Information/ Monitoring, Evaluating and Learning Advisor
job_description:
Experience : 5-7 years
Panagora Group is a social enterprise dedicated to providing high-quality, high-impact international health, development, and learning consulting. We are a dynamic woman- and employee-owned small business partner focused on market-based and integrated local solutions that strengthen country capacity and independence; and on learning, communications, and technology solutions to accelerate and heighten impact. As a small business, we are able to implement novel and innovative approaches using highly participatory approaches to mobilize community, civil society, and government energy in defining and owning solutions, and to promote inclusive development that benefits all groups.


Position Summary

Background
The Technical Support Services (TSS) Activity helps USAID/Southern Africa and Regional Health Office (RHO) to address technical priorities and develop creative, innovative solutions to strategically allocate resources, strengthen connections with partners, and replicate best practices and effective program models. Through the TSS contract, Panagora Group augments capacity by providing technical, operational, and administrative support to USAID’s largest health portfolio. TSS deploys advisors in response to USAID requests for priority work with government stakeholders, implementing partners, and/or other entities. TSS supports Health Office staff and teams to integrate creative solutions into routine work. TSS also provides international and local expertise for surge support, as needed, for USAID Program Cycle requirements, planning, development, outreach, communications, and Health Office human resource functions.


Description of Position :
The USAID/Southern Africa Regional Health Office (RHO) based at USAID/Southern Africa in Pretoria seeks a Regional Strategic Information/ Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (SI/MEL) Advisor who will join RHO’s technical advisory services platform to advance the implementation of the U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) programs across the Southern Africa region. RHO has technical Advisors in HIV Care and Treatment; TB; OVC and HIV Prevention in Adolescent and Young Women; Digital Health; primary health care and integrated service provision; and in Localization and Sustainability. The SI/MEL Advisor plays a lead role in strengthening the RHO technical advisory services platform through advancing PEPFAR strategic information and monitoring, evaluation, and learning approaches across the USAID Southern Africa region .


The SI/MEL Advisor drives regional data analytic initiatives and provides country specific support to PEPFAR monitoring and evaluation activities and strategic information teams, when called upon, especially during peak work cycles such as during preparation and submission of the Country Operational Plans (COPs) and during quarterly program performance reporting cycles. S/he engages in all aspects of data analyses for effective program planning, including assistance with UNAIDS EPP/Spectrum modeled estimates; assisting with routine program performance reporting, including quarterly, semi-annual, and annual PEPFAR reports, portfolio reviews; assistance with surveillance studies, Demographic Health Surveys (DHS) PHIAs, size-estimations, and other special studies.


Under the supervision of RHO’s Team Lead for Program Analytics, or his/her designate, the major duties and responsibilities for this position will include but not be limited to:


Strategic Information Support to USAID Missions teams (50%)

  • Lead quarterly, semi-annual, and annual performance reports to understand USAID/PEPFAR program performance across the region.
  • Provide strategic information support to USAID Missions and host country stakeholders in the region across program planning and implementation cycles.
  • Provide guidance and support to USAID/PEPFAR implementing partners and government counterparts to develop and implement program monitoring, evaluation, and learning plans
  • Strengthen the cap acity of USAID/PEPFAR implementing partners and government counterparts in using data to inform policy and programmatic decisions.
  • Provide guidance and support to USAID/PEPFAR implementing partners in the development and implementation of program/project/activity Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning Plans
  • Advise USAID Missions teams on specific measurement techniques appropriate for their programs/projects/activities, including reviewing partner activity work plans and monitoring plans to ensure relevant and effective performance measures, and defining indicators that appropriately measure anticipated outcomes and results.
  • Assist in the development, implementation, and analysis related to special studies, surveys, and surveillance activities, including both qualitative and quantitative studies, such as demographic health surveys (DHS), population-based HIV impact assessments (PHIAs), violence against children surveys (VACS), Integrated HIV Bio-behavioral surveillance survey (IBBS), etc.
  • Work with country SI leads to ensure that survey and surveillance findings and performance data are integrated into program decision-making and partner work plans.
  • Provide mentorship to RHO technical staff and RHO client country staff on MEL concepts, processes, and design, including novel analytical approaches to advance data use for decision making.

Regional Leadership and Knowledge Management (35%)

  • Develop data-driven products, requiring independent analysis and interpretation on regional health outcomes for informational, advocacy, and coordination purposes; prepare visually compelling briefs and presentations with findings and recommendations.
  • Develop effective implementation approaches to institutionalize high quality monitoring, evaluation, and reporting across RHO client countries in the region.
  • Facilitate knowledge sharing and transfer across regional program and strategic information teams to improve analytic approaches, facilitate uptake of best practices, and inform new strategies.
  • Identify and disseminate best practices in data visualization and data storytelling.
  • Represent USAID, as appropriate , on relevant technical working groups and in technical discussions on issues related to strategic information approaches.
  • Organize and share epidemiological and programmatic data, analyses, and tools with USG partners and other international organizations in the region e.g.: UNAIDS, Global Fund, International Organization for Migration (IOM).
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the RHO Director and/or RHO Deputy Director.

Collaboration and Continuous Learning (15%)

  • Maintain effective working relationships with colleagues in USAID Global Health Bureau’s Office of HIV/AIDS (OHA’s) Strategic Information Evaluation and Informatics (SIEI) division, as well as RHO client country SI teams to keep abreast of evolving SI related needs across USAID programs.
  • Keep abreast of current public health literature, reports, international guidelines, standards, and best practices; Attend courses, seminars, conferences, or participate in other learning and professional development opportunities related to the core job function and needed to maintain and update professional knowledge.
  • Attend and/or present at regional meetings, conferences on SI, epidemiology, and other relevant topics.
  • Work closely with relevant regional multilateral and bilateral stakeholders to identify opportunities for collaboration and coordination of strategic information activities at the regional level.
  • Other activities as assigned.



Requirements

Qualifications:

  • A Master’s degree in a social science e.g.: Epidemiology, Public Health, Public Health Informatics, Statistics, mathematics,
  • I n-depth , professional-level knowledge of methods for performance analysis, data visualization, and program design, monitoring, and evaluation required .
  • A dvanced quantitative and qualitative data management and data-analysis skills, and advanced knowledge of MS Excel and applications such as, DATIM/DHIS2, Stata or SPSS or SAS or R, EPP/Spectrum, ArcGIS and Tableau required .
  • Knowledge of principles, theories, methods, and procedures of statistical analysis and research design, related to epidemiology and biostatistics.
  • Exceptional Data storytelling skills, including the ability to develop a compelling narrative based on complex data and analytics to help tell, influence or inform a particular audience.
  • Able to communicate effectively, both verbally and visually, to high level decision-makers on technical matters, including topics that may be outside of his/her area of expertise.
  • F amiliarity with program monitoring and reporting in resource-poor environments with varying levels of health information systems maturity required .
  • Demonstrate understanding PEPFAR monitoring and evaluation and reporting (MER) guidance, including ability to exercise considerable ingenuity in applying new and evolving reporting guidelines and novel analytical approaches across different settings.
  • Demonstrate ability to resolve problems that arise by determining the approaches and methodologies to be used, and to make defensible judgments under such circumstances.
  • Able to provide technical advisory services and technical assistance to USAID Operating Units on PEPFAR SI practices, including completion of various operational planning and reporting tools, such as the FAST, End of Fiscal Year reporting, Facts Info, and PEPFAR Next Gen tools, as well as implementation and analysis of Data Quality Assessment (DQA) Methodologies and Site Inspection and Monitoring Systems (SIMS).
  • Demonstrate leadership and coordination skills, including ability to deal effectively and diplomatically with a variety of stakeholders, including multiple U.S. government agencies, implementing partners (IPs) - international and local - multilateral organizations, and other donors.
  • Familiarity with USAID program/project management cycles to assist with program design, implementation, and the achievement of results in the course of providing technical assistance .
  • Understanding of development problems in the health sector in the region.
  • Ab le to respond professionally and adjust in fluid situations to meet deadlines in the face of competing priorities and time pressures.
  • Able to travel regularly (up to 60% LOE) within the southern Africa region and beyond, as required.
  • Excellent verbal and written English language skills.
  • Proven capacity to take the initiative and willingness to learn new skills as needed.
  • Strong work ethic and the ability to work well independently and as part of a multidisciplinary, culturally diverse team.

Work Experience:

  • Five years of progressively responsible job-related professional-level experience in monitoring, evaluation, and learning (MEL) and other surveillance systems, evaluation of program/project/activity implementation, in direct program/project/activity management, or in a closely related activity is required . At least two years of this experience in a development-oriented workplace, or a related field, for USAID, other donor agencies, host-country organizations, or private-sector institutions, which included project design, performance monitoring, and/or the analysis and interpretation of large amounts of data, is required .
  • Proven experience with data collection, analyses, and reporting, including project management experience related to conceptualization and design of complex data-related activities and initiatives.
  • Demonstrated experience working with clients on executing complex projects that involve data collection, data cleaning/wrangling, and analysis, including improving client’s ability to use, present, analyze, and communicate with data.
  • Demonstrated experience in interpreting research and evaluations for a wide audience, and effectively applying and translating findings into effective practice.
  • Experience exercising a high degree of judgment in providing guidance and assistance to a wide variety of high-level professionals, including ability to independently plan, prioritize, and carry out context specific activities and deliverables.
  • Demonstrated experience in technical and strategic information needs related to USAID’s development programs and approaches, preferably related to HIV/AIDS prevention, care, and treatment in sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Demonstrated experience in building and maintaining effective relationships, building consensus within diverse teams, and fostering cooperation among constituents with diverse viewpoints and perspectives.

No telephone inquiries, please. Finalists will be contacted. Please include a cover letter and resume. Only applicants who include the required application components will be considered.


Panagora Group is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.


  • Note: Panagora does not offer visa sponsorship.

Master's Degree

display_title: Associate Director Quality Assurance - GCP Clinical Trials - Based in South Africa
job_description:

  • Serve as the QA Contact for assigned internal/external customers and IQVIA functional areas

REQUIREMENTS

  • Strong knowledge of pharmaceutical research and development processes and regulatory environments.

  • Considerable knowledge of quality assurance processes and procedures'.

  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to positively influence and guide others.

  • Excellent problem solving, risk analysis and negotiation skills.
