Discovery Life
Product Analyst

About Discovery
Discovery’s core purpose is to make people healthier and to enhance and protect their lives. We seek out and invest in exceptional individuals who understand and support our core purpose, and whose own values align with those of Discovery. Our fast-paced and dynamic environment enables smart, self-driven people to be their best. As global thought leaders, Discovery is passionate about innovating in order to not only achieve financial success, but to ignite positive and meaningful change within our society.

About Discovery Life
Discovery Life is an ever growing fast-paced and dynamic environment that provides innovative risk assurance to individual clients. This environment thrives on customer engagement and customer experience as well as mutually beneficial relationships with our brokers and other stakeholders. It is important for our employees to provide a world class service to our internal and external clients, thereby ensuring long and sustainable relationships.

Key Purpose

As a Product Analyst you will work hand-in-hand with the Product Development Team, Systems Architects, Systems Development, Business Analysts and Business operations teams to steer and guide the process of developing new and improved products from conception to launch. Success in this role hinges on your technical aptitude, quantitative abilities, and business acumen.

Areas of responsibility may include but not limited to:
  • Assist the Product Specialist, Senior Business Architect or Enterprise Architect to define the priority of work and ensure delivery of work within defined timeline and ensure implementation meets business objectives.

  • Assist the Product specialist, and at times be the product lead of, cross functional development teams for a component of a new product or feature or of an entire small project, and contribute to new product or feature implementation.

  • Work with various stakeholders including Actuarial, Systems Development, Business, Marketing, Graphics-and-usability experts to ensure great member experience in product or feature enhancements.

  • Conduct root cause analysis and investigation of production defects to ensure that Discovery Life systems operate efficiently.

  • Update and, at times document, product specifications for small projects relating to implementation of new or enhancements to existing products or features.

  • Collaborate, negotiate and co-ordinate with various stakeholders to produce and sign off Product requirements documents to ensure product requirements are developed and improved.

  • Ensure all products or features are designed to optimise self-servicing and are operationally efficient.
  • Be aware of Life business, customer experience, digital and innovations in this field to act as a consultant to guide Life’s new product or feature experience and enhance Life’s current product suite to achieve strategic outcomes.

  • Develop knowledge of Life’s product offering and assess the impact of new products or features to the greater Life business.

  • Contribute to formal and informal research to assist in product or feature design and refinement.

  • Review test packs for testing of business requirements.

  • Report and provide regular updates on progress to stakeholders to manage delivery of Product initiatives.

  • Adherence to the agreed Systems Development Life cycle (SDLC) and standards for Systems development and automation.

  • Assist and at times, facilitate Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions with stakeholders and present solutions for new products or product enhancements.

Education and Experience

Essential:
  • Matric
  • Tertiary Education, preferably B Comm. (IS) or BSC (preferably in Information Systems or Actuarial Studies)

Advantageous:
  • Minimum 1 to 2 years Product Analysis or Product Systems development experience within the Life Insurance Industry.
  • IT or development training or certifications

Technical Skills and Knowledge

Essential:
    • MS Office Suite (expert)
    • SQL (Intermediate)
    • Data Analytics
    • Business Analysis
    • System Analysis
    • Excellent Communication skills
    • Decision making skills
    • System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
    • Knowledge of the Life Insurance Industry
    • Enterprise Architect tool

Advantageous

  • Unified Modelling language (UML)
  • Programming – Oracle/ Java/ Delphi/ C++
  • Integration modelling/exposure in the Discovery Group
  • Exposure to strategic planning

Knowledge of:
  • Life insurance business and systems
  • Discovery Life Product

Organon is a Women’s Health Company that believes in a better and healthier every day for every woman! We are a passionate, global community of thousands dedicated to redefining the future of women’s health. Our mission is to deliver impactful medicines and solutions for a healthier every day. But what really makes it work at Organon is our people.

We’re looking for real, passionate team players, curious innovators, forward thinkers, empowered by the idea of shaping their career, and ready to bring their fire to embrace change and the opportunities it brings for progress.

At Organon, you’ll get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the open, agile, collaborative culture of a start-up, and operating at the scale of a Fortune 500 company with an international footprint that serves people in more than 140 markets.

It’s going to be an exciting future—come be a part of it!

Purpose

The Business Analytics & KPIs Specialist is responsible for taking the data that Organon holds and mining it to achieve valuable insights, which are used to inform critical business decisions and shape the company's future and the way it operates. The Business Analytics & KPIs Specialist will utilise internal and external data sources to achieve the key deliverables, including key metrics and KPI’s to measure performance against target and against the market. The individual will also partner with key stakeholders to deliver actionable visualized analysis, to the right people, at the right time, to enable the business to make the right decisions.

Primary Responsibility

  • Engage all business stakeholders to assess their business intelligence and analytics needs, and develop a program to address the needs.
  • Proactively provide fact-based insights and analytics to address strategic and tactical business needs.
  • Utilize secondary research methods and industry resources to provide business intelligence.
  • Upgrade and maintain existing BI platform based on business need and cooperate with IT and vendors to deliver KPI metrics and metrics analysis including static slides and spreadsheets as well as interactive, live dashboards using an array of tools, e.g., Spotfire, Qlik, Power BI etc.
  • Assesses market strategies by analyzing related products, markets, or trends Provide reliable and accurate reports, analyses and recommendations to business leaders to support decision making on company strategies and present to and advise senior management on strategic decisions when required.
  • Ensure data is well maintained, stored and organized, enabling business stakeholders to leverage data efficiently and accurately in a timely manner.
  • Ensure a single view of the business.
  • Work with internal stakeholders to understand, improve and monitor the data collection.
  • Understand complex data and finding data patterns in different sources.
  • Create solid statistical predictive models and innovative visualizations.
  • Ensure the use cases are in line with business objective and priority.
  • Ensure use cases are operated in time and communicated professionally.
  • Be able to communicate about highly complex data topics in easy and understandable ways.
  • Support data modelling and sourcing data.
  • Roll out a data governance framework, with a focus on improvement of data quality through standards, governance metrics, processes, related tools and data architecture.
  • Understanding customer engagement strategy and define KPI measurement to track the business impact.
  • Integrate with complex data sets and combine data from multiple sources to investigate useful business insight.
  • Coordinate with vendor and IT team to offer a qualified customer engagement dashboard.
  • Develop reporting, toolkits, and dashboards for Marketing, Sales, Commercial Learning teams to optimize campaign plans across digital and offline channels.
  • Collect feedback from Marketing, Sales, Commercial Learning teams to define new data analytics requirements.
  • Lead user acceptance testing, to ensure a good user experience.
  • Regular review digital campaign performance and business insights with MCM team, assist to improve digital campaign plan.
  • Maintains current knowledge of industry and business trends through communication with professional organizations, suppliers, customers, competitors, and other informed individuals.
  • Summarizes financial and economic data reports for review by executives, managers, clients, and stakeholders.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
  • Develop methodologies to improve data analysis.
  • Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solution.
  • Develop and manage BI solutions.
  • Identify development needs in order to improve and streamline operations.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Honours degree in business, marketing, statistics, mathematics, or related field is required.
  • Ability to code and write programs.
  • Related industry experience with a minimum 5 years analytical experience.
  • Expert in handling and analysing various data sources (e.g., in-mkt sales, IQVIA data…)
  • Commercial business intelligence tool report creation experience required, e.g.: Spotfire, QlikView, Cognos, or Tableau.
  • Experience within Agile software development teams.
  • Effective knowledge of databases, SQL and Minitab.

Organon Leadership Behaviors

  • INSPIRES GROWTH- Creating an environment that values growth and individual strengths, coaching and bringing up others to drive engagement and support career development.
  • COMMUNICATES WITH OPTIMISM AND AUTHENTICITY - Cultivating an engaged, mission driven workplace with transparency and empathy that differentiates Organon leaders.
  • MAKES CONNECTIONS - Acting in the best interests of the whole and having a holistic view of what is needed at the enterprise level, going beyond collaboration to integration.
  • INNOVATES WITH AGILITY - Having an entrepreneurial mindset that elevates performance through new and improved ways of working. Enabling decision-making while understanding risk and ensuring progress over perfection.
  • DELIVERS WITH ACCOUNTABILITY - Making ownership in setting and effectively delivering stretch goals in a sustainable and ethical way, always rising together to the challenge when problems and opportunities appear.
  • ACTIVATES BELONGING - Driving a culture of belonging and an environment of psychological safety, fueled by curiosity of difference and grounded in optimism and respect.

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

The digital age is bringing rapid change. Businesses are becoming increasingly interconnected, and borders around supply/value chains are becoming increasingly blurred.


A key part of our purpose is building trust in society. We provide decision makers with information they can trust and give our clients confidence in an unpredictable world. We use cutting-edge technology to provide market-leading services for our clients, both in person and virtually.


There are two sides to Digital Audit:


Digital Auditing - You’ll be using our latest tools to help digitise the way we deliver audits through automation, AI, data analytics and innovation. You will also use PwC-developed tools and industry-leading software to audit our clients.


Auditing Digital - You’ll be auditing our client’s technology to give them assurance that security and controls are in place. This includes infrastructure, Cloud, and applications. You’ll gain an understanding of end- to- end processes and how business applications are utilised, controlled and optimised.


Digital Audit will give you a unique opportunity to experience all aspects of the audit from finance to technology. You’ll develop a strong understanding of the role that digital plays in the modern-day audit and how new technologies are deployed and controlled within business. In practice, you’ll understand and test IT systems and controls, deliver technology-enabled audits including the latest on advanced analytics, process control and automation and the use of innovative tools.


At PwC, we recognise the importance of IT Risk Assurance as a key enabler in organisations. Our digital trust professionals work closely with IT, the business, compliance, audit and risk functions to help businesses meet their objectives by managing and optimising risks through the use of technology. We offer a three-year graduate programme, during which you will receive on-site training and valuable real business work experience. We’re looking for talented, business ‘tech-savvy’, curious and skilled graduates who can bring new ideas and a fresh approach to IT Risk Assurance.


What will you be doing?


You’ll have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients, industries and technologies.


You’ll need to be a people person, tenacious and resilient. You’ll have exposure to contacts such as financial controllers, heads of IT or finance directors to understand and test IT systems and controls. You’ll be checking IT systems to ensure they are appropriately controlled by management and to check that data produced is accurate, highlighting and questioning any differences. It's investigative work where you’ll regularly speak with clients, using in-person meetings or leading-edge collaborative technology.


You’ll be part of a variety of teams, taking real responsibility for the work you do. Your reviews may include:


  • Identifying key risks and controls, controls optimisation, including the configuration of controls around security, business process and within IT environments;

  • Applying internal control principles and business/technical knowledge including information technology general controls and application controls; financial reporting concepts; working experience applying professional skepticism skills;

  • Leading the adaption a work programme and practice aid, as well as performing assessments, using PwC’s proprietary or other relevant tools to evaluate controls, security, SOD, and potential for optimisation;

  • Exhibiting project management skills, including developing project plans, budgets, and deliverable schedules;

  • Creating a positive environment, monitoring workloads of the team while meeting client expectations, and respecting the work-life quality of team members. This includes providing candid, meaningful feedback in a timely manner and keeping leadership informed of progress;

  • Interacting with clients on solutions and executing projects on client engagements, forming client relationships and demonstrating an understanding of the client's business;

  • Review of financial and operational business process controls;

  • Review of IT general controls;

  • Infrastructure and database security reviews;

  • Compliance with other regulatory requirements;

  • Due diligence on systems and controls;

  • Pre- and post-implementation system reviews;

  • Computer security reviews;

  • Privacy and protection of personal information;

  • Outsourced and Co-sourced Internal Audit Engagements;

  • Governance, Risk and Compliance reviews;

  • Performance Audits and Audit of predetermined objectives;

  • Work on ERP (SAP, Oracle, etc.) projects - assessing risk, identifying and testing controls and assisting clients to develop and implement solutions such as GRC; and

  • Cyber security/IT Audit/Data Analytics.


Requirements

A university degree (preferably with honours) in:


  • Computer Science, BCom (IT), Engineering, Mathematics or Accounting

  • IT (BSc or BCom)

  • Computer Science

  • Engineering

  • Mathematics

  • Management Accounting

  • Internal Auditing

  • Business Science

  • Risk Management

  • Economics

Whole leadership


I lead myself and others to make a difference and create a positive impact in a responsible, authentic, resilient, inclusive and passionate manner.


Business acumen


I bring business knowledge, innovation and insight to create distinctive value for clients and PwC.


Technical and digital


I apply a range of technical, digital and other professional capabilities to deliver quality and value.


Global and inclusive


I operate and collaborate effectively with a mindset that transcends boundaries and embraces diverse perspectives.


Relationships


I build relationships of high value, which are genuine and meaningful.

About MCI

MCI is a dynamic Business Information Systems Consulting firm and an equal opportunity employer. Our service offering includes project management, software implementation, product development across various platforms, and including e-commerce solutions.

We strive to be the best at what we do, and to achieve this we need people on our team who have commitment, drive, and a positive attitude that helps deliver winning results.

Role

display_title: Senior Manager Analytics and BI - Digital Services
job_description: The role will drive the implementation of data and analytics programmes for Digital Services and will primarily focus on analysing and proposing reporting and insights dashboards sustainable business growth & profitability and internal efficiencies. It will also be responsible for providing data insights, analytics and reporting based on key KPIs defined; and will also be responsible for driving standardization of reporting and KPIs.

Who You'll Work With

You will join our Johannesburg office as part of our Client Capabilities Network asset team and our global Basic Materials insights network.
The Client Capabilities Network leverages McKinsey’s industry expertise alongside the extensive experience our mining professionals have along the entire mining value chain to help companies implement transformations at mine sites around the world.
The team helps companies to compare their operating, labor and cost performance to a broad set of peers. Our proprietary database includes equipment, cost and labor metrics from mining operations across the globe and you will be leveraging and improving our mining diagnostic methodologies.

What You'll Do

You will support our consultants and clients by collecting, summarizing, analyzing and synthetizing information that helps solve specific business problems in the basic materials industry.
In this role, you will perform a wide range of analytics tasks on various basic materials industries and more specifically mining operations, developing perspectives that are relevant to clients. You will collaborate with our global Basic Materials Insights network to share and build knowledge, best practices and relevant new ideas. In project work and in exchanges with colleagues, you will deal with new intellectual challenges daily as well as build your industry and functional knowledge on an ongoing basis.
The problems will often be of operational nature and you will use your knowledge, combined with McKinsey’s tools and frameworks, to solve these problems.
When not directly supporting clients, you will be refining and developing our offerings and assisting in the growth of the basic materials solutions and practice.
The versatility and nature of our work gives lots of opportunity for you to grow professionally and intellectually over time.
There is flexibility to hire at the Knowledge Analyst or Senior Knowledge Analyst level, depending on your experience.

Qualifications

  • Master's degree in geology or mining operations
  • 3+ years of work experience in underground mining operations
  • Superior problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Significant understanding of the industry dynamics of the mining sector
  • Passion for analytics and interest in developing new approaches to mining data analysis and application to operational improvement
  • Willing to work in a highly demanding and result-oriented team environment
  • Exhibit self-motivation and high service-orientated work ethic
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

Job Family
Risk, Audit and Compliance
Career Stream
Enterprise Wide Risk Management
Leadership Pipeline
Manage Managers
Job Purpose
  • The Margin Analytics function plays an important role in Nedbank in terms of unpacking the Group and cluster-level net interest income (NII), interest earning assets (IEA) and net interest margin (NIM). The Senior Manager: Margin Analytics is responsible for managing the margin analytics processes and associated reporting into the various executive committees and public disclosures.
  • The Margin Analytics function works closely with the Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP) team to keep abreast of the movements in the FTP rates and changes in methodology that will impact NIM and similarly with front-line clusters to unpack and understand the movements in client rates and any changes in inter alia strategy.
  • The Senior Manager: Margin Analytics will be responsible for supporting the Executive: Funds Transfer Pricing and Margin Analytics with quantitative and qualitative tasks pertaining to Group and cluster-level NII, IEA and NIM and other Asset and Liability Management processes.
Job Responsibilities

Retrospective and Prospective Group NIM Analysis and Reporting
  • Responsible for analysing and reporting the drivers of Group and cluster-level NII, IEA and NIM movements through various reporting periods.
  • Managing the reporting of NIM analytics in public disclosure documents, e.g. results booklets. Support the Nedbank leadership team to present NIM to the market by raising key items, offering good insights and relevant analytics in a timely manner.
  • Collaborating with front-line clusters to, retrospectively and prospectively during the forecasting process, unpack the key drivers of movements in their funding and credit spreads and together with the FTP team liaise with front-line clusters to share information about movements in FTP rates and how it could be impacting their funding and credit spreads, endeavouring to have a consistent message being landed at the various management meetings.
  • Build strong relationship with and add value to front-line clusters through insightful engagements and analytics tools that BSM avail to ultimately ensure that the BSM Margin Analytics team is a partner of choice for front-line clusters.
  • Continuously optimising and automating NIM processes to ensure world-class reporting with key insights with maximum time spent on analytics and value-add.
  • Produce Group and cluster level NIM analytics over the forecasting period and enable constructive discussions to ensure that Strategic Portfolio Tilt, other Alco and management strategies and changes in the FTP methodology is correctly incorporated into the forecasting process.
  • Manage all other daily, weekly, monthly and adhoc responsibilities of the Margin Analytics team.
  • Keep abreast of market, accounting and strategy changes to anticipate and report the impact it could have on Group NII, IEA and NIM in a timely manner.

Comprehensive Peer Analysis
  • Complete detailed peer analysis, including right-sizing analytics, by unpacking the NII, IEA and NIM drivers of the peer group as disclosed to the market and comparing it to the drivers in Nedbank.
  • Collaborate with Group Risk to overlay the Credit Loss Ratio and provide key insights to stakeholders.

Contribute positively to the greater FTP and Margin Analytics and BSM team:
  • Active involvement in the running of some of the key FTP processes to promote synergy in the greater team, reduce key-person dependency and encourage cross-skilling in the team.
  • Engage with the FTP, Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book and BSM Finance teams on key developments, projects and strategies that will impact NII, IEA and NIM.
  • Role model human-centered leadership and values driven, ethical behaviour in Nedbank. Contribute positively to the Nedbank culture and inspire delivery of our purpose of using our financial expertise to do good and in so doing, drive greater impact in society.
Essential Qualifications - NQF Level
  • Advanced Diplomas/National 1st Degrees
Preferred Qualification
  • Post graduate degree in Accounting, Economics, Financial Risk Management, Quantitative Risk Management, Financial Mathematics.
Minimum Experience Level
  • 5 to 10 years’ experience within a Treasury, Balance Sheet Management, Asset and Liability Management or NII Analytics function.
  • 3 years in a people management position.
  • Knowledge of banking book products and experience with data analytics and optimisation of processes.
Personal style and values
  • Must demonstrate a willingness to enhance understanding of current methodologies and models (self-starter).
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be able to explain complex and/or technical matters clearly, accurately and simply.
  • High levels of resilience, determination and drive.
Technical / Professional Knowledge
  • Budgeting
  • Business terms and definitions
  • Capacity planning
  • Client service management
  • Communication Strategies
  • Diversity management
  • Financial Accounting Principles
  • Governance, Risk and Controls
  • Organisational behaviour theory
  • Principles of project management
  • Relevant regulatory knowledge
  • Stakeholder management
  • Strategic planning
  • Risk Management Policies,Procedures and Best Practices(ERM and ORM Knowledge)
  • Business Reporting Skills
Behavioural Competencies
  • Building Partnerships
  • Coaching
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus

Company Description
-Join us as a Commercial Advisor where you will be accountable for outstanding up-date on key performance and financial matters at the operations and for developing a deep emphasis of the KPIs and cost drivers that impact business performance.

Finances are vital. You’ll help us see where we’re going.

Anglo American has a portfolio of world-class mining operations. We mine, process, move and market the essential ingredients that enable a cleaner, more connected world and that meet fast growing consumer-driven demands for products from smartphones to electric cars. Our basic materials build homes, offices, railways and airports, and our diamonds fulfil people's dreams.

Anglo American Platinum

Our Platinum business mines, processes, and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium and osmium.

We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialised applications that improve lives across the world – from vehicle fuel cells to jewellery; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining.

Amandelbult operation, fully owned by Anglo American Platinum has two-underground mines, Tumela Mine and Dishaba Mine with a concentrator (with two-plants) located on the north-western limb of the Bushveld mineral complex.


Job Description
-As a Commercial Advisor, you will be responsible for leading a shaft accountant for a key shaft at the Amandelbult Complex and supporting the Amandelbult Complex Commercial Finance Specialist and Commercial Manager. You will be responsible for not only the coordination and management of key deliverables, but also for driving key business improvement and commercial strategic initiatives. The Commercial Advisor will need to provide commercial insights to support decision making and ensuring adherence to governance policies. Some of the specific tasks that are also required include

  • Preparing Anglo American Platinum weekly, monthly, quarterly, interim, and year-end (or as required) management reports ensuring key issues are highlighted with focus on key value drivers and trend analysis.
  • Assist and advise discipline Managers & Superintendents to develop budgets, e.g., by providing insights into financial data and consolidating inputs.
  • Provide business case modelling support for on-site SIB capital, make recommendations on capital expenditure decisions to the disciplines.
  • Support preparation of financial forecasts that includes forward looking risks and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with discipline to develop risk register, proactively providing financial evaluation (cost/capital) of risk mitigation strategies.
  • Provide discipline-specific financial reports and analysis.
  • Drive delivery the sustainability activities as relevant to discipline and set out in the Life of Asset Plan to improve sustainability performance over time.
  • Analyse performance and anticipate, research and resolve issues. Includes identifying the impact of operating anomalies, adverse financial trends, changes in policies and reporting requirements, and evaluating the impact on reported results.
  • Manage compliance of the teams within work area with external (legislative, regulatory, permitting) local requirements as a minimum level of site performance.
  • Participate in Anglo American Platinum led performance and diagnostic reviews and provide supporting analysis as required by mine management and corporate teams.
  • Liaise effectively with key business contacts and build up strong working relationships.

This role is at a band 6 level reporting to the Commence Finance Specialist


  • Qualifications
    -Postgraduate qualifications within Business Accounting, Finance, Economics CIMA/CA(SA)/CFA

Experience

  • 10 years’ experience in similar role with at least 2-3 years management experience, 2 years of which should be in a Mining/PGMs environment.
  • Experience in Financial Management systems, Essbase and SAP.
  • Experience in Capital and Project Appraisals.

Knowledge & Skills

  • Excellent financial acumen
  • Advanced data analysis and management
  • Proficient in mine financial systems and related legislation
  • Advanced computer literacy (PowerPoint, Advanced excel, Word)
  • Proficient in budgeting and forecasting, Actuals, data submissions, financial modelling
  • Strong verbal and written communication in English

Additional Information
-What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, but more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are.

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.

How we are committed to your safety.

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

We’re looking for an Online and Digital Marketing Manager for our business. Someone who will oversee and be responsible for delivery and implementation – this means coordinating, executing, tracking, optimising and troubleshooting online digital media campaigns across all digital and social channels, as well as market research and analytics.

You’ll need to create, implement, and monitor effective marketing and communication campaigns that align with, and support our business objectives. Website Consultant

Career Level 3

Company
Munich Re
Location
Johannesburg , South Africa

Munich Reinsurance Company of Africa Limited (MRoA) has been operating in South Africa for 50 years, although the Munich Re (Group) was active on the Continent via Munich Re in Munich for some years prior to commencing the Southern African operation in Johannesburg in 1968. The Head Office of MRoA is in Johannesburg, with a client service Life office situated in Cape Town.


Munich Re’s Global Digital Communications section designs, develops and implements external digital communications and marketing channels such as website, emails and our presence on social media platforms. In addition, the section supports Munich Re’s business units globally in their digitalization and digital marketing activities. We are looking for a skilled and motivated Website Consultant to strengthen our team.


The Website Consultant will be responsible for collaborating with international cross-functional teams to conceptualize and implement user-centered web experiences that meet business objectives and improve website performance.


This role will directly report to the Global Head of Digital Communications.


Your job:


  • Conduct user research and analysis to identify areas for improvement on the websites.
  • Consult and collaborate with internal stakeholders, including product managers, developers, webmasters, marketing business partner and content owners to implement changes and improve website functionality.
  • Use data and feedback to optimize the user experience and conversions, including improving navigation, layout, and content.
  • Manage website projects from initial set up and concept to go live based on an existing component stack.
  • Create user flows and wireframes to articulate website and component concepts and interactions.
  • Develop prototypes and conduct user testing to validate component concepts and gather feedback.
  • Collaborate with visual designers and developers to ensure components designs are implemented effectively.
  • Create and maintain a consistent user-centric experience across the website, ensuring that all pages are user-friendly and intuitive.
  • Continuously monitor website metrics and user feedback from internal and external stakeholders to identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback to other team members.
  • Quality assurance of the website with regard to corporate design, spelling and broken links.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in UX design, web design, and technology.

Your Profile:

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as digital communication, website management, marketing or web design.
  • At least 5 years of experience in website optimization, ideally in a global corporate organization.
  • Excellent knowledge in using CMS tools like AEM.
  • Experience using analytics and A/B testing tools such as Adobe Analytics.
  • Strong knowledge about accessibility standards.
  • Strong knowledge of design and prototyping tools such as Figma or Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Empathy and a sense of humor.

Our Benefits:

  • Life and Health Benefits.
  • Retirement Benefits.
  • Hybrid working environment.
  • Bonus Scheme.
  • Employee Assistance Program.
  • Wellness Programs.
  • Global Mobility.


#LI-Hybrid


You will work in an environment where we aspire to think big: Change and culture are challenged. We communicate a compelling and shared purpose and direction. We pave the way towards success and see failure as learning.


You are going to experience that we care & dare: We are empathetic. We know when to lead and know when to let others lead. We attract, grow and coach future leaders.


We aim to communicate in a clear & authentic way. We solicit feedback, ask and listen, learn and unlearn.

We lead the We: We have a passion for winning and growing as a team. We inspire people to deliver a joint performance. We create an inclusive environment where different thoughts, generations, cultures and experiences are valued and encouraged.

This is a permanent position and is based in Johannesburg, South Africa.


The closing date for this opening is 17 July 2023.


Please apply to the advert or through our careers page. We do not accept CV's by email. We do respond by email to all applications received through our advert. If you have not heard from us, please check your spam email folder.


About Munich Re:

Founded in 1880, Munich Re Group is on the world's leading providers of primary insurance, reinsurance and insurance related risk solution. As pioneers in risk assessment, we promote the digital transformation of the global insurance landscape, expanding products and services as new forms of risk emerge. From space rocket launches to cyber-attacks, from high net worth individual life cover to pandemic, we take care of risk, so our clients can take care of their business.

Apply now!

Disclaimer:

At Munich Re, we embrace, and value, the interaction of diverse backgrounds, experience, perspectives and thought. This interaction is the foundation of our open culture, spirit of partnership, of how our teams are built and cultivated, and of how we are supported and developed. And at the centre of this interaction is each of us.

Company Description
-Here is an exciting opportunity to join our Platinum Business as a Project Shaft Ventilation Engineer responsible for developing and maintaining the overall Ventilation and Occupational Hygiene systems and programmes, to meet business plan life of mine requirements, as well as providing the Operational Area Management with the specialist Ventilation and Occupational Hygiene expertise, to ensure a safe and healthy work environment, to minimise pure risk and litigation and adverse publicity.

Zero Harm. Safe. Smart. Sustainable. Probably not the first words you typically associate with mining. But Anglo American is not your typical mining company.

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

Anglo Platinum

Our Platinum business mines, processes and refines the entire range of platinum group metals (PGMs): platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, iridium and osmium. We are the world’s leading primary producer of PGMs, which have a range of specialised applications that improve lives across the world – from vehicle fuel cells to jewellery; dentistry to glassmaking; pacemakers to petroleum refining.


Job Description
-The focus areas for this role will be to:

  • Ensure that legal requirements, AAP standards and policies are adhered to achieving legal compliance.
  • Develop, maintain and manage all mandatory code of practices, ventilation and occupational hygiene related standards and procedures.
  • Maintain Ventilation and Occupational Hygiene strategies, systems and compliance measurements.
  • Conduct risk assessments and participate in audits and risk management.
  • Report findings and recommend appropriate interventions and reporting structures.
  • Maintaining asset management and equipment.
  • Assist in long-term ventilation and occupational hygiene planning (life of mine).
  • Contribute to the achievement of the objectives and targets of the Ventilation and Occupational Hygiene Department and those of the business area.
  • Develop and maintain VUMA-3D ventilation models for current, future and project business plan requirement.
  • Extensive report writing skills to provide clarity w.r.t. Ventilation and Refrigeration requirements to the project management team.

This role is in the MRM department at a Band 6 level reporting to the Chief Ventilation Engineer.


Qualifications
-You will be required to have:

  • Grade 12 with Maths & Science.
  • Intermediate Certificate in Mine Environmental Control (Paper 1 and 2).
  • Chamber of Mines (COM) Certificate in Mine Environmental Control (Paper 1 to 6).
  • Membership of the Mine Ventilation Society of South Africa.
  • Extensive computer literacy in MS Office, SAP, Vuma 3D and VentSim.

Knowledge, skills and experience required:

  • Qualified as Ventilation professional and occupational hygienist with five years experience in ventilation.
  • At least 3 years’ Experience as a Shaft Ventilation Engineer in the active role Planning Projects and reporting

Formal training or practical experience in: Occupational Health legislation, Management system formulation and implementation, Hazard identification and risk assessment, specialised technical programs will be advantageous.


  • Additional Information
    -MHSA and Reg Legislative understanding
  • Ventilation project implementation (Raiseboring of Ventilation Shaft) will be advantageous
  • Knowledge of managing complex Ventilation circuits with heat-loads and hot underground water

What we offer

When you join Anglo American, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Who we are?

Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.

Inclusion and Diversity

Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer.

How to apply

To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

Purpose of the position

The Data Engineer will work collectively with the SI-MER team to provide expertise in the field of data processing and engineering. The role will lead and implement data engineering projects, support, and maintain data pipelines, and provide expertise and best practices regarding data engineering for staff across the organisation. As needed, the Data Engineer will design and develop new data engineering pipelines as part of the SI-MER Team. Further, the Senior Data Specialist will help decide how and implement improvements to pipeline, systems, and infrastructure to support the development of analytics output and data reporting.

Key Accountabilities

  • Assembling large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements
  • Liaising with SI-MER team and the rest of the APACE team to elucidate the requirements for each task.
  • Conceptualising and generating infrastructure that allows big data to be accessed and analysed.
  • Identifying, designing, and implementing internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes
  • Building required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Python, SQL and other applicable technologies
  • Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and customer acquisition
  • Working with stakeholders including data, design, product and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues
  • Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues
  • Preparing raw data for manipulation by the SI-ME team analysts
  • Remaining up to date with industry standards and technological advancements that will improve the quality of your outputs.

Desirable qualifications

Experience & skills

  • At least 6 years of experience working with a team throughout the development lifecycle in an Agile development environment for Business Intelligence tools
  • Proven experience as a data engineer, software developer, or similar.
  • Expert proficiency in Python, and SQL. Knowledge of C++, Java will be beneficial
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Capacity to successfully manage a pipeline of duties with minimal supervision.
  • Experience performing systems analysis for systems that cross multiple components and impact multiple systems.
  • Experience managing software projects using tools to facilitate the DevOps process such as Monday.com Trello, Jira or Microsoft DevOps.
  • Possess technical writing skills and ability to review work products such as: Use Cases, Detailed Functional Requirements,
  • Detailed Design Specifications, and Software Requirement Specifications.
  • Demonstrated experience in working within a multi-disciplinary team in a fast paced, technically challenging environment.
  • Excellent leadership, management, coordination, interpersonal and teamwork skills.
  • Experience working with public health and reporting systems like, TIER.NET, Excel, DATIM, DHIS and Synch will be advantageous
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Valid Driver's License

Personal qualities & Behavioural competencies

  • Ability to connect the dots, make linkages and collaboratively work across the organization to optimize the client experience
  • Be solution focused

Winning, Enabling and Delivery of Projects

People Leadership/Self Leadership

Relationship Management

We have an opportunity for a Senior Insights Executive to manage all research activities during the planning, set-up and on-going management of our client’s research projects.

As a skilled Senior Insight Executive, you will have a keen ability to balance client demands with internal timelines, you will ensure that projects remain on schedule, on budget, and guarantee client satisfaction.

A Senior Insight Executive is both an analytical thinker and a strategic thinker who performs well under pressure and is able to manage multiple customer accounts while ensuring quality outputs and clearly articulated insights.


Industry / Business Knowledge & Relationship Management:

  • Actively getting to know the client’s business/industry
  • Build ongoing client relationships to ensure loyalty and satisfaction

Proposals & Costing:

  • Set up proposals & costing (when requested) with support and input from the insights lead
  • Able to translate client business or research objectives into an effective research project design
  • Considers multiple design options to achieve the research objective
  • Recommends optimal design based on methodology, cost, time, access
  • Considers sampling, quotas, bias effects, routing, filters, reporting outputs
  • Considers need for external suppliers where appropriate (stats, field, qualitative moderators etc.)

Insight Community / Consumer Panel set-ups

Project Management of Research Projects:

  • Set-up of project deliverables and timelines
  • Allocate project tasks on the internal project management system
  • If requested, communicate with the client on the status of the project (including ad-hoc projects)
  • Management of project tasks in accordance with timelines
  • Communicate with internal teams on an ongoing basis regarding project status

Questionnaire Development:

  • Designs questionnaires or discussion guides for discussion with client/checks and approves a questionnaire set up by a research executive
  • Finalises & signs-off questionnaire or discussion guide with the client
  • Briefs the operations teams for scripting or authoring
  • Tests questionnaire (i.e. logic, flow, length etc.)

Analytics & Statistics:

  • Compiles analytical plan in consultation with the insights lead
  • Communicates details of tabletop breaks to the operations team
  • Communicates and discuss any modelling required with the statistician
  • Assesses whether weighting of data is required by comparing the achieved sample distribution relative to the ideal
  • Communicates to the operations team and statistician the distributions to weigh towards if required

Moderating (if experience allows):

  • Moderates online discussions where appropriate

Reporting:

  • Prepares visual and insightful reports detailing key insights (requesting input guidance as needed)
  • Presents results to client face-to-face when needed

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 3 years of project management experience
  • 5 plus years of research experience
  • Well-rounded experience covering brand health, communications testing and product innovation project work within the FMCG/ CPG and retail sectors
  • Completed a relevant degree but preferably post-graduate qualifications
  • Professional presentation
  • Excellent command of the English language i.e. written, spoken, grammar and writing
  • Fluency in additional languages of the African continent an advantage (French, Portuguese and/or Arabic in particular)
  • Strong in numeracy (statistical knowledge and experience an advantage)
  • Excellent time management, organizational, problem solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to service several clients at one time
  • Ability to work well under pressure and possess a high degree of tenacity
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office
  • Aptitude for technology and software
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills

Our Client?

The Companies Group Technology is responsible for the provision of a digitally enabled technology service as a group COE, drive business and transformation and provide group-wide digital and data architecture. We operate the various technology platforms and shared services, ensure Cyber and Information Security resilience, and act as technology governance and risk orchestrator for technology across Company.

What will you do?

  • The Analytics Technical Lead will consult and provide technical solutions to meet the companies requirements, improve system performance and address chronic issues.
  • Guided by Architecture and other Technical Leads, you will be responsible for establishing new technology components and reusable solution patterns that can be leveraged by business-facing development teams in their day-to-day solutions. You are regarded as an IT specialist with advanced analytical and technical skills.
  • You should be able to communicate technical information to technical teams and be competent in communicating challenges and solutions to project and operational leadership.

What will make you successful in this role?

  • Work with the architects (i.e., application, infrastructure, security, and other architects) to ensure a sustainable platform that meets the business needs of the future.
  • Establish a consumption tool centre of excellence.
  • Form relationships and orchestrate delivery with key technical stakeholders across our business including architects.
  • Engage with technology vendors and external technical experts when conceptualizing, designing, or implementing technical solutions.
  • Ability to create efficient best practices and establish suitable processes to ensure effective environment and solution management.
  • Provide technical leadership for the consumption tool teams.
  • Put in place best practices and processes to ensure platform stability and performance.
  • Work with the consumption tool teams on monitoring and other requirements.
  • Ensure security is implemented according to the companies security standards through regular reviews.
  • Make business stakeholders aware of what of the comparative analysis across the consumption tools.
  • Evaluate consumption tool releases and new product features.
  • Interact with development teams and provide guidance, best practices and industry standards to enable good report and dashboard development.
  • Design, document, and communicate technical solutions that deliver on business requirements.
  • Constant refinement to standardize and implement new functionality based on experience and lessons learnt.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues such as database non-performance, integration failures and code failures.

Qualifications

  • Grade 12
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, Engineering, or another quantitative field / National Diploma in an Information Technology related discipline preferred.

Knowledge

  • Understanding of Standards, Best Practices, procedures, and Key Metrics to enhance operational and Platform Stability
  • Familiarity with the use cases, business purposes and quality of the data.
  • Understanding of SDLC, code management / standards / re use, release management, project management, and API integration
  • Understanding of Multitenancy
  • Proficient in SQL and MDX (Critical)
  • Exposure to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) will be an advantage
  • Exposure to SAP HANA, MS SQL and DB2
  • Knowledge of other consumption tools (i.e., Business Objects, QlikView, QlikSense, Power BI and Domo) will be an advantage
  • Application and analytics background with a solid background in SQL is required

Experience

  • Development experience in BI with a solid background in SQL, application, and information architecture
  • Solid Agile development experience
  • Performance Tuning Experience
  • Proven track record in working with Architects, BI developers and end users
  • General working experience in financial institutions is recommended
  • 8+ years related experience

JOB OVERVIEW
Business Segment: Group Functions
Location: ZA, GP, Johannesburg, Baker Street 30
Job Type: Full-time

Date Posted: 6/27/2023

JOB DESCRIPTION

To drive the strategic positioning of the Standard Bank Group in light of the significant impact of emerging prudential and digital regulation of the financial services industry and the imperative for banks and insurance entities to reposition themselves. To enable the Standard Bank Group to take a strategic approach to its internal regulatory response and to effectively and efficiently deal with the breadth and complexity of regulation.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Qualifications

Type of Qualification: Post Graduate Degree
Field of Study: Finance and Accounting

Other Minimum Qualifications, Certifications or Professional Memberships: Certified Financial Risk Manager (FRM), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and/or Professional Risk Manager (PRM). A Masters degree in Finance and Accounting or Risk Management would provide credibility as this role will provide specialist advice.

Experience Required
Financial Insights & Analytics
More than 10 years
The role requires an incumbent with banking experience in prudential regulation, regulatory reporting finance reporting, quantitative financial modelling and risk management. This also encompasses knowledge of and experience in market risk, liquidity risk and Interest Rate Risk in the Banking Book (IRRBB) would be required.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Behavioural Competencies:
Exploring Possibilities
Examining Information
Interpreting Data
Interacting with People
Producing Output

Technical Competencies:
Continuous Process Improvement
Financial Analysis
Financial and Accounting Control
Financial Industry Regulatory Framework
Promote Good Governance, Risk & Control

Please note: All our recruitment processes comply with the applicable local laws and regulations. We will never ask for money or any from of payment as part of our recruitment process. If you experience this, please contact our Fraud line on +27 800222050 or TransactionFraudOpsSA@standardbank.co.za

Our client, based in the Southern Suburbs, is looking for a Junior Investment Analyst to join their team. They are a successful and independent investment management company. As a Junior Investment Analyst, you will be working within their team of highly experienced, thought-leading, and entrepreneurial-minded investment professionals. This is a key new role that intersects with all the functions performed across their investment team, and through which you will be supported and empowered to develop
hands-on knowledge and expertise across multiple areas of our investment firm. As a leading provider of fund
manager research, the exposure you receive by working in this role will provide you with insights into the
behaviours and practices of leading local and offshore asset managers. In addition, through exposure to each
area of their rigorous and institutional quality investment process, you will get the opportunity to develop the
expertise that will accelerate your growth as an investment professional.

The Role:

The successful candidate will report to the Chief Investment Officer, and shall be responsible for assisting with
investment analytics, implementation, and the improvement of processes across the investment functions.
Investment analytics plays a pivotal role in their investment process, and the successful candidate will have a
broad range of responsibilities in this area, including quantitative analysis, data management and modelling,
and performance calculations and attribution analytics, all of which provide key inputs into various aspects of
the investment team’s processes. The role will have daily responsibilities, and will contribute to the investment
team’s research, asset allocation, portfolio management, implementation, compliance and reporting activities.

Work Experience

The ideal candidate for this role will have 1 – 3 years’ experience within the financial services industry. Examples
of financial services industry experience would include the following:
  • Understanding of the investment environment and financial markets both local and international (incl.
CIS’s, ETF’s, equities, benchmarks)
  • Quantitative analysis (modelling, design and development)
  • Financial modelling
  • Development of analytical tools (incl. Excel, BI tools, proprietary tools)
  • Structuring and processing large amounts of data
  • Performance attribution analysis
  • Performance calculations
  • Portfolio mandate and regulatory compliance monitoring
  • Trade implementation
  • Trade life cycle management (incl. execution, confirmation and settlement)
  • Understanding of investment analysis metrics (incl. tracking error, standard deviation)
  • Compilation and delivery of investment reporting (to the investment team and clients)
  • Sourcing and maintenance of market data and data from 3rd parties
  • CIS operations (incl. asset and liability administration, Manco, trustees, custodians)
  • Design and implementation of internal process improvements

Qualifications and Skills
Qualifications and skills serve to provide the potential candidate with a strong foundation upon which to grow
and develop within this role. The type of qualifications and skills we are looking for include the following:

Degrees (or similar): Bachelor’s, Honours or Master’s degrees (fields incl. Actuarial Science; Finance;
Mathematics; Statistics; Computer Science; Investment Management) Degree Results: Upper Second; First-Class; Deans Merit List

Additional Studies: Studying towards or completed CFA, CIPM, CFP or other fields of specialization

Computer Skills: Proficient use of all MS Office applications (ability to use MS Excel is essential to succeed in this
role); Programming experience (e.g., SQL, Python, Java, C#, R); Experience with trade management, analytics,
and market data systems (e.g., Refinitiv, Bloomberg, Morningstar, FE Analytics)

Job Description :
PURPOSE OF THIS ROLE
Deliver Procurement outcomes for Diageo within one or more categories of spend, through effective support to Specialists and Managers across Procurement CoEs. This includes (but is not limited to):
  • Applying strategic procurement excellence, through provision of research, data, analysis and insights that enables creation of category strategies that deliver procurement value for Diageo.
  • Supporting Sourcing activities for specific categories of spend procured in Market.
  • Supporting end-to-end execution of category strategies, working with global and other market category professionals in line with strategy.
  • Developing subject-matter expertise for specific spend categories, supporting collection and leverage of supply market expertise and management of a reusable knowledge base for development and application of supply market data and information to strategy development and sourcing.
The Market Category Analyst is accountable for active participation in a global community of procurement professionals in one or more spend categories, including joining regular meetings, supporting alignment around strategy, supporting development of own and others’ capabilities & expertise and sharing of best practices. S/he is also accountable for aligning local data with Diageo standards for data and knowledge management and for ensuring global access to it.
ENTRY LEVEL REQUIREMENTS (CAPABILITIES, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE)
  • Graduate or equivalent qualification.
  • Experience in Procurement, Finance, FMCG Commerical or other relevant role, with exposure to supply markets and spend categories relevant to the role
  • Demonstrated performance in projects and in cross-market teams.
  • Strong analytical and financial awareness including a strong understanding of AOP requirements and financial goals & value drivers relevant to the categories in scope
  • Track record of generating insights to influence decision-making; good commercial acumen
  • Good systems knowledge (esp. SAP, PRDM, M/S Office, E-collaborate or similar systems & tools)
  • Strong verbal, written and presentation; strong interpersonal skills
  • Proven track record of consistent performance and delivery
Category-specific/ Market-specific requirements
Pool roles may be aligned to specific sub-categories/categories however a degree of flexibility will be required in managing data needs across all categories & geographies within the Africa Source CoE team. Each analyst is expected to provide a standard level of service to the categories that they support, comprising
  • Vendor change management (new Supplier Service Hub), ad hoc requests for support in any key area within categories, eSourcing events, Buyers matrix maintenance, review and close Responsible Sourcing gaps, prepare Category review packs, month-end reporting, projects support, annual standard cost setting/AOP planning support, supplier performance management and contract creation.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
General
  • Applied expertise. Build, manage and grow expertise in one or more spend categories, including understanding of supply markets, suppliers, stakeholders. Become a subject-matter expert and share with others in a global community of category professionals. Apply expertise and standards to identify and win new value for Diageo.
  • Knowledge management. Drive development of best in class market data and knowledge and ensure its availablility and active management/ refresh. Apply Diageo standards for category excellence. Contribute to improvement of existing and development of new tools & techniques.
Category strategy
  • Business partnering. Support category managers and specialists in developing relationships with stakeholders, partners and suppliers for deeper insights into needs and capabilities; articulate requirements and deliver insights for greater value from stakeholder collaboration.
  • Strategy development. For one or more spend categories, support development and evolution of category strategies by (1) researching and analysing supply markets and dynamics and providing insights to specialists and managers; and (2) assessing opportunities and proposing solutions.
  • Best in class capabilities. Generate insights from internal and external benchmarking, develop cost models to consider scenarios with suppliers and stakeholders and build & evolve analytics capabilities that allow regular review and improvement of strategies.
  • Strategy execution. Support end to end execution of category strategies across geographical and organisational boundaries. Track and monitor progress against performance goals, providing detailed, monthly KPI data (including reconciliation to category team tracking projects, savings, supplier performance, etc.).
  • Sourcing
  • Market sourcing. Support sourcing activities for CM2 (above-market leverage) and CM1 (truly market-specific ) spend categories. Engage community members as required, apply Diageo best practice standards.
  • Market contracting. For relevant sourcing projects, support management of contracts and contract compliance (Diageo stakeholder compliance and Supplier compliance) through contract lifecycles. Track and monitor compliance in line with Diageo and local market standards.
  • Risk management
  • Mitigate strategic risks. As part of category strategy execution, identify, record and follow-up risk mitigations in line with category strategies and best practice.
  • Mitigate sourcing risks. Identify corporate, supply, supplier and other risks associated with sourcing activities, support execution of mitigations and engagement of relevant stakeholders, partners and suppliers to ensure the mitigations are successful.
  • Apply and improve tools & techniques. Apply Diageo best practice standards, ensuring the most recent and relevant approaches are always applied; use formal governance and peer review to ensure the quality and efficacy of risk management; contribute to development of standards.
  • Supplier relationship management
  • Supplier relationship. Apply standards, ways of working and trust relationships with market suppliers in relevant categories; ensure Diageo best practices are applied and that there is a good foundation for strong performance, risk mitigation and rapid resolution of issues.
  • Supplier performance. Support definition and drive monitoring of KPIs, improving the value of data generated and applied and liaise with Supply sites for resolution of escalated issues. Provide data analysis and input to the SPM to manage the relationship with suppliers to the performance plan and maximise value for Diageo.
  • Data management. Maintain all relevant data on systems and offline databases, e.g., vendor details, price lists, standard costing, invoice query support.
EXCELLENCE IN SUPPLY CHAIN ‘SOURCE’
  • Clear track record working within a standard, end to end process, preferably ‘Source’ (generically, Source-to-Pay); proven track record in adherence to Core Process and Standards.
  • Experience working within KPI-led performance management structures and rigorous tiered reporting and performance review structures.
  • Proactively leverages the learning curriculums and materials on Learning Hub and other sources to continuously grow and develop in role.
Worker Type :
Regular
Primary Location:
Waterfall

2023-06-28

overview

An international Data Analytics company based in South Africa is looking for Senior Data Scientist to join their team.Our client is looking for a Senior Data Scientist who will collaborate across the various teams in the
solution designing in credit and non-credit industries, as well as development and deployment of solutions.

description

  • Developing advanced analytics and machine learning models for various industries
  • Developing advance analytical solutions to solve business problems for our clients
  • Developing predictive models and solutions across the credit life cycle for industries
  • Providing best practice consulting advice to a wide range of organisations that rely on data to drive their business, domestically and internationally
  • Offering day-to-day consulting assistance across multiple clients
  • Analysing reports and results while performing investigative analytics to solve problems
  • Compiling professional consulting reports and presentations for delivery to clients
  • Developing close relationships with clients to identify additional areas for development and assistance
  • Working in collaboration with other teams in the business such as sales, marketing, software deployment/development and consulting;
  • Driving and delivering new product innovation within the analytics team

experience, qualifications and skills

  • 8 – 10 years’ experience in consumer credit analytics, with specific focus on Predictive
    Modelling utilising Machine Learning methodologies and a proven track record
  • BComm majoring in Statistics; Quantitative Management OR a BSc Engineering; Mathematics; Applied Mathematics; Data Science; Logistics; or related fields
  • 8 – 10 years’ experience in consumer credit analytics, with specific focus on Predictive Modelling utilising Machine Learning methodologies and a proven track record
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Good working knowledge of SQL, Python and Azure/AWS
  • High level of competence of Predictive Modelling techniques
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritise with a sense of urgency and work under pressure to tight deadlines
  • Demonstrate a thirst for knowledge and desire to grow and learn
  • Excellent customer service orientation
  • Strong presentation skills
  • An agile mindset and approach to work to improvise and adapt principles into alternative environments
  • Amazing Ms Excel skills, coupled with super skills in Ms Word and PowerPoint

In Africa, we’re the largest provider of professional services with over 450 partners and over 10,000 people in 32 countries. This means that we’re able to provide our clients with seamless and consistent Tax, Assurance and Advisory solutions, wherever they do business on the continent.


Our strategy, The New Equation, is about how PwC brings together unique combinations of people, powered by technology, galvanising ourselves as a community of solvers to address those dual challenges. The foundation of the strategy is our multidisciplinary model, which allows us to help clients build trust and deliver sustained outcomes by bringing together deep expertise across a broad range of capabilities.



Consulting helps some of the world’s most significant organisations become even more effective in an environment where the risk of disruption is more intense than ever before. We help clients improve the way they operate; accelerate their growth; reduce their costs; manage their risks; develop their talent and change the way they do business. In doing so, we bring our collective expertise to focus on the big issues our clients are grappling with today.


You will work closely with the best in industry, finance and government in South Africa and possibly abroad, bringing fresh insights and motivation to the problems they face. Our clients might want us to help them enter new markets; address the challenges created by organisational change; or draw up a sustainability strategy that aligns their commercial objectives with broader environmental and social concerns.


You can gain experience across our Consulting Competencies in which we focus on:


  • Accelerating value and enabling leading organisations to develop customer loyalty, drive growth, increase productivity, and inspire and engage the workforce. It is enabled by sub-solutions and accelerators combined with our industry-leading experience and technical subject matter experts for best-in-class digital enablement.

  • Delivering an end-to-end operations transformation for our clients, including operations planning, procurement, supply chain, and manufacturing.

  • Delivering new ways of solving problems, creating unique experiences and accelerating business performance. Sub-solutions include Analytics and AI Transformation, HR Transformation, Cloud Transformation and Finance Transformation.

  • Helping clients to become transformative organisations, capable of radically reinventing themselves in the face of fast-moving disruption. Key priorities include enabling them to become Fit for Growth and ensuring they have the front and back office capabilities to create value, deliver their growth strategies and outperform their competitors.


Requirements

A degree (preferably postgraduate i.e. honours) in the following fields of study:


  • Computer science

  • Computer engineering

  • Data science and Data Analytics

  • AI and drone technology

  • Information systems and Information Science

  • Other related technology degrees.


A 60% minimum cumulative average across all years of study.

Whole leadership
