To know more about what we do read about our work or our thoughts on digital product design.

Founded in 2002
Coworkers 200
Turnover £25Mn

Insight & Data · Johannesburg

Senior User Experience Consultant

Are you a passionate, creative thinker who has an insistence of following human-centred design principles? If yes, then this might be the role for you.

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing and reporting on business data in order to improve the efficiency of processes within the organisation. This role involves researching new methods of processing orders and ensuring that they are accurately recorded so as to provide accurate information to stakeholders. You'll then present your findings to senior managers or other departments within the company.


Requirements


  • Responsible for applying a set of tasks and techniques used to work as a liaison amongst stakeholders to understand the problems; opportunities; needs; structure; policies and operations of the organization on medium to large projects / medium risk
  • Recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals and to elicit and analyze the actual needs of the stakeholders; facilitate communication between organizational units and play a central role in aligning the needs of business units with the capabilities delivered by information technology and may serve as a translator between these groups
  • Providing support to the transaction processing group in improving and implementing business processes
  • Develops new business process and sets up tools, procedures and guidelines to achieve goal of efficient transaction processing
  • Documents and communicates changes within the business unit and the surrounding IT environment
  • Analyzes data to help drive business decisions
  • Leads a team of two or three Analyst/Engineers
  • Designs and develops business solutions for cash flow management, customer relationship management (CRM), sales, product sourcing and supply chain management
  • Analyzes and designs software solutions that include custom applications, programming languages and platforms


Qualifications


  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or related field required
  • Experience in business analysis, including a variety of data mining and predictive analytics
  • 5 years' experience as a BA
  • Experience with extensive knowledge of the CRM, Commerce and E-Commerce platforms
  • Knowledge and understanding of all industry standards, technologies and industry trends is required
  • Previous experience with Office 365 preferred
  • Experience in a business-to-business environment preferred
  • Experience in business analysis, with a focus on complex systems and data analytics
  • Experience as a business analyst with a proven track record of success might be addition
  • Preferably a Senior BA, but a high-end Intermediate might work
  • Preferably to have D365 experience but not essential
  • Good Test Analyst with Commerce / Orders / CRM experience could also fit this role

A unique opportunity to be the go-to digital marketing expert to the advertising and PR global team of a well-established organisation and to build their digital marketing presence in Africa. This is remote position that would involve travel to Malawi, Zambia and Zimbabwe.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage the digital marketing solution vision and technical roadmap, delivering process enhancements and solutions on time and at a quality essential to supporting business marketing objectives.
  • Developing and implementing comprehensive digital marketing programs across all digital channels including web, SEO/SEM, database marketing, email, social media and display advertising campaigns, in line with brand plans and business priorities.
  • Working with content marketing and design teams to create suitable content for each stage of a customer’s digital journey.
  • Lead strategic technical initiatives within the group, partnering with developers to optimize web traffic, conceptualize and produce web content and promotional campaigns.
  • Measure and report the performance of all digital marketing campaigns and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs).
  • Capture business needs across Business Units and translate those needs into processes, technology and data solutions capable of scaling to meet demand.
  • Identify and integrate solutions across CRM, marketing tech, advertising tech and supporting solutions stack focused on streamlining operations and ensuring data efficacy for accurate targeting and measurement.
  • Oversee overall governance of data and data analytics across the marketing organization, systems and tools.
  • Manage migrations and lead continuous improvement of data governance and data integrity.
  • Manage vendor relationships directly or in partnership with other stake holders ensuring that the vendor is aware of and operating in line with Full Circle business needs and expectations.
  • Create and manage training programs for system and tools ensuring team members know how to leverage the solutions to meet their objectives and streamline their work.
  • Develop and maintain strong internal relationships, nurturing an enablement environment where team members look to you for solutions to streamline their work and improve overall program performance.
  • Advocate for solution and process adoption across the group, partner with leaders and team members to infuse solutions into their work and make improvements in marketing data and measurement.

Key Requirements

  • You have a degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field
  • You have prior experience in a similar role
  • You have good knowledge and hands on with SEO, data analytics, social media marketing, email marketing, CRM, marketing automation and digital marketing analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Tableau
  • Excellent analytical and project management skills
  • You have excellent written & verbal communication skills.
  • You are a creative thinker and problem solver.
  • You thrive in matrix environments and are adept at building relationships with different stakeholders.

display_title: USAID LEAP Local Programme Manager (Gauteng) for a Donor-Funded Public Health Programme
job_description:
ABOUT GENESIS:

Genesis Analytics is the largest African-based economic consultancy with its headquarters in Johannesburg, South Africa. As a testament to the firm’s purpose of unlocking value in Africa, we have worked in 43 countries on the continent and our operations include offices in Abidjan (Côte d’Ivoire) Nairobi (Kenya), Lagos (Nigeria) and London (the UK) with representation in Botswana, Ethiopia, India, Israel, Lebanon, Portugal, Scotland, and Zimbabwe. We are in the process of opening our Ethiopian office.

We use our analytical capabilities to improve decision-making and, through better decisions, unlock substantial value for our clients and society. We built our reputation in the areas of competition and regulatory economics, and financial services strategy consulting, but have since expanded our offering to incorporate applied behavioural economics, evaluation for development, and health.

Our Health team provides experts with decades of experience in the design, implementation and evaluation of health programmes and in the provision of analytical and advisory services that inform health policy and practice.

ABOUT THE POSITION:

Genesis has been awarded the USAID LEAP Local Project, a $17 million programme spanning 5 years, aimed at strengthening national infectious disease programmes and other health priorities by empowering host governments to lead and manage key aspects of their infectious disease portfolios and capacitating countries in pandemic preparedness. This marks the first time Genesis has secured a prime contract from USAID.

LEAP Local facilitates a linkage between local technical expertise and a recognized human resource gap within the infectious disease portfolios at a variety of national health entities. By targeting local entities to provide expertise, solutions will be locally driven with local priorities being central to an inclusive country-driven programming approach.

As a local provider, the project will be delivered through Genesis’ offices in South Africa, Nigeria, Kenya and Cote d’Ivoire, allowing for engagement in a meaningful, culturally appropriate, local solution driven and technically sound approach that permits continuous direct mentoring and quality improvements within the Ministry of Health and other national health entities.

Genesis Health is recruiting a Programme Manager to manage The USAID LEAP Local project. The Programme Manager will provide technical support to the program to ensure smooth management and administrative coordination and manage the overall program timeline to ensure that all deliverables are met.


REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Education:

  • Master’s degree in Public Health or any other relevant field

Experience:

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience, with grant and programme management experience.
  • Experience working with and implementing donor-funded programmes in the health sector; and familiarity with USAID grants
  • Experience working with public, private and donor agents in the health sector; building and maintaining good relationships and leveraging these relationships to identify new opportunities
  • Financial and operational management experience for successful programme delivery
  • Excellent writing, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
  • Fluent use of written and spoken English

Location:

  • South Africa (Gauteng). Eligibility to live and work in South Africa is a prerequisite. Therefore, either citizenship, permanent residency or a valid visa/work permit should be in place already at the time of application.

KEY PERFORMANCE AREAS:

  • Oversee all facets of the programme’s activities across the various countries and, with the support of the programme team, lead on troubleshooting any issues that arise
  • Manage overall programme timelines to ensure that all deliverables are on track and are delivered on time
  • Serve as the primary contact point for country technical support staff as it relates to day-to-day activities
  • Liaise with the USAID AOR, where required and lead specific stakeholder outreach initiatives, dialogue, and other forms of engagement to understand key concerns and issues and inform the review and enhancement of project start-up and it's smooth running thereafter.
  • Support Programme Director in communicating with the various MOH officials
  • Champion and collate quality deliverables and manage the Programme Director's review and approval processes
  • Work closely with the technical team to extract, document and disseminate lessons from implementation and identify opportunities for improvement
  • Work with the Finance Officer to manage the grant budget and ensure financial control; ensure expense invoices and consultants are paid in a timeous manner as well as monthly grant reporting requirements are completed to a high standard.
  • Contribute to Genesis Analytics' strategic planning, work planning and budgeting processes.

HOW TO APPLY:

  • Our system is an easy tool to use with a maximum of 10 single-line fields to complete and 2 compulsory document uploads
  • Please follow the online application process on the career portal of the Genesis website
  • We use an automated applicant tracking system in order to receive and manage all applications in one central point, and for this reason, we also do not accept any e-mailed CVs or applications
  • Please note that your application will primarily be considered for this role. In the event that that are multiple roles that you are interested in, please submit your application as outlined on the opportunity description, as advertised roles each have their own pools of applications
  • Once you have applied via our career portal, you will receive a system-generated confirmation e-mail that your application was received
  • NOTE: Please be advised that uploaded documents/attachments cannot be bigger than 4MB in total, as the system will not accept your application if the uploaded documents exceed 4MB
  • Applications can only be made online – no other means of application will be accepted this is due to emails not being an application tracking system and data protection regulations.

DISCLAIMER:

  • Relevant previous experience is essential
  • Communication will be with short-listed candidates only - if you do not receive any feedback on your application within 3 weeks, please consider your application unsuccessful
  • Genesis Analytics reserves the right not to proceed with an appointment of any advertised role
  • All appointments will be made in line with Genesis Analytics’ Employment Equity Plan and Transformation Policies
  • All applications will be treated confidentially

display_title: Senior Specialist: Enterprise Sales Finance Business Partner
job_description:
Role Purpose

The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner is responsible for leading, managing, coordinating and developing the overall business plan associated with Sales Customer contracts in accordance with company policies, regulatory framework and applicable laws. The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner will be responsible to develop industry best practice principles across the company contract elements, from Sales, Service Delivery, Service Management, IT support, Finance and Governance/Legal. Acts as the primary contact between the potential partners, business unit, regulatory and legal, ensuring that all financial matters are addressed efficiently and promptly.

The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner must understand the business processes of all LTSA functional areas and execute such processes in order to meet Contractual Requirements. The finance business partner will be dealing with complex customised contracts that normally do not conform to normal standard contract terms of the organisation. Hence the Finance Business Partner is responsible to design and implement new processes within the organisation to achieve contract obligations and mitigate customer contractual risks. The Finance Business Partner will be exposed to high risks and severe pressure, that can severely impact the organisations financial results.

Finance business partner work alongside different business departments, providing financial information, tools, analysis and insight to executives, develop new processes, helping them make more informed decisions and driving business strategy. Their role is to provide 'real time' support and analysis, to be a trusted adviser and to add value that will assist in decision making

The Senior Specialist: Finance Business Partner must develop all risk management models associated with the contracts, to each cross-functional department within the organisation. The Senior Specialist: Finance Business and Commercial should have a full overview of the contract and related project requirements ensuring full business support on contract completion
Emphasis is also placed on ensuring and developing models on contract profitability, revenue and efficiency improvements. This role will focus on governance, compilation and analysis of contract performance and risks, operational performance and financial data.

Role Description

Business Partnering

Develop business engagement models in support of effective execution and planning of the Business Partner Revenue Forecasts across a specific operational division. Variance analysis including reviewing monthly results and providing detailed analysis and explanation for executive management, review and challenge actual performance, identifying key variances and suggesting potential opportunities and actions to rectify poor performance.

Implement business product management models in line with best practices that accurately reflects commercial, contractual and legal aspects in accordance with company policies. Strategic development based upon the review and analysis of financial information to identify key trends and areas for future improvement, challenging poor or exceptional performance in financial KPIs and advise on rectification actions. Develop and Implement effective commercial procedures, or initiating change, to ensure key operational, commercial and financial targets are delivered. Provision of decision support through modelling ‘what if’ scenarios, challenge assumptions and make recommendations on preferred outcomes. Provide ad-hoc analysis and insights on specific issues.

Financial Management, Accounting & Reporting

Ensure contract execution aligned with business cases, operational and financial targets to maximise revenue and margins.Manage cross functional operational efficiency based on business performance data and KPI’s. Establish relationships with the Sales Executives team ensuring quality and timeliness of processing and reporting. Establish compliance criteria and parameters for cross functional efficiency measurement. Support Sales Business with planning and development of Budget input associated with revised business plans. Manage the Sales Business units to ensure that deliverables remain within budgets and report the managed variances within contract structures.

Reporting and Business Analytics

Develop monthly reporting on BI Platforms, with re and integrate in LIT Reporting platforms. Ensures that Reporting and Analytics is developed in line with company objectives, and information can be access real time. Manage the budgeting process with Business Partner Chief the annual strategic capex budgeting requirements for LTSA for CPM submission. Monitor, track, report to Exco and group and provide feedback to business units of approved spend. (4+8,7+5). Provides accurate and timely reporting on all business financial reports in relation to projects with related scorecards for Exco.Develop and Implement Strategic alignment to the New Liquid Business Segments with the Chief Officers associated with EBU and CBU units.

Governance and Risk Management

Develop governance processes and structures aimed at sound and accurate execution of monthly obligations and operational requirements. Develop and Implement structures that will ensure QoS internally with business units. Develop cross functional financial business partner capability and alignment to achieve operational requirements for LIT.Develop and implement risk management structures across business units on account delivery and support teams.

Drive risk resolution and feedback loop as a key risk management function. Develop Budgets and Risk Management Models within the business areas associated with contracts and report Monthly to Exco where applicable. Manage cross functional business and contractual risks through LIT risk management policies.

Corporate Performance Enhancement

Implement constant improvement measures on current systems and procedures for internal efficiencies regarding monthly revenue forecasting. Maintains an Integrated Business Unit Reporting and provides accurate forecasting of Key Financial indicators. Acts proactively and thinks strategically, in anticipating organisational needs, recognising the wider business environment and dynamics. Recommends a range of suitable options from which to develop sustainable plans and objectives. Business Case methodology control and reports up to Group Level for all LTSA business Cases.


Role Requirements


Tertiary Qualifications in CPM, Legal and/or Business Management. NQF 7 Essential

B Com degree Essential

Professional accounting qualification Desirable

2 -3 Years Management experience Desirable

5 - 7 years Financial, business, commercial and FBP experience in the ICT sector Essential

All Appointments are subject to the Labour Legislation in the respective country.

Mid-level marketer with strong digital and social skills.
Looking for an individual who is ready to take that next step in their already well established career. You will need to have experience previously working with lifestyle/entertainment and aspirational brands. Understanding of influencer marketing and how to leverage added value (through partnerships, proposals etc- business minded). This environment is fast paced, often paired with events - so sometimes disorganised. Through your attitude and marketing efforts you are expected to ensure the association with the brand and it's offering support experiences that leave hosts and guests feeling positively memorable!
You will be driving the marketing activity for the business.
Expected to consider all channels but have expertise in content strategy (including curation, creation and coordination of content across media types).
Well versed in social media engagement with an ability to adapt respond
Aware of trends and able to respond and create material in a relevant way for the brand/business.
Generate awareness and drive interest continuously by ensuring the preparation and scheduling of compelling content across external communications.

Looking for someone (with):
Get the job one and done-right mentality
Not afraid to take the bull by the horns
Self motivated
Comfortable to chase feedback/approvals and response
Good with numbers, aptitude to oversee and manage relevant budgets (as related to spend/recons etc)
Four years’ + experience working in digital marketing/social media marketing
Open minded- happy to get involved
Happy to collaborate and brainstorm.
Takes initiative.
Strong command of the English language (good grammar and spelling, eye for detail.)
Open to receiving both feedback and criticism and move forward to correct/improve or apply the thinking and perspective shared in order to better consider the strategy/brand/line of thinking.

In this role:
Inform a marketing plan/execute on strategy that may have been developed
Create content- posts, content calendar creation and roll out
Basic (quality) copy
Demonstrate value to the business in allocating budget to images/shoots
Ability to ideate, come up with concepts and generate/inspire thinking.

Nice to have:
Simple videography and editing ability (work/brief with videographers and photographers when needed)

Experience:
Completed qualification in social media/Google/digital marketing (ideally also qualification in marketing/brand management)
Ideally completed Google AdWords certification (and experience working with AdWords)
Understanding of marketing strategy and ability to consider audiences
Understanding of relevance and selection of appropriate social media platforms for the relevant audience

Preferred expertise:
Proficient in Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook Business, TikTok etc
Ability to build awareness and influence
Understanding of influencers (micro and nano influencers)
Spontaneous events and partnerships (budget for established influencers thru attendance at event or brand/product collaboration)
Good knowledge of digital advertising – including but not limited to social, understanding of SEO and PPC
Advantageous: experience working with data and analytics (as related to social media efforts/campaigns)

Other areas of focus:
Key messaging and respect strat guidelines
Agency meetings - manage, feedback and monitor
Be at events, engage with clients (B2C and B2B)
Tastings
Consider/obtain client testimonials as well as internal testimonials/team member endorsements/success stories
Propose original/interesting ways of compiling these (video, audio, etc with graphics) and share on the appropriate platforms/channels.
Liaise/work with other agencies
Uphold the integrity of the brand and ensure all brand comms are in line with the CI.
Experience in managing comms and several communities/groups or pages on appropriate social media platforms
Highly resourceful – in gaining an understanding of the social media platform potential and restrictions.
Capture the creativity and craft of the business
Proven track record - two years’ experience in leading content efforts for a brand/business

Senior Software Engineer
Are you ready for the next step in your engineering career?
Do you enjoy coaching others to achieve high standards?
Join us in shaping a more just world.

display_title: DATA MIGRATION CONSULTANT – ROA – COMMERCIAL CE
job_description:
Role Purpose:

The Data Migration Consultant is an experienced data migration specialist with the ability to understand integration solutions and drive results for the company. This role will be based in our London office, working closely with the Head of Technology Development. The position requires a minimum of 5 years’ experience in an IT-related environment. be useful but not essential.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems or a related field required.
  • Experience in data migration/data modeling required.
  • Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL databases and other technologies such as Big Data and analytics is desired.
  • Experience developing data marts and ETL processes for multiple platforms.

Requirements

  • Responsible for the Data Mapping and Migration of the Customer Master into the Customer Experience Module (CE)
  • Must have experience in the Customer Experience Module as well as the Kingswaysoft application which is used to import the data via SSIS package into the Customer Experience module.
  • Experience in the Customer Master in F&O to understand the integration via the DualWrite interface.
  • Manage, facilitate, and drive the extraction criteria, data cleansing, object mapping, field mapping and value mapping for the ETL process.
  • Manage, facilitate, and drive the filling in of the templates by the Business for the Construct process Facilitate Issue resolution where there are load errors (Defects logged in DevOps)
  • Status reporting per functional area as and when needed.
  • Engage with business resources per stream to resolve data queries.

The Team:
S&P Global Market Intelligence’s Credit & Risk Solutions (C&RS) business unit powers credit and risk management workflows by bringing together cutting-edge analytics, differentiated data, technology and workflow solutions to help our customers stay ahead of the competition, pinpoint risk exposures and spot the right opportunities in an unpredictable market environment.

Our capabilities span Credit Ratings and Research from S&P Global Ratings; rating transition, default and recovery rate analytics; RiskGauge credit reports on >50m public and private companies; quantitative and expert judgment Probability of Default and Loss Given Default scoring models including specific areas/markets such as Climate.

We value partnership and collaborative teamwork as essential qualities to succeed in this role. We reward hard work, dedication, and self-starters and believe that no one part is more valuable than the sum of the whole; we need everyone to achieve our goals. As a high growth, highly successful Sales team we work global, multi-stakeholder deals with a wide range of companies who lead, innovate, and disrupt their respective industries.

The Role:
You will join a specialist sales team renowned for the strength and track record of its members. As a member of the Middle East and Africa C&RS sales organization, you will be responsible for driving new business sales opportunities across some/all of our capabilities in the Africa market while contributing to the overall performance of the region’s sales goal and other performance metrics.

Core Responsibilities:
Revenue Generation - Drive ambitious sales growth, meeting or exceeding your new business sales quota
Develop and nurture strong client relationships with the ‘C-Suite’ and Senior Managers within their organization (eg. Chief Executive Officers, Chief Financial Officers, Chief Risk/Credit Officers, Heads of Divisions & Business Units, etc)
Optimize revenue by prioritizing opportunities and engaging clients proactively through networking and methodical outreach campaigns, marketing strategies, account planning with Account Managers, etc
Develop industry specific knowledge necessary to have credible diagnostic conversations with clients
Develop a strong understanding of the value proposition for our offerings as it relates to your market and communicate clearly to deal team members (ie. Account managers, credit product specialists, product management, etc)
Represent and promote S&P Global core values
Contribute to the business strategy through a deep understanding of and keeping up to date with key industry news and events involving clients and prospects alike, macro/ market trends /regulations impacting local markets and keeping abreast of our competitive landscape
Provide timely and accurate pipeline updates and revenue forecasts and maintain opportunity pipelines, leads management and sales activity in Salesforce.com

Core Skills and Requirements:
You are a results-driven, sales professional with a strong understanding of the Investment workflow and comparative solutions – on the client side or in a Product or Commercial role for a market provider – who can actively seek out and engage prospects in Financial Institutions across the Asia Pacific region. We are looking for:
Minimum 10 years of direct new business sales experience in the institutional financial markets, preferably selling complex solutions in the Africa region. A comprehensive understanding of fixed income / credit markets gained via experience at financial institutions, asset managers or financial data / technology firms is highly desirable
A strong network of contacts in South Africa and Nigeria is highly preferable
Strong interpersonal communication skills, active listening, and confidence in delivering product demonstrations are essential
Interest in solving problems for clients through the delivery of financial solutions and analytical tools
Strong personal integrity and a confident and positive manner
Entrepreneurial mindset; demonstrates drive, initiative, energy, and sense of urgency
Work effectively in a team-based environment as well as independently
Must be fluent (Native level) in written and oral English
Desire and flexibility to learn and grow in an ever-changing environment
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. MBA/CFA/CMA/MAppFin is a plus

Flexible Working:
We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.

Return to Work:
Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return-to-Work initiative, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.

Grade /Level (relevant for internal applicants only): GL10

The Location: Johannesburg, South Africa

About Company Statement:
S&P Global Market Intelligence partners with customers to broaden their perspective and operate with confidence by bringing them leading data sources and technologies that embed insight in their daily work.

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com

-----------------------------------------------------------

Equal Opportunity Employer
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

Job ID: 289246
Posted On: 2023-07-04
Location: South Africa

Job Advert Summary

To assist the Head: Group Compliance in the execution of compliance duties and to proactively safeguard the Bank against any compliance risks by ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, including amongst others, Acts, regulations, policies and procedures.

Minimum Requirements

SKILLS/PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED

  • Relevant Bachelors degree.
  • An admitted Attorney and / or a Diploma in Compliance Management or related field will be an added
advantage.
  • At least 5 years’ relevant experience within the Financial Services Industry.
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in a management role.
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience/exposure in data analytics.
  • Proven and demonstrable success in developing compliance programs.
  • Experience in advising on matters in an organisation with a diverse range of business activities.
  • Ability to develop policies and procedures.
  • Planning and organising skills
  • Attention to detail.
  • Ability to work effectively within a team.
  • Ability to work under pressure.
  • Ability to work after hours if there is a need to do so for short periods.
  • Ability to build successful and long-lasting relationships with key stakeholders both internally and externally.
  • Possess soft skills to maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders long term.
  • Ability to take theoretical concepts and practically execute them.
  • Deciding and initiating action.
  • Entrepreneurial and commercial thinking

KEY COMPETENCIES REQUIRED

  • Comprehensive knowledge of relevant Acts and Regulations affecting the Financial Services Industry.
Knowledge of proposed new and / or amendments where applicable.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of key control assessment processes.
  • A strong knowledge and understanding of banking products, governance and control frameworks in the
financial services industry.
  • Strong analytical skills to analyse trends and typologies in data and make informed decisions on such trends
and typologies.
  • Ability to exercise oversight over the operational compliance areas.
  • Ability to identify weaknesses in the control environment and implement changes.
  • Management skills to successfully manage a team, if required to do so

Duties and Responsibilities

DESCRIPTION OF TASKS

  • Identify the Regulatory landscape for the Group. This requires thorough knowledge and understanding of the financial services regulatory landscape to sufficiently identify Acts and Regulations that impact the Group.
  • Proactively identify and assess proposed changes to new legislation or amendments to current legislation by
conduct an impact assessment of the proposed new or amended changes.
  • Draft governance documents. This requires the ability and proven experience in drafting documents, such as
Regulatory Universe, Coverage Plans, Policies, procedure manuals etc.
  • Apply a Risk Based Approach (where deemed appropriate). This requires the ability to proactively identify,
analyse and draft a RBA in certain instances and to sufficiently mitigate the RBA to be taken.
  • Provide information on request from competent authorities timeously and efficiently by engaging relevant
stakeholders for such information requested. Vetting information before submission to the relevant authorities.
Market Conduct:
  • To manage the Market Conduct portfolio for the Bank in ensuring compliance with various legislative
requirements.
  • Provide guidance to business on entrenching the Treating Customers Fairly (TCF) requirements into operational processes.
Ensuring that all Representatives and Key Individuals (KI’s) are suitably accredited and trained and meet the
requirements of the Financial Advisory and Intermediary Services (FAIS) Act.
Ensure that the Bank’s Complaints processes are entrenched and
  • Ensure that the Bank’s Complaints processes are entrenched and that all complaints are managed
appropriately by the business in line with TCF principles.
  • Ensure that appropriate reporting is done to various stakeholders and the Regulator.

Advice and Identification of Compliance Risks:

  • Provide advice to all divisions within the bank and raise awareness of the cost benefit of compliance, good
ethics and corporate governance.

Monitoring:

  • Conduct monitoring on the requirements of applicable Acts or Regulations. This requires a thorough
understanding of the procedures and processes relating to formal monitoring within the Group, including but
not limited to providing guidance and templates on scope, working papers, formal reports to be issued, etc.

Training:

  • Provide training for own staff and assist in drafting training material on applicable regulatory requirements.
  • Identify and provide training to high impact individuals or roles where necessary.

Data Analytics:

  • Proactively identify areas of concern where data analytics is required to address any shortfalls.

Projects:

  • Manage Compliance projects for the implementation of required systems for the Bank.
  • Conduct gap analysis, where appropriate, and manage the resolution of the gaps with relevant stakeholders.
  • Report on the progress made on compliance projects at relevant forums.

  • Ensure effective record keeping processes are maintained together with an audit trail to evidence all work
conducted which will serve as evidence for audits, inspections etc.

Customer Service:

  • Provide and contribute to effective stakeholder management.

  • Maintain external relationships to ensure compliance services meet the required service standards.

People Management

development and management of Key Performance Indicators in line with deliverables.
  • Develop talent by facilitating cross training, developing, coaching, mentoring and growing individuals and teams in the business units. Encourage career advancement endeavours.
  • Ensure that effective training and development practices exist and that continuous learning is fostered.

We are seeking a highly capable Materials Manager.

The incumbent will be responsible to head the warehouse and for the overall management of the daily operations of the warehouse within the business whilst effectively and efficiently ensuring that operational activities are executed on time and in accordance with the Service Level Agreement (SLA) conditions and that all administration is completed timeously and accurately.

Reporting to the Head of Supply Chain – the core functions of the Material’s Manager include managing inventory and purchasing procedures for raw materials and other supplies within the company. Collaborate with other managers to determine supply needs, purchase supplies and materials according to specifications and coordinate and supervise receiving procedures.

A tertiary qualification in Supply Chain or related is essential.

  • Previous Supply Chain Management experience having worked within a Manufacturing (FMCG), or related Industry is essential.
  • Experience in the use of an ERP system and/or WMS. Syspro would be an advantage.
  • Must understand process development and management.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Data management skills.
  • Relationship-building and interpersonal skills.
  • Creative thinking to help bring products to the market faster.
  • Technical ability, including a solid understanding of artificial intelligence, analytics software and innovations that can impact the supply chain.

Company Description


Job Description


Responsibilities

  • Drive client satisfaction by providing insights and actionable recommendations during reporting, presentations and business reviews and also by providing value-added analyses and response to special requests.
  • Build and maintain ongoing relationships with the identified key persons within client organization.

Additional Information


About NIQ

NIQ, the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, reveals new pathways to growth for retailers and consumer goods manufacturers. With operations in more than 100 countries, NIQ delivers the most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior through an advanced business intelligence platform with integrated predictive analytics. NIQ delivers the Full View.

NIQ was founded in 1923 and is an Advent International portfolio company. For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with the latest updates on our business and #LifeAtNIQ? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. Position Summary
We are looking for an experienced Merchandise Planner to work within our portfolio of well known international fashion brands and assist the business in expanding both channels and improving profitability.
The role will encompass both store and assortment planning for the retail channels; as well as working with the Brand/Sales Managers to support the wholesale business with demand planning. There is a strong focus on improving key performance metrics over time, where the successful candidate will play a pivotal role in ensuring that these objectives are met.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities
  • Preparation of seasonal sales and stock plans, encompassing unit projections, price inflation targeting, and product mix optimization.
  • Preparation of Seasonal analysis of each Brand in order to fully understand the performance down to the lowest SKU Level; and to use such analysis for Critical Forward Planning for each Brand.
  • Assisting with the compilation of annual sales budgets, with ongoing reforecasts at a store, category and product level to ensure achievability and to rebalance OTB commitments.
  • Management of the forward order pipeline with international vendors by ensuring OTB commitments are aligned to the budgeted sales plans and Principal Commercial Contracts.
  • Managing the critical path of each brand respectively, to optimise the relevant timelines and ensure key interventions are conducted on time.
  • Continual assessment of store performance and implementation of stock management techniques to keep the business aligned to key indicators; including but not limited to effective replenishment to maximise sales performance and market share.
  • Providing support to the Brand Manager/s and Head of Planning with the setting and maintenance of prices and margins across the range.
  • Compilation of regular management and operational reporting to bring visibility to business operations.
  • Working closely with the Brand and Purchasing & Customer Services Teams to formulate commercially practical ranges whilst providing and presenting data that supports informed decision making.
  • Working with and providing direction and/or guidance to the allocations team to replenish stock to stores to eliminate lost sales opportunities.
  • Work jointly with Store Operations to ensure grading/option plan is in line with space management (pre-season).
  • Ensure integration of ratio management in all merchandising activities.
  • Ensure that best practice is actioned for in-depth analysis to support buying commitment decisions for each Brand as appropriate.
  • Review and action fact-based category input and feedback for internal/external stakeholders.
  • Guide the Operational teams for best practice end-to-end in season management including management of best sellers and worst sellers, in season stock cover management, in season reactivity and sales to space management.
  • Provide guidance and strategy for execution of end of season stock management.
  • Oversee the optimal flow of merchandise including fulfilment of product/marketing introduction deadlines/capacity planning.
  • To work collaboratively with Marketing and Brand, Visual Merchandising (VM) and Store Operations.
  • To support the Business and Finance Teams when conducting Business Reviews for each of the Brands as appropriate.

Education and Experience Requirements
  • Essential: Matric
  • Desirable: Relevant business related tertiary qualification
  • Essential: Minimum 3 years relevant merchandise planning experience in a retail environment.

Core Competencies
  • Persuading and Influencing
  • Analysing
  • Deciding and initiating action
  • Planning and Organising
  • Entrepreneurial and commercial thinking
  • Presenting and Communicating Information

Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
  • Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
  • Negotiation skills
  • Communication skills
  • Commercial thinking
  • Presentation skills
  • Knowledge of IT systems and data analytics
  • Client account management
  • Knowledge of market trends and the retail landscape
  • Self – starter and manage own tasks and responsibilities

display_title: ESG Solutions Director, S&P Global Sustainable1Solutions
job_description:
The Role: ESG Solutions Director

Grade : 12

The Location: South Africa

Overview :
We have an exciting opportunity to join Sustainable1, the S&P Global team that promotes the sustainability solutions across data, analytics, reporting, indices, ratings, commodity benchmarking.

Based in South Africa you will be responsible for sustainability solutions success in Africa and supporting the wider region. You strive to be the thought leader for sustainability solutions and want to work with clients across investment management, banking, corporates, academics, regulators, and exchanges. You will be part of a very specialized, highly talented global team. S&P Global provides industry leading solutions for ESG and Climate Change analysis. The team aims to create powerful, positive societal change and help the world transition to a more sustainable, low carbon economy. You are a self starter with a desire to see the business grow and generate strong revenue growth.

Responsibilities:
Develop and execute on a plan to increase adoption of S&P Global ESG/Climate solutions across the region.
Collaborate with S&P Global divisions, Market Intelligence, Index, Ratings, Commodity Insights, Mobility, to deliver excellent client service and strong growth in sustainability solutions.
Develop and maintain Strategic Account Sustainability Plans, which are designed to summarize priority opportunities emerging from the evolving ESG/Climate context, client priorities and the portfolio of S&P Global sustainability solutions.
Represent the business at client meetings, effectively diagnosing their needs and conveying our value proposition, assisting with the integration of ESG/Climate data and research in their processes, support them in use of ESG/Climate data, tools, reports and indices, by answering technical questions.
Organise and represent S&P Global Sustainable1 at events, webinars and conferences, helping raise the visibility of S&P Global's industry leading Sustainability solutions
Educate internal teams and clients on the benefits of disclosure and integration of sustainability solutions in their processes, answer technical questions on ESG/Climate data and reports, sustainability indices, ratings and energy transition solutions.
Work with our marketing team to create and deliver regionally relevant thought leadership (white papers, speaking at events and presentations).
Write proposals; plan and prepare presentations

Basic Qualifications:
Extensive work experience
Understanding of ESG and the local and global sustainability trends, industry, industry groups, and regulation
Technical knowledge of ESG factors, such as Carbon Emissions, Physical Risk, ESG Scores
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including confidence presenting to large groups and at public forums
Ability to write compelling, articulate proposals for innovative solutions.
Excellent business acumen, good negotiation skills and persuasiveness
Personable, and enjoy networking and meeting new people
Self-motivated, self-starter and results oriented, with a positive, "can do" attitude
An insatiable appetite to learn product methodologies and the willingness to be a subject matter expert on key solutions
A sharp intellect, commercial acumen, creative approach to problem solving in a new and innovative industry and an entrepreneurial attitude are important.
Motivated by solution selling, strategic relationship building and meeting commercial objectives
Team player
Fluent written and spoken English, other local languages are bonus

Preferred Qualifications:
Understand how financial markets operate, with experience in banking.
Understand how financial institutions evaluate and incorporate ESG and climate issues in their decision-making and the organizations involved (e.g. NGFS, PCAF, TCFD, UNPRI)
Understand some of the following: portfolio carbon foot printing and accounting across asset classes, ESG risk and opportunity analysis by investors, TCFD reporting, use of environmental data for financial products (funds and indices), sustainability solutions for banking clients, green bonds.
Experience working on or servicing a responsible investment/ESG or sustainability team
Experience speaking and presenting to large groups of people and executive audiences
Ability to travel extensively to offsite meetings

About S&P Global Sustainable1:
S&P Global Sustainable1 is the central source for sustainably intelligence from S&P Global. Sustainable1 matches customers with the ESG products, insights and solutions from across S&P Global divisions to help meet their unique needs. Our comprehensive coverage across global markets combined with in-depth ESG intelligence provides financial institutions, corporations and governments an unmatched level of clarity and confidence to successfully navigate the transition to a sustainable future. Our data and well-informed point of view on critical topics like energy transition, climate resilience, positive impact and sustainable finance allow us to go deep on the details that define the big picture so customers can make decisions with conviction. To learn more about Sustainable1, visit www.spglobal.com/sustainable1 .

-----------------------------------------------------------

Equal Opportunity Employer
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

display_title: Deputy District Programme Head (Wits RHI) Gophelega Ekurhuleni
job_description:
Main purpose of the job:

  • Serve as Deputy to the District Programme Head
  • Provide oversight for the Gophelega program implementation at the District level
  • In collaboration with the District Programme Head, provide strategic leadership and direction to ensure technical, programmatic, compliance, and financial integrity of the Gophelega Programme and achieve program goals, objectives, and targets determined by the Wits RHI Leadership, District and Metropolitan Departments of Health, CDC and PEPFAR

Location:

  • Germiston – Ekurhuleni District

Key performance areas:

  • Support the development and implementation of Operation Phuthuma (OP) and facility improvement strategies within national and international guidelines
  • Ensure the program is technically sound, evidence-based, appropriate, and responsive to local needs
  • Provide leadership in the design, analysis, and synthesis of interventions and innovations
  • Ensure the quality and sustainability of interventions
  • Communicate the Wits RHI program strategy to all relevant stakeholders
  • Conduct program site visits and review project assessments to evaluate progress on OP and facility implementation plans
  • Directly manage Programme managers and lead meetings with specialist technical teams that include Retention, Psychosocial and Innovations, Differentiated Care Model, HIV Testing Services, and Maternal, Child, and Adolescent Health and other stakeholders
  • Support on-the-ground implementation of program evaluation projects and contribute to the publication and marketing of relevant evaluation projects
  • Ensure compliance with the CDC Gophelega Cooperative agreement and oversight of program activities to achieve stated targets and expected results
  • Support the annual work planning process in close collaboration with Technical Lead – HIV/TB Care and Treatment, District Programme Head, Gophelega Programme Head, Director – Health Programmes, CDC, District Department of Health, Metropolitan Municipality Departments of Health, and other program partners
  • Mentor and support a team of highly qualified staff and align their efforts to ensure rapid and sustainable results
  • Provide guidance, in collaboration with key staff to subcontractors and sub-grantees and coordinate activities with other agencies
  • Support the writing and/or review of technical components of materials and publications related to this program and its development
  • Ensure compliance with CDC operational policies and regulations
  • Work with the Technical Head: M&E, Analytics, and Date Decision-Making, Monitoring, and Evaluation (M&E) Lead and M&E staff to develop M&E frameworks and tools to track data/results effectively
  • Provide oversight and coordination to the compilation of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual, and ad hoc reports according to program requirements
  • Ensure timely responses to ad hoc requests from CDC
  • With the District Programme Head, ensure the programmatic and financial integrity of the program to achieve OP and facility improvement program goals, objectives, and targets
  • Ensure resources for program implementation are available
  • Work with finance and program staff to develop and track project budgets
  • Ensure timeous submission of financial/budget reports, via WHC Finance Staff
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships and alliances with USG, the National, Provincial, and District/Municipal DoH, and other key stakeholders to maximize resources and avoid duplication of effort
  • Coordinate program interventions with other USG and DOH-funded CBOs to ensure the maximal impact of interventions; Coordinate protocols and SLAs as required to ensure collaborative working
  • Represent Wits RHI’s interests and present progress, achievements, and lessons learned to key stakeholders, including CDC and partners in public and professional circles through meetings, conferences, and presentations
  • Advise national counterparts on technical issues and participate in relevant technical advisory groups with counterparts and partner institutions
  • Communicate with all levels of Wits RHI staff about inputs and outputs
  • Provide leadership and coordinate key Programme Staff and their activities; Provide coaching and support to ensure a cohesive and high-performing implementing team
  • Attend to all staffing requirements and administration
  • Supervise and manage the duties of subordinates to ensure optimal staff utilization and maintenance of sound labor relations
  • Set and review work plans
  • Perform and facilitate performance development and assessments
  • Identify substandard performance by team members and take necessary corrective action
  • Coach and train subordinates and team members to ensure the acquisition of knowledge and skills required by the organization
  • Promote harmony, teamwork, and sharing of information

Required minimum education and training:

  • Masters or Postgraduate Degree with experience in Public Health with specialist knowledge of HIV & TB; MBBCH or PhD

Required minimum work experience:

  • 5 years of management experience in HIV/TB-related district-level support programs or comparable

Desirable additional education, work experience, and personal abilities:

  • Demonstrated leadership, management, and change management abilities, including the ability to manage, coach, and motivate a diverse team
  • Demonstrated history of influencing positive change with external stakeholders and developing and maintaining relationships at all levels of host and partner organizations
  • Positive, energetic team leader with an ability to adapt to complex situations, manage stress, and deliver goals pro-actively
  • Organized with a thorough and accurate approach to work and attention to detail

Demands of the job:

  • Confidentiality, National and (potentially) international travel will be required from time to time
  • Must be contactable after working hours

Communications and relationships:

  • Maintain effective working relationships with Senior Management and Wits RHI staff at all levels
  • Communicate effectively with all external stakeholders including donors (CDC, PEPFAR), Department of Health (DoH), District and Municipality Health staff, media, medical and academic institutions, community and other partner organizations

TO APPLY:

  • Only if you do meet the minimum job requirements and experience as mentioned above, you may submit a detailed updated CV.
  • Please Apply Online.
  • Please take note that the applicants who do not adhere to the above criteria will not be considered for the respective position.
  • The closing date for all applications: 06 July 2023.
  • Note AJ Personnel is fully POPI compliant.
  • Note WHC, in accordance with their Employment Equity goals and plan, will give preference to suitable applicants from designated groups as defined in the Employment Equity Act 55 of 1998 and subsequent amendments thereto.

Please note:

  • AJ PERSONNEL is only responsible for the advertising of the advertisement on behalf of their client Wits Health Consortium.
  • Wits Health Consortium will only respond to shortlisted candidates.
  • Candidates who have not been contacted within two weeks of the closing date can consider their applications to be unsuccessful.
  • AJ Personnel does not have any salary or other information regarding the position.

Hybrid role (2office 3 home)

This person, in conjuction with the Health Informatics team at a Corporate level, Assist with the identification and procurement of an Electronic Health Records (EHR) system, as well as other IT related clinical applications, that meet the nursing end user as well as company clinical and patient care needs, within ICU

QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCE

  • Informatics experience with clinical information system implementation, support and optimisation

  • Experience in healthcare management
  • Registered/Professional Nursing qualification

﻿﻿JOB SKILLS

  • Clinical data analytics and reporting
  • Clinical governance and risk management
  • Data governance, standards and regulations affecting the practice of nursing
  • Health care information management
  • In-depth knowledge of ICU nursing and health care practices, clinical workflow, terminology and standards
  • IT Infrastructure components and integration standards
  • Knowledge of health information systems and other IT applications in support of clinical and business decisions

  • Research, report writing and presenting
  • Systems thinking with understanding of the interactions and inter-dependencies of business information and events on the operational level
  • Training and facilitation methodologies

Job Description

Our client based in Kyalami is seeking to employ a Demand Planner to do the following:


Supports the Demand Planning Manager and Brands to develop the consensus forecast for the brands based on statistical forecast and sales & marketing activities such as promotions (GWP, local sets) and new product launches;


  • Develops the SKU & aggregate forecast based on the in-market intelligence from the multifunctional teams (e.g. incorporating latest promotion plans, in-market performance of the new launches, competitive activities, macro market trends, customers’ plans, trade inventory etc.);


  • Collaborates with Affiliate Inventory Managers and brand & sales team to manage and shape demand especially during extended out of stocks situations;


  • Maintains the Demand Planning Attributes & Master data such as Characteristics Value Combinations (CVCs), Product lifecycle (PLC’s), Demand Type (DT), Strategic Indicator (SI), and History Start Date (HSD);


  • Conduct New Product pre & post launch analysis with brands and regional demand planning team and recommend actions for future launches based on historical insights (pipeline, sell-in velocity, cannibalization, execution excellence);


  • Leads the pre(Branded) SIOP meetings focusing on demand trends insights, building blocks assumptions, and share scenarios planning based on risks & opportunity assessments;


  • Leads the Demand Review section as part of the monthly SIOP meetings, focusing the team on key trends insights and focus the team’s energy on strategic areas which makes the biggest impact to the business (e.g. key assumptions which assumptions went right/wrong, key demand drivers insights, cannibalization learnings for reapplication, key building blocks assumptions); and


  • Conduct forecast analytics and share analysis insights and recommendations.


  • Generate, analyze and communicate key reports and data throughout the region in line with regional strategy and local requirements.


Skill Requirements / Personal Competencies

  • Knowledge of supply chain management concepts, i.e. Plan, Source, Make, Deliver and Return
  • Strong analytical and problem solving abilities
  • Proactive and a team player
  • Continuously look for forecast accuracy improvement opportunities
  • Critical thinking skills to identify where analysis is required & then do it
  • Ability to work in a dynamic, pressurised environment
  • Experience with Microsoft Office with strong experience in Excel (Advanced) and PowerPoint (Basic)
  • Experience in and/or exposure to S&OP processes and procedures
  • Excellent communication skills - both formal and informal
  • Ability to communicate within all levels of the organisation
  • Strong meeting facilitation skills
  • Strong negotiating skills
  • Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques


Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field
  • SAP/ERP knowledge, APO would be advantageous
  • Demand Planning systems knowledge
  • 3 to 5 years planning experience
  • APICS or other forecasting certification preferred

Key purpose:

To contribute to the design and development of new applications / systems to meet the business requirements of the Data and Analytics (D&A) environment.

To analyse business or system requirements and data to enhance understanding of the D&A environment.

To participate in and provide input to the Architect during the compilation of solution design documentation for new and existing D&A products and systems.

﻿Qualifications and experience:

  • A relevant tertiary qualification in Information Technology or Data Analysis
  • A relevant tertiary qualification in Information Technology - Computer Science or Data Analysis
  • IT systems development processes (SDLC)
  • Application development
  • ETL processes
  • Rational database system and cloud data warehousing
  • Dimensional modelling
  • Standards and governance
  • Agile development life cycle

  • Banking systems environment
  • Banking business model
  • Best practices for Quality Assurance (QA)
  • At least 6 years proven experience within management information systems / systems analysis together with a relevant 3 year tertiary qualification
  • At least 6 - 8 years proven experience within management information systems / system analysis
  • Proven experience in:
  • SQL Server and / or business intelligence tools (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS)
  • Data Warehousing
  • Data Management Lifecycle
  • Proven experience in:
  • Python and/or Open Source development tools
  • Visualisation Technologies: MS PowerBI, AWS QuickSight
  • Cloud Environment
  • Experience working in an AWS environment as well as with AWS Technologies
  • Participation in PBT Graduate Programme / Training / Skills Development, PBT Academy, e.g. Data Engineering, BI Business Analysis, Data Modelling
  • Clear criminal and credit record

﻿Required skills:


  • Analytical Skills
  • Communications Skills
  • Computer Literacy (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook)
  • Interpersonal & Relationship management Skills
  • Problem solving skills

Experience:

A hands-on Solution Architect who knows how to develop, design, and maintain technologies that work for our clients. You are a next-generation thinker when it comes to what we call Data in the New. Your superpower? Using the latest data and analytics technologies to help clients glean the most value from their data. And you know how to come up with strategies, solutions, and processes for managing enterprise-wide data throughout the data life cycle. You’re a digital native who’s right at home when the challenge calls for teamwork and originality.

The work:

- Defining the policies & standards for cloud native data management for structured, semi- and unstructured data use

  • Popular Cloud Platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP)

  • Data Quality Rules & KPIs
  • Automated Data Cleansing (e.g. use of AI / ML)
  • Compliance Rules & KPIs
  • Data democratisation
  • Data security
  • Compliance & security policies for data access, use & integration

  • A minimum of 7+ years of working as a Data Governance consultant or directly with clients leveraging popular tools like Informatica, Collibra, IBM, ASG etc.

  • A minimum of 7 years in a role that discovered captures the current state of the system, encompassing processes such as data discovery, profiling, inventories.
  • A minimum of 7 years in a role that defined processes include data classification, business glossary creation and business rule definition.
  • A minimum of 7 years in a role that applied processes with aim to operationalize and ensure compliance with policies and include automating rules, workflows, collaboration etc.

Bonus Points if:

  • Experience in a role that led measurement and monitoring to determine the value generated and include impact analysis, data lineage, proactive monitoring, operational dashboards and business value.

  • Data Architecture Estimation

We are looking for a highly capable machine learning engineer to develop self-running AI software to automate predictive models for recommended financial processes, digital transformation initiatives, across digital assets, RPA solutions, virtual assistants, chatbots and optimize our machine learning systems.

The candidate will be designing and evaluating existing machine learning (ML) processes, performing statistical analysis to resolve data set problems, applying algorithms to enhance the accuracy of our internal and client’s digital assets from predictive, prescriptive, adaptive to autonomous capabilities, helping us create artificial intelligent and autonomous digital ready products/solutions.

The ultimate goal for the candidate will be to shape and build efficient self-learning digital apps, demonstrate solid data science knowledge and experience in creating machine learning models and retraining systems, showing exceptional skills in statistics and programming.

The person will be reporting to the senior manager and also support and delivery of digital transformation projects within the business and clients. Working closely with our Business Transformation Team and Information Technology Operations delivery teams to successfully deploy machine learning models/projects for the company and its clients.


Responsibilities:

  • Consulting with senior managers/managers and business executives to determine and refine machine learning objectives.
  • Designing machine learning systems and autonomous artificial intelligence (AI) software to automate predictive models.
  • Transforming data science prototypes and applying appropriate ML algorithms and tools.
  • Ensuring that algorithms generate accurate user recommendations.
  • Solving complex problems with multi-layered data sets, as well as optimizing existing machine learning libraries and frameworks.
  • Developing ML algorithms to analyse huge volumes of historical data to make predictions.
  • Running tests, performing statistical analysis, and interpreting test results.
  • Documenting machine learning processes.
  • Keeping abreast of developments in machine learning, research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
  • Develop machine learning applications according to requirements
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Run machine learning tests and experiments
  • Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
  • Train and retrain systems, when necessary, extend existing ML libraries and frameworks

Requirements and skills:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
  • Master’s degree in computational linguistics, data analytics, or similar will be advantageous.

  • At least 2-3 years' proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
  • The candidate should have previous consulting background interacting with clients and stakeholders.
  • Understanding of data structures, data modelling and software architecture
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
  • Ability to use and write robust code in Python, SQL, SAS and R including Java, Docker, GitHub, PowerBi, Tableau, GGPlot2, Plumber & Swagger REST APIs etc
  • Extensive knowledge and familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch, H2o, MLFlow, Tidymodels, etc ) and libraries (like scikit-learn, Tidyr, Tidyverse, Shiny etc)
  • Superb analytical and problem-solving abilities, great communication and collaboration skills.
  • Excellent time management and organizational abilities.

Company Description
-De Beers is a member of the Anglo American plc group. Established in 1888, De Beers is the world’s leading diamond company with unrivalled expertise in the exploration, mining and marketing of diamonds. Together with its joint venture partners, De Beers employs more than 20,000 people across the diamond pipeline, and is the world’s largest diamond producer, by value, with mining operations in Botswana, Canada, Namibia and South Africa. As part of the company’s operating philosophy, the people of De Beers are committed to Living up to Diamonds by making a lasting contribution to the communities in which they live and work, and transforming natural resources into shared national wealth. For further information about De Beers visit www.debeersgroup.com .

ABOUT DE BEERS MARINE:

De Beers Marine (DBM) is based in Cape Town, South Africa and is part of the De Beers group. Activities managed include Marine exploration, geophysical surveys, sampling, mining, ship conversion, upgrades and maintenance, large project management, engineering design and mining system equipment builds. DBM executes world leading R&D in marine mining practices resulting in the most successful and advanced marine mining equipment and operations globally.


Job Description
-The incumbent will be involved in all project functions and activities associated with cost engineering/control, project accounting, financial control, change management, planning, scheduling, estimating and reporting.

Focus Areas

  • Project Cost control, monitoring and reporting.
  • Establishment, update and implementation of project cost management procedures.
  • Preparation of Project documentation for Assurance reviews including Management plans associated with Cost management.
  • Project cost estimation and cost estimate structuring in alignment with project planning.
  • Establishment and drafting of project basis of estimates.
  • Cash flow management and forecasting.
  • Identification of cost and/or schedule related risks and opportunities and general Risk Management support.
  • Coordinate, manage and report on Change Management Process.
  • Team time / cost management.
  • Alignment of project cost management system to the DBM ERP (SAP).
  • Project financial Close-Outs.

SKILLS/PERSONAL COMPETENCIES:

  • Strong analytical ability, action orientated with a strong attention to detail.
  • The ability to communicate effectively at all levels, including excellent written and verbal communication.
  • Ability to work flexibly, independently and in a team.
  • Work well under pressure.
  • Customer focus, ensuring that their needs are a primary focus and developing sustainable relationships.
  • Information and data interpretation and reporting.
  • Problem solving and organizational capabilities

  • Qualifications
    -Degree in either Quantity Surveying, Engineering, Accountancy or Commercial with 8 Years working experience, and a minimum of 2 years project cost control experience within a mining, construction or similar field.
  • Good knowledge and experience of IFRS, SAP (or similar ERP systems) and Project Cost Management Systems (Preferably Prism, but other Cost Management System experience would still be advantageous).
  • Highly skilled in the Microsoft Office suite.

Additional Information
-Who We Are: De Beers Group

Established in 1888, De Beers Group is the world’s leading diamond company with unrivalled expertise in the exploration, mining, sorting, valuing, selling and marketing of diamonds. Together with our joint venture partners, we operate in more than 20 countries across six continents.

We want our diamonds, and our business, to make life brilliant – for our people, our customers and the world around us.

We build partnerships and connect with our people and their communities to make a positive contribution to the wider world. We’re constantly developing new ways to make an impact and build a beneficial legacy. We call it ‘Building Forever’ - it’s fundamental to our pioneering spirit and the purposeful way we do business.

What we offer

When you join De Beers, you can expect to enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package. But more than this, you’ll find yourself in an environment where the opportunities for learning and growth are second to none. From technical training to leadership programmes, we bring out the best in our people. There are plenty of opportunities to move onwards and upwards too. We’re a large, successful multinational company – and we’re still growing all the time.

Safety

Safety first is a way of life for us. We are unconditional about the safety, health and well-being of our colleagues, at work and at home, and about that of the communities where we work. We aim to lead the industry by investing in innovation to protect people, who are at the heart of our business. Our high performing teams take accountability for their own and others' actions, work collaboratively, and always show care and respect .

Inclusion & Diversity

We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are. We provide equality of opportunity to enable everyone to fulfil their potential.

Background Checks

Successful candidates will be required to complete background screening which may include a criminal check and validation of qualifications.

How we are committed to your safety

Nothing is more important to us than ensuring you return home safely after a day’s work. To make that happen, we have the most rigorous safety standards in the industry. Not only that, we’re also continually investing in new technologies – from drones to data analytics – that are helping to make mining safer

Closing date: 07 July 2023

Digital E-Commerce Manager Retail
Johannesburg North, Johannesburg - Gauteng - South Africa
An excellent career opportunity awaits you in the luxury retail brand sector. Our client, a renowned retail brand, is searching for a professional with experience in digital marketing to transform and optimize their eCommerce website for superior customer journeys. We're looking for a forward-thinking professional, passionate about creating a seamless, user-friendly online shopping experience.
You will bring a minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience in a Digital Marketing Agency or a dedicated Digital marketing team within the Retail Branding sector. Your professional skills should encompass technical proficiency with eCommerce platforms such as Shopify, Payment Gateways, Google Analytics, and Everlytic. A successful track record of driving results across a broad spectrum of digital channels, including SEO, Display Social, Email, and Paid Media is a must-have.
In this role, you'll take charge of various eCommerce operations, including daily online shop management, product data management, and eCommerce stock management. You'll also be responsible for updating the website content and collaborating with the Marketing Manager to devise strategies that ensure profitability and meet sales targets.
Additionally, you'll work alongside our social and digital marketer and other team members to boost traffic, plan promotions, and increase revenue. Designing monthly reports on e-commerce metrics, handling customer queries, and liaising with third-party service providers will also fall under your remit.
You will oversee sales and stock on additional digital wholesale channels and manage the external ad agency regarding budget spend and campaign work. Moreover, you'll collaborate with the graphic designer to plan and create biweekly newsletters, proofread marketing content, and create content for the website and newsletters.
